The food overall wasn't great. No one LOVED what they got. We found the chips to be greasy and the salsa just off. I did like my tamales, but wasn't blown away. I really feel if we had gotten to sit outside our experience would have been better, but really the food is mediocre at best. There are plenty of good mexican restaurants in the valley, I will opt for one of them next time.

Yuck! We used to go to El Encanto all of the time but the last two times we had horrible food and was warm at best. My beef burro enchilada style was stuffed with more salsa than beef and there wasn't any melted cheese on top of the enchilada sauce. My daughter's Mahi-Mahi was so disgusting that she took one taste and left the rest. (Thank goodness for their chips and salsa; that was the only token star given). I will never go there again since it seems that this restaurant has continued to disappoint us.

This place had excellent Mexican food!!! The atmosphere is wonderful! The outside ponds with the ducks is really neat. This is a fun place to bring your kids as well. It's very casual. The enchiladas were excellent!! If you like Mexican food you must try this place. If you have out of town guest you just take them here, be sure to make reservations because this place stays packed!

Horrible service. Seating people out of turn. Not willing to accommodate a party of 7. I would avoid this place as the staffs unwillingness to give good customer service is an indication of the quality of food.

So this place has above average Mexican food, and great atmosphere.  Who could not love watching the ducks and turtles. Sometimes they have a live Mexican band as well. The food. Its pretty good. Maybe not the absolute best in Phoenix but definitely the best in Cave Creek. Food generally was good. And prices, pretty reasonable for Cave Creek or Phoenix for that matter. I definitely will go back and bring visitors.

We went to El Encanto on our first night in Cave Creek.  It was within walking distance of the resort at which we were staying.    The outside wall hides the beauty inside.  We were amazed at the ambiance hidden behind the concrete walls surrounding the restaurant.  There's covered indoor and outdoor seating around a huge pond.  You would never know you were in the middle of the desert.  Even inside (in the air-conditioning), we felt like we were outside, sitting along the pond with only a big glass window separating us!    The fresh salsa (3 kinds!) and chips that they bring you were delicious.  Nobody wanted the two spicy salsas, so I had them all to myself.  Mmm...    For my entree, I (and so did two others at my table) tried the Enchiladas de Pollo con Mole (Chicken Enchiladas with Mole sauce).  Everyone agreed:  the mole sauce was AMAZING.  It was the best I've EVER tasted.  It was so full of flavor that other mole sauces have, apparently, been lacking.  Now, no mole sauce that I ever eat in the future will be able to stand up against this one.  Sigh...    My one negative comment would be that I was a bit put off by the server's rudeness (or perhaps, lack of interest).  He seemed to do the bare minimum and nothing else.  When I asked him what the dinner specials were, he replied, "I don't know."  Well, okay...   What he *should* have said was that it was only 4:30 (we got there early because we just flew in and were still on East Coast time) so their dinner specials didn't start until 5:00 and the chefs and/or management hadn't informed the wait staff yet.  The food and atmosphere were so perfect, though, that I can't even slight the restaurant's ratings for his lameness.
Unique ambiance - you can feed the ducks! I thought the food was pretty in line with Mexican food restaurants. My extended family enjoy going to this place as they live nearby.
After we ate there my husband ended up at Mayos ER with confirmed food poisoning!! Ugg!!!

A co-worker suggested we visit this restaurant while in Arizona.  I can see why they make it a point to go whenever they are in town.  We sat inside but enjoyed a view of the pond and ducks.  My margarita was a little on the weak side but still tasty.  My fajita was very good, especially the black beans.

I like the setting with the pond and ducks and all but the food wasn't spectacular. Nothing really stood out. I ordered a pitcher of margaritas that cost 25$ and was half filled with ice which was a turn off. Service was good and the happy hour is ok with buckets of 6 8oz coronas for 5$.  I am not sure I would chose to sit on the patio where all the ducks and birds fly around dropping poo but you can sit inside and still have a good view if you pick a window seat. They had some live guitar music out side which was a nice touch. I might go back for happy hour but would probably go elsewhere for food.

I've lived in cave creek for 15 years and El Encanto  used to be a restaurant we are at weekly. I've seen the restaurant change over the last few years. El Encanto has always been slow service wise. Tonight was the first time we came for dinner in a few years with a large party and over an hour wait to be seated. Sorry your pollo fundido isn't good enough to make up for the horrible service. Highly disappointed.
Fantastic atmosphere,  good drinks,  and fajitas were awesome.  Pollo fundido was dry (two of us ordered it and didn't like it). Chips and salsa are a highlight!

El Encanto is a fun spot to take a out of town guest. It's located in the small cowboy town of Cave Creek. Upon entering the restaurant you are greeted by large ducks frolicking in the central man made pond.  The food and service is decent. I love their margaritas and always order the pollo fundido. Cream cheese and chicken nestled in a deep fried tortilla topped with more cream cheese sauce.  By the way, this place is huge, it seems like every corner you turn they have slapped in an additional dining room. Also, if the weather is decent I recommend sitting al fresco.

Visited El Encanto with some friends for lunch the first time last week.  The restaurant has a great atmosphere.  We sat inside with a view of the pond and the ducks.  The service was good and the food above average.    The green salsa is fantastic with a wonderful flavor.  The chips are fresh and they are happy to refill as you request.  I ordered the carnitas which were terrific.  Others at the table had the carne asada, the fajitas and the pollo fundido.  Good reviews on the food from everyone.  Portions were generous and we all left with no room for dessert.  Great place for lunch or dinner.  The restaurant has a nice feel and  you certainly won't leave hungry.

This has been one of our favorite places to eat for many years! Once again, our entire family, 12, had a fantastic time. Also, Eric a manager there helped make my sons birthday very special by making a reservation for our group on a Saturday night, for the next day at noon!! Our 4 Grandchildren loved the beautiful pond with all the turtles and ducks, which also kept them entertained!! You will never be disappointed eating this delicious, authentic food!!

El Encanto is such a fun place to be! We come very often!They have an amazing pond filled with ducks and turtles, and it's such a big place! The food is awesome as well. 3 different types of salads and their frozen margaritas are AMAZING! People complain about long wait times in their reviews, but it's a busy restaurant in the heart of Cave Creek, and a long wait should be expected! Definitely worth the wait when you order the Carne Asada Relleno or the Pollo Fundido! The staff is also so friendly and knowledgeable of all the menu items! Great service!

LOVE LOVE LOVE EL ENCANTO!!!  Authentic Mexican restaurant located in North Phoenix (Cave Creek).  Awesome food, excellent sevice and a great atmosphere all come together for a wonderful dining experience!  If you are in the area it is worth the trip!  Cheers!

Food OK just average. Friends ordered Pollo Fundido & enjoyed it, but our Chicken Fajitas and Carnitas Burrito were DRY and not so flavorful. Waitress was friendly and attentive. Bartenders needed to pay better attention ... gave our drinks to another couple next to us and didn't even realize the mistake until we pointed it out. LAME!  Nice atmosphere on patio.   Very large restaurant and we heard manager on the phone calling servers to come in to work,  so service could get spotty.  Plenty of other places with better food and service, though perhaps you'll have to travel outside Cave Creek to find them.  We might come back here but only after trying the other restaurants in the area first.

Traveled to Scottsdale/Phoenix for business.  Asked for a great local place for mexican food and our host took us out to Cave Creek.    By far the best mexican Ifood  have had in a very long time.  The menu had a great variety, and out of my party of three we all had very different but equally tasty dishes.  I have to say..it was the best guacamole I have ever had.  Ever.    The only thing that could have made it better was an ice cold cerveza.. but alas.. it was a business trip and only lunch.    The only knock I have was the wildlife.  Although the birds, geese and ducks are nice and fun, the big goose poop on my bosses chair- although funny was slightly uncalled for.  I will be back to this gem during my next trip to Scottsdale.  I will of course ensure I add some cold beer and tasty tequila on the next stopover.

OK....  I wanted to like this place.  cool location, building, courtyard.  But the service was lacking and the food was not what we were expecting.   This is run of the mill Mexican food. Nothing more. Salsas were average.  Our table was dirty and the floor was also dirty.  The Fajitas were ok...  just lacking flavor and love.  Its a place you may want to try but I did not like it...  Its ok.

Ambience 4 Service speed 2 Food 5  I would love to return and be able to enjoy some more of the great dishes here when I have extra time to wait for the sluggish service.  It may have been due to the fact that there was a special event taking place in Butterfly Wonderland/Odysea Aquarium and they weren't prepared for extra diners.  I enjoyed the wonderful meal, the service, not so much.

If you ever go here, make sure and get the Pollo Fundido!!!  The best ever!!  And make sure and get the FROZEN margaritas, NOT the regular margaritas, because they are way stronger than the regular.  I love this place and would highly recommend it for a date, or a night out with some of your friends.
Took 15 mins just to be acknowledged. Then waited another 25 mins to be seated. Food took almost 40 mins to be brought to the table. Food is good, nice variety, a bit pricey though.
Every time I am in town; I visit here with my family. They're great to accommodate large groups and are very patient. The service, food quality and ambiance is what brings me back every time.

My wife and I have been eating there for over 20 years. Great service and great food. Love their salsa. A nice getaway in summer to sit outside under their misters. They have heaters outside unless its really cold in winter.   We just ate there yesterday and I am ready to go back soon...

The Complete Lowdown: El Encanto Edition.   I live five minutes away and have been here countless times. Here is what you need to know:   -Ambiance: spectacular. El Encanto has a large outdoor and indoor seating arrangement decorated with authentic Mexican titles and trinkets. It is quite lovely and makes you feel as if you are in a Mexican village. For the full experience, I recommend sitting outside next to the pond or on the strip of indoor seating that has windows to view the pond. That way, you will get the opportunity to be enchanted by the pond creatures (adorable turtles and ducks) and to be entertained by the children feeding them. You will also be touched by the warming and relaxing sunshine overhead--glorious.  -Busy: Be aware and warned--weekends are busy. You may have to wait 30 minutes for a table and scrounge for parking, but it is all part of the fun, excitement, and liveliness of the experience. Grab a margarita at the bar to enjoy the wait!   -Food: every table is served chips and three sauces to start--all of which are very tasty. There is a standard red sauce, spicy chipotle sauce, and a green tomatillo sauce. Try the queso Guillermo for a starter--it is delicious. Being a health freak, I normally order the fresco salad or fish tacos. They are quite tasty but nothing mind blowing or fancy. If I am feeling indulgent, I go for the small portion of the cheese enchilada which comes with rice and beans. I recommend it.   -One word: Margaritas! I have tried nearly every flavor and would have to recommend the original, mango, or raspberry. You will not be disappointed. Just remember, they are strong so I would advise not having more than two--drive safely and responsibly!   -Service: I have experience the good, the bad, and the ugly. I would say 75% of the time the service is friendly and reliable. However, the more less than positive occasions I have been waited on by slow and standoffish servers.   All in all, I come here for the ambiance, margaritas, and convenience. It only gets better the more you come due to its charming and appealing qualities. There's no denying--me encanata El Encanto! It is truly a special place.

Sorry I went to Dos. The salsa was terrible , chili paste or Las Palmas red chili salsa with nothing added tasted like the spicy one. Regular salsa no flavor and the tomatillo one bland. Chimichanga was a burrito, mushy and brownish sauce, NOT red sauce. Rice was dry and flavorless . I've heard the one in Cave Creek went downhill too. A guest arriving this week and I think I'll skip El Encanto for CC Smokehouse where we are guaranteed great brisket, everything ! It's a shame what you've done to my favorite Mexican Restaurant , sad. If you have to raise the already not cheap prices to hire new chefs, cleaning staff, etc do it. It'd be worth it. I'd rather pay a bit more than eat the sub par food on dirty tables and filthy menus. What have you done?!

Not sure if the heat we were feeling at breakfast was due to the near 100 degree weather at 9am or the spicy Huevos Rancheros from very unique El Encanto Mexican restaurant.  Yes its hot out but that shouldn't stop you from heading up to Cave Creek and giving this restaurant a try. For those not brave enough (or smarter than I am) to handle the AZ heat (especially during the summer months) you can sit inside. If you do dine inside, make sure, especially if you have kids, to get a window seat by the pond to see the ducks, turtles, occasional fish and on our last visit an owl.  We decided to sit outside as we got there early enough before it starting getting too hot outside (misters were on so that made it very comfortable) and enjoyed the live music on the patio. The rustic Mexican furniture fits the theme perfectly with Mexican blankets as seat cushions. The guitar player was really good and my 2 daughters definitely enjoyed the entertainment.  Until 11am on Sundays (not sure if this is always the case so make sure you give them a call before you head in) they have a great brunch to try out some of their menu items. I don't believe you can order off the normal menu during brunch but many of their top items are available during brunch so you should be happy either way. The Pollo Fundido is awesome as well as the Huevos Rancheros.  Everything we have tried so far has been delicious.  Can you tell I am a fan?    As my 5 year old daughter who is a big fan of Mexican food likes to say after she finishes up her breakfast and gets to feed the ducks, "this is the best place eveeeeer!"  If you are up for a fun experience and great Mexican food give El Encanto a try. You won't be disappointed.

I met a group of friends at El Encanto for dinner and it was a lovely evening.  I enjoyed the ride up (about 30 minutes for me), you leave the hustle and bustle of Scottsdale and just drive.  It was late afternoon so the sun was kind of low.    El Encanto is rather large with an indoor and outdoor seating area.  My friends were already there when I arrived but I sat down and ordered a drink that was not only very good, but on the table within two minutes.  I chose the cheese enchiladas, which were really really good.  They stuff them full of cheese and onions, which I find is rare.  Most places use a meager amount of cheese but these were oozing (in fact there was cheese over everything on my plate! Yum!) and were drowning in enchilada sauce.  Just the way I like them!  Everyone enjoyed their meals which included shrimp tacos and a bean burrito.    I will definitely be returning with my husband.  I enjoyed the atmosphere outside, the service was quick (we were only there an hour) and the food was fantastic.

I have been searching for many years for a chile relleno as yummy as my dad makes...and finally found it here! Their food is not nearly as spicy as I prefer, but it was delicious!   The chips & salsa were fresh & flavorful, and my prickly pear margarita on the rocks was made with real juice (not syrup!). Their beer selection was a bit disappointing.   The atmosphere is beautiful & relaxing, and refreshingly quiet, considering it's right in the middle of a tourist area. Lots of parking in the back & easy to walk to the nearby shops.   Can't wait to come back to AZ & try ALL of their locations :)
The food was meh. Service was meh. Margarita was awful. Chips were overdone. Won't be back. Ever.

At last wonderful Mexican food in Arizona... you would have thought that would be easy to find. A friend recommended this place and we were not disappointed in the least, The Chicken Mole was wonderful best I've had in years just a hint sweet and not flame thrower spicy. Loved the hot salsa provided which was really not very hot at all but had the great grilled tomato and pepper flavor. Also of note was the flan... our waiter was surprised we wanted dessert! of course. It was just right not thin but fully bodied with real camel flavor and density. We will be back... oh yes it was also a lot of fun to watch the turtles try to climb onto the rock ledges for the sun shine. Highly recommend.
Have been going here for many years. We love the atmosphere and we always have terrific service. The food is Great. Wonderful place to bring friends and family. Can't say enough ole

Awesome, relaxing eatery. Beautiful ambiance. Today I had the special: a beef burrito with green verde sauce. Delicious!! The best part of the experience was our waiter, Rashaad (aka Superman:). He was so friendly and positive. Made our lunch a great experience!!!

We came here for my husbands bday.  We were too late for reservations, but came early to get a table for 20 people.  We waited at the bar and the bar keeps and patrons were so much fun.  Food was great too. I had chile rello de pollo. Not fried at all! And frozen margarita was good too.  Best Mexican food in the area for sure.

We have been going to El Encanto for years. The drive out to Cave Creek is an easy escape from the city to find excellent food in a wonderful setting. At El Encanto it's not hard to imagine you are a thousand miles away. My wife and I celebrated our 30th anniversary there recently and the staff went out of their way to accommodate our special requests. Food was great as usual and staff were gracious and professional in every aspect. Special thanks to Ryan, Eric and Robin for all they did to make a special evening come together seamlessly.

The atmosphere is delightful! What a hidden gem! There is a beautiful duck pond surrounded by outdoor and indoor tables as well as a patio with live entertainment. Today they had a musician and a flamenco dancer! My son loved looking at the ducks, turtles, and fish in the pond.   The food was delicious! I had the pork carnitas and they were satisfying but didn't leave me feeling overly stuffed. The chips they served at the start were good although I had a hard time deciding on a salsa. They serve a mild red, medium green, and hot red. None in their own worked for me, but salsa is an individual preference. I appreciated all of the gluten free designations on the menu. The waitstaff and hostess were friendly and helpful.  Why 4 stars? The bathrooms and foyer/bar need some work. There is a very strong odor. I personally think that the bricks, tiles, and grout- just in the front area and bar- need to be pulled up and replaced. It smells so strongly of stale beer. Fortunately you only pass through this area on the way to the gorgeous main eating areas, but it is enough to mention this in the review in the hopes the owner sees it and makes a note that yes, the customers do notice the smell.  Despite this small flaw, I look forward to returning soon with my family. What a great local joint!

Went last week. Always a great time. Went on Saturday night. Happily waited an hour in the bar. Nick and Jay took very good care of us as usual with chips and salsa and the nest frozen margaritas with a racing stripe of strawberry, my favorite! Had dinner outside by the pond. Brian was our server and very tolerant of our special requests. And then there is Raul. He has been a fixture the for as long as I have been a guest. He will sing any of your favorite songs, my favorite that he sings is "Quando, quando, quando".
The food, the atmosphere and the dessert were all amazing! We wanted authentic and we got it. From Baltimore, MD

Hands down one of the best Mexican restaurants in the Phoenix area and I don't mind the drive. The food is good and I like sitting by the pond and watching the ducks.  Have been there there several times and quality and service where spot on

Review from my 12yo son:  We went here with a large group of about 17 people. The service was slow and we ran out of water several times. I ordered the queso fundido and it was cooked well but it was too cheesy for me. I would go back again but I would order something else.   One of the kids that we were there with has special needs and the waiter never brought him his order and he didn't tell anyone so he left without eating even though his mom paid for his quesadilla!  The bathrooms were fairly clean and the duck pond is fun. You can feed the ducks, turtles and fish if you put quarters in the duck food machine.  I would go back again but I'd rather go to Taco Bell.

Visiting Cave Creek. El Encanto was recommended to us by a local. Great ambience. While we were told the wait would be 45 mins, we're were seated in less than 15 mins. Our seating with a view of the duck pond provided for a delightful experience. Staff was friendly and attentive. Tequila Lime Shrimp and Pollo Con Fundido were both very good. Excellent Fried Ice Cream. I'm a fan.

One word: meh.  The end.   Just kidding! Service was kind of bad. I had to ask for lemons and coke FOUR times. Rice was decent. Vegetables were good. Shrimp was good but the habanero sauce was kind of bland. Salsa tasted like pure tomato sauce and cumin. Where is the flavor? Corn chips needed salt.   Pond was pretty, though.   Nice try guys but I probably won't be returning on my own terms.

Overall very good, as always.  Food was spot on.  Service was fair, but at times slow.  Margaritas were fantastic.  My only complaint really is we were at table #1.  Frustrating how many people came over wedge themselves between the pond and our table, placing their rear end in our faces.....Think people.
Wasn't great, wasn't terrible. If you are looking for chips and salsa- go somewhere else!!! Otherwise friendly staff

Best frozen margaritas, hands down, in Phoenix area.  The service and atmosphere are excellent.  The food is just ok and this is why I gave it four stars instead of five.  Because of duck pond, it's fun for kids of all ages.

New location of a place that already has many locations. Had five bucks off due to a coupon in my mailbox. Personally, I usually order the same dish at lunch in the other locations which is the chicken mole. It did not seemed stuffed with as much chicken as the other locations. The pollo fundido had alot of chicken though and was similar in taste to the other dishes. The chips and salsa are free, but were average and nothing else really stood out during our meal. Although with lots of empty tables, no way should a host seat a couple with a baby right behind two normal people. Of course the baby screeched and was annoying, so parents and tourists take note and leave the kids behind for the sake of regular folks who hate babies on airplanes and restaurants.

Dropped by for lunch and was not very impressed. I have been to this place years ago but things have changed and not for the better.   The server/bartender was kind of slow and I ran out of water frequently. If we asked for more salsa and chips, would you not bring enough for everyone at the table? We had three salsas to start but the server only gave us one new one. They were very small as well! It's not about the customer at this place.   I'm not a shredded chicken or shredded beef kind of person, so I was hoping to get ground beef in some enchiladas but that wasn't an option. We were told there was no ground beef.   Next thing I see is a burger go by our table. This made me question the ground beef. Was this a shredded beef burger? No, they have ground beef but not for my order. So I asked if I could get a burger patty next time and assemble my own enchilada. That seemed to be okay. I understand the food is probably prepared in advance and the burger patties are pre-made, so I get that.   I changed my order to a green corn tamale but there were no "meals". I had to order the tamale appetizer along with a side of beans and rice. How is this not a meal option? I'm just so confused.   Also their portion sizes have seem to get smaller while the prices have increased. The food was just "okay" and nothing to share on social media about. Good thing I ate before I went or I would still be hungry.

Good food. I got the Pollo Fundido and my wife got the Mole'.    My only complaint is that I paid $28 for a pitcher of margaritas that was 95% Ice.  That's right, ICE!   This pitcher would have been easier to drink at $15.    Also, some biker decided I parked too close to him so he spit on my drivers side window on his way out.  This is probably the same guy that didn't wash his hands after doing who knows what in the bathroom stall.  #keepitclassycavecreek

This place could be described as a tourist trap, but those types of places have bad food and the food here was rather tasty. Now, I enjoy mole, but usually it is too spicy for me, but that was not the case at Encanto. The mole was on the sweet side just as the waitress had mentioned. It was ladled over my chicken enchilada and I mopped up all the sauce with ease. We ordered a $7 guac appetizer and it came with chips and this was a good, traditional version of the mean green food. Nice chunks of avocado and no spice at all. The main attraction is of course the turtle pond. We got a seat inside, but we were right next to the pond. Outside is not worth waiting 30 minutes and we arrived at sort of an off hour on a weekend. Probably less folks here during week, but the food was well worth the drive to the West's most Western town.

Tried my fourth El Encanto on Cinco de mayo.  The Odysea in the Desert is just beginning to gain attention and this newish El Encanto seems to be getting going too.  Food was tasty.  Service was in learning mode but did the job.  We are looking forward to the kitchen and staff hitting their stride in short order.
Love the environment and the food! Eating outside in the courtyard is wonderful. Live music on the weekends. Had fun feeding the ducks!

I don't know why I've repeatedly gone back to this place over the years. The ambience is nice, and it's a cute place to bring out-of-town guests to wile away an afternoon. But the food is nothing to write home about -- Los Mesquites down the street is much better -- and far too expensive for quality that is comparable to what you can get at Filiberto's at 2 AM for 1/4 the price. Our last visit clinched my decision not to return when we had the most obnoxious waiter on earth. He spent the entire time he waited on us talking about how he was majorly hung over and explaining in detail how on his last shift he belittled his customers. The only thing more inappropriate would have been for him to compliment my boobs, which come to think of it would've probably been better. Oh, and by the way, one night I drove past here at around 10:00 before the front gate was shut and saw a bobcat moseying out the front door and across the street to Frontier Town - probably looking or a beer after chowing a duck.

Newest location of the family owned El Encanto chain. I still prefer the Cave Creek location for ambience, but pleased to have this new location closer to everything. I used to work as a busser/expo in high school and when I go back it's hard to tell anything has changed. I recommend enchiladas mole or the pollo fundido. Still my favorite place for real good Mexican food.

Dang!  I wish I had seen the reviews prior to visiting this restaurant but...it was not my choice, actually.  What completely freaked me out was that the bill was $85.00!  $85.00 for a meal for two!  For Mexican food!?  Excuse me!!!???  The atmosphere was nice, the waitstaff was average, and the food was sub-par.  Actually, the fish tacos were the worst I have tasted but my date loved the carnitas.  The pitchers of margaritas are largely filled with ice.  And everything is WAAAY overpriced for the flavor and quality of the food.  I won't return.

Que Bueno!  We got the opportunity to enjoy El Encanto recently (for brunch) and we really did enjoy it!  We had different selections along with some traditional brunch selections/offerings.  The Chorizo and eggs was very tasty, the fresh fruit, the made to order omlettes all were very good. We love the courtyard patio, such a nice touch and makes you feel like you are probably down in Mexico. Can't wait to come back for lunch or dinner sometime soon!

We ate there on 3/18/17.  They were busy.  We sat in an area where the bartender was our waiter.  She didn't seem to interested in serving us.  We had to ask a busboy who our server was and when she came over she wasn't pleased.  We had no silverware or napkins.  I asked for some and said it would be awhile as they were wrapping silverware now.  I just walked to the other end of the dining room and took it off a vacant table.  The food was just OK.  The service was just not  good.  It was my first and probably last time there.

Duck! I mean ducks...all around...in the duck pond..quacking away...while I'm getting my margarita on. Ducks getting caught in the net. Ducks looking for leftover tortillas. But I duckgress. The food was cheesy..dope for being drunk off a few pitchers of Margaritas. This is the G Family Christmas and we're getting drunk at 2 in the afternoon..right before we have to go to a White Elephant party. Thanks Monica.   The server was funny..even calling his helper Antonio Banderas. The heavier version of Zorro.   I would still go with the blended margarita..at least at 2 in the afternoon. No need to get a margarita hangover this early in the day.   Props on the heaters...it was actually too hot.
This is a wonderful Mexican restaurant that has a great setting it is surrounded by a man-made pond.
Great food and atmosphere! Good portion sizes and the oasis is very relaxing and fun to watch all the birds, ducks and turtles.

To start with the positive, this place has amazing atmosphere. This is the only reason. I can imagine for the high star reviews. The one star is for the environment,  the food is waaaay back on the negative scale. I had the pollo fundido. It was baaad. I felt ill before even leaving the place and I am really hoping it doesn't get worse.

Heard this place was good from a friend of ours. We are from the north west so we've have had good luck with Mexican food down here. But we weren't impressed with this place too much. Has a nice pond in the middle which is very interesting. We had the steak fajitas and they didn't really have any taste to them except meat. The 3 salsas that came with the chips were pretty blah also. The other reviews said they had some good stuff but we tried it and will move on.

Maybe today's visit to El Encanto was just an off day, but a couple of things marred the visit.  First, the main course was almost hot, but it would be better to describe it as very warm.  It cooled off to barely warm by the time it was halfway eaten.  The plate was very hot, but the food was only warm.  Second, our waitress didn't show up very often to see how we were doing.  We had to wait several minutes to get a drink refresh.  Disappointed.

Pollo fundido is amazing. I have eaten here a lot and it's the only thing I have ordered. We drive at least 45 miles just to eat here and buy goat milk products from a close by store. The inside tables next to the pond are so clear it's like they aren't there. We come probably only once a month and the manager remembers us and always takes care of us. We have only had one not so great experience where the server forgot to put our order in and we were heavily compansated. Price is low enough we can bring our family of 6. The ducks and fish keep kids busy and if you aren't nervous they eat out of your hand. Duck food is sold at the register.
Some of the best Mexican I have ever had. Very fresh and authentic. The restaurant atmosphere is very unique and cool. Especially love the pond in the middle with the ducks and turtles!

Love the atmosphere of this place. The kids love feeding the ducks. Food is always pretty good. Margaritas are great. Didn't give it 5 stars because the hostesses are usually less than friendly. One of them made a rude comment to my four year old about buying ANOTHER pack of duck food. ( I walked up with her to the hostess stand to buy a second cone full) Ummmm, you sell it for the kids to feed the ducks. If you don't want them feeding the ducks or are limiting their food, don't sell it!! That's the reason my kids beg me to come here!

Good mexican food with reasonable prices, large portions, and with a nice ambiance. The outdoors area is very nice and has a lot of seating so you shouldn't have to wait too long for a table. The food is straightforward and good (not amazing but not disappointing). We had:  - Queso Guillermo: A yummy cheesy dip made from real cheese (none of that weird nacho cheese stuff) served with corn tortillas. It's very filling but probably not one of the best fundidos I've had. The cheese isn't really melted that well together so it ends up forming clumps and a strange liquid separation layer. It could have used more flavor like chilis or cilantro or something. - Fajita Taco Salad: A straightforward but solid salad served in a fried tortilla shell. The veggies are a little on the greasy side. The refried beans and guacamole were my favorite parts. - Chile Relleno con Pollo: My boyfriend got this and thought it was good. I think their rice is average.

We tried this restaurant because we were hoping for a better Mexican meal than other nearby paces. There are lots of adequate but not particularly good Mexican restaurants.  This one had good chips, good margaritas, decent entrees, not very good guacamole, etc.   This is closer than our default Mexican restaurant but the food isn't quite as good.   It didn't help that, as we arrived, the hostess told us we would have to wait 20 minutes for a table: there were two tables inside in use and two outside.  My wife said we would go elsewhere so we were seated immediately. We were greeted by our waitress soon thereafter. Drinks came quickly. Food came in a reasonable time. More chips were offered.   I hope things improve but this has been open long enough not to have staff and service problems.

My husband and I love this place. This place has authentic Mexican food. The ceviche was awesome. It is hard to find good ceviche and this place had it. The service was great and everyone was very friendly. The atmosphere was very nice and clean. The manager even stopped by to chat with us. For me to visit Cave creek for the first time this place made my visit even better. Definitely going to come back. Our drive from gilbert was so worth it..

This is such a nice place to get some very tasty mexican food. We went to dinner and got the platos burros and a quesadilla. Our server was very pleasant. She checked in on us, made sure that we always had water and our food was out very quickly (it was amazing). We love the pond and ducks while eating dinner, so relaxing. I am a huge fan of El Encanto and will return.

You'll see as many locals eating here as winter visitors/tourists. The atmosphere is comfortable, service is good, and food is delicious!   It can get pretty busy during peak season, so make a reservation or come mid-afternoon to avoid the crowd, although they're great at managing the mayhem!   Enjoy the patio if it's nice out. They fire up the patio heaters if it's chilly, and serve frozen pitchers of margaritas if you need to sit by the cool of the pond on a warmer day!   Enjoy our beautiful town! There's not another place like it! ;-)
Good, not great. Under-seasoned from app to entre; various rooms smelled like sulfur.

made a reservation early in the week to celebrate our daughter's birthday called to see if we could move it to an earlier time.  We discovered  that the reservation was never put into the system.   The attitude of the staff was "Who cares. we really don't need your business" .  My husband then spoke to the manager who told us to come up and wait until a table was free...60 minutes.  I had eaten here before and the food is fine...nothing to rally write home about  and not worth a 60 minute wait.

We popped in here before visiting the OdySea Aquarium last night and had a GREAT experience! Ronnie was super attentive and took great care of us. :) We sat at the bar and enjoyed some margaritas, chips, DELICIOUS salsa, guac, and split the *sizzling* fajitas! Since we were splitting, we got the chicken and steak combo and a few extra tortillas. The flavor was incredible! It came with a side of beans, guac, and pico de gallo. If visiting OdySea in the Desert again, I will absolutely dine here! I loved their thin, crispy chips. If you have delicious chips + salsa, you're automatically a winner in my book! Thank you for the wonderful dinner experience, El Encanto!
The carne asada burro with the fundido sauce is amazing! However, the shredded chicken is kinda dry and flavorless. We like the patio and the atmosphere, and the prices are right!
The restaurant was large and packed with customers. The service was excellent, fast and delicious. Can't wait to go back to AZ

I've been going here for years and I just love this place.  It can get really busy on the weekends, but if you go mid-week for lunch you will find the patio very relaxing. The restaurant looks like it used to be a house.  There is a pond in the back with ducks and turtles that can be viewed from both the outside and in-depending on where you sit. The pollo fundido is the best, shredded chicken in a deep fried burro with jalapeno cream cheese and cheddar melted on top- probably a million calories, but worth it. I've never really had a problem with the service and the food has been consistently good.  Plus it's in charming Cave Creek, great place to bring out-of-towners.  Actually, the restaurant was even mentioned in a book I read recently (the author was local).

I was brought here by chance on Christmas Eve. It was a welcomed change from other valley Mexican restaurants. The open patio in the back with the turtle and duck pond really was magical. I had the pleasure of trying their shrimp taco suave and their taco fritas. The taco suave was particularly good. It had onions and red cabbage. Put a little bit of their homemade salsas on them and wach their taste explode. Very savory and spicy. I was pleased to find such a flavorful and authentic restaurant so far off the beaten path.

Love El Encanto, if you want Mexican food this is the place to go. I do love both El Encanto & El Encanto Dos but seem to favor El Encanto on Cave Creek Rd . It's very authentic. Food is absolutely delicious and the Sangria goes great with any menu item !!

The historic Western charm of days gone by are on full display in the Cave Creek area.  Plenty of dust of get on your 'boys and an equal amount of watering holes to keep you hydrated.  Thinking we'd find an Irish cowboy, we headed to El Encanto on St. Paddy's day.  This open air (at least in the center of the restaurant) was perfect for the amazing Arizona weather this time of year.  Complete with a large wading pool for waterfowl and goldfish, guitar strumming mariachis, and excellent service El Encanto services up ambience in spades.  The one thing you won't find is a James Beard award winning results on your plate, and that's ok.  The food is not bad and actually quite passable- just barely.  I had the pescado with veggies and rice in the habanero sauce. The fish was average, the veggies perfect and the rice with corn (nice touch) was a little undone.  The habanero sauce was not spicy at all, very little flavor.  The Princess had close to the same dish (although with shrimp). She enjoyed it but said the same thing about the sauce.  I had a margarita on the rocks and it wreaked of a sweet mix rather than a simple craft margarita of tequila, lime juice, maybe some Cointreau.  P had some Cabernet and enjoyed it.   Overall, this is a fun place to take in some great vibes and enjoyable (not great) Mexican food.

Came here for lunch because the kiddos wanted to hang out and feed the ducks. My husband and approaches the hostess stand and was rudely told by Robin that they were not seating any one outside. We talked it over for a bit and the kids really wanted to stay. I re-approached the hostess and she asked if we wanted to sit by the window. I said yes and she reiterated that no one could sit outside. I laughed it off and made a comment about the kids wanting to be outside to play. She said (very curtly), "Well, this IS a restaurant and kids can't just run around." I laughed and told her that we would be dining elsewhere. My kids had been standing there quietly the entire time - no running, no yelling and no fits. I guess she had to assert herself and put us in our place. I'm not sure why they have the ducks and allow kids to feed them if they don't want kids playing outside. My husband then asked her for her name and her supervisors contact information. She told us she was in charge - we asked her if she was the owner of the restaurant (to which she answered "no"). We then requested this individuals contact information. She reluctantly have us an email address. She then told my husband "well, what should I have said to your wife?"  At this point we disengaged with her and left. We headed down the road to the Buffalo Chip Saloon and had excellent service.   This was the straw that broke the camels back - the food was mediocre and this type of service is abhorrent. If my children are misbehaving then feel free to tell me something but don't provide me with preemptive and unsolicited parenting advice. This place is definitely off of our list of places to eat. We will use our hard earned money to patronize establishments with staff that knows how to treat its customers.

This is my favorite little gem in Cave Creek! The Mexican food is as you'd expect, and it's authentic enough for my liking without being pretentious! The restaurant itself is just so homey and there's a spot in the house for everyone with an amazing outdoor patio, indoor setting, and a more secluded bar area. I think this restaurant does so well because of the atmosphere. With the small pond and outdoor patio, I could sit here all day, slam down some chips and salsa, and indulge in their margaritas. It's just a great place to be! Everything I've eaten here is tasty, very filling, and the staff doesn't skimp on the chips and salsa refills. If you're anything like me then you agree that chips and salsa are life! It's been somewhat of a tradition for my family to eat here every time we are in town and I plan to make another stop here the next time I drive through beautiful Cave Creek!

It was 2pm on a Saturday and very busy. 30 minute wait to get a table. Got a nice seat by the water inside, the service was good our server tried to accommodate requests. Kitchen forgot to omit onions in one order. Ice tea was watered down. Chips and salsa: chips were great tomatillo salsa was bland, other two salsa were great. Food was ok/good - not sizzling hot, the plates were hot but the food wasn't. Weird bathroom layout.

the atmosphere was pretty cool and there's an artificial pond in the middle of the outdoor area  which is good for photos and for the kids. The salsa and chips were great and ate a lot of them since we were so hungry.  I ordered a Fajita Taco Salad. It was huge and looked so good. But, looks could be deceiving. The chicken didn't really have any favor and the salad just felt like I was eating lettuce. It was sort of a let down, as we were leaving my date (who grew up in the area) said she wasn't impressed either and she said it wasn't as good as she remembered.

They are quite busy so I snuck in and grabbed a table in the bar. Chips are light and crunchy. Salsa was good. I need to tell you about the amazing pescado lunch. $9.99 and it was mahi mahi today. Grilled and topped with pico de gallo. Cooked perfectly. Moist and flavorful. Also served with rice. The rice is good. Not mind blowing but have I mentioned the FISH?? Get here before you're starving if you want to enjoy the fabulous courtyard.

Our server Mike was excellent. We sat outside in the area closest to the restaurant itself and there were toasty overhead space heaters that kept us quite warm, some of our table neighbors were a little too toasty!  On this night we had a traditional chili relleno which was stuffed with cheese and then batter dipped and fried, and a grilled flattened chicken breast topped with a spicy Ranchero sauce.  Both were very good, and the chili was made even better with the suggestion from Mike to add the green chili sauce (with meat) on top of it for only two extra dollars. You might be thinking wait - two dollars for chili sauce? Ah but no this was not just thin green chili sauce, it was a green beef chili stew with large chunks of tender beef and they put lots of it over the chili relleno - it was well worth the added cost and even felt like a value.  This place has very few spicy dishes available so it was nice for Mike to guide me into choosing the chicken as I asked about options that had some kick.   The chili was so flavorful that we can't wait until our next visit to go back there and order one for each of us!
This place was great! We sat outside and it was so nice! All of our food was good but the fundido was great! Definitely try it if you go here. I can't wait to eat there again on my next visit to AZ!

Oh, how I want to like this place more! It has charm, plenty of it, from the arched entry to the inner courtyard complete with water fowl. The service is great, staff is attentive, but notice I haven't mentioned the food yet. The food is, well, underwhelming. When we have so many outstanding Mexican restaurants in the area, it is simply not enough to have a ho- hum approach to the offerings. Spice it up, get creative with fresh ingredients, or go for authentic old-school Sonoran style Mexican, but do it like you care, like you love the food and want to share it with your guests. So go to this restaurant if you are looking for atmosphere, but maybe look around a bit further if you want a full flavor Mexican dining experience.

Good food, nice location and an American Mexican restaurant kind of vibe.  Great for a lunch meeting and a nice place to break if you're at the odyssey aquarium or other attractions nearby.  My favorite was the one the ever changing specials. So if your adventurous, you won't regret it.

Great food, nice environment with outside duck pond (romantic) Service of food is slow though or I would have given 5 stars. Make a reservation if planning to dine in the evening as they are extremely busy during peak tourist season.

I have always loved this place!  There is something about the ambiance here, and Cave Creek in general.  When I lived in the area from 1998-2002, I would frequent it for lunch at least once every few months.  Now that I live in the far SE valley, I will still make the occasional "trek" up north!  The food is very good, in my opinion, and I have eaten a lot of Mexican food in my day.  Today I ordered the chicken enchilada lunch w/ green sauce, rice & beans.  It was just delicious...piping hot, not too spicy, with large pieces of chicken breast with that greasy, cheesy goodness smothered on top.  It was too hot to sit out on the patio, so a nice table with a view of the pond was relaxing.  Yes, the pond water is dirty!!!!  But the ducks and turtles don't seem to mind :)  I've been here a few times in the evening, and the enlarged patio with the fireplace and tree lights etc. make for a wonderful place to have a few drinks and enjoy a nice relaxing dinner.

My family and I dined at El Encanto on Sat. May 12th and had the most horrendous, humiliating and embarrassing experience. This place is labeled as wheelchair accessible but it is clearly not an establishment for anyone who is disabled. I was using my scooter due to pain issues and the greeter who seated us was very nice to take my scooter away so that it was not in the way but after needing to use the facilities a bus boy helped me by taking the scooter away and I appreciated both of their assistance. After returning to the table and getting the scooter situated my family and I were talking and enjoying the view of the water, I was reminiscing on childhood trips to dine at the restaurant when out of nowhere Robin the manager comes yelling at me shaking her finger at me and screaming about how my scooter isn't a toy and that I had no business letting her employees ride my scooter. She also said other things I did not catch because she was just yelling like a crazy woman. All of the other customers were whispering and looking at us so I was embarrassed. As if that wasn't bad enough she continued to yell and make a scene as she walked from one end of the restaurant to the to the other. Then she started to yell at the young man who had helped me in front of everybody. I had just come from a place where I felt so empowered and not so different and in one minute she ruined my mood and my view of the place. Right before she came to our table yelling I was telling my family how much I loved the place and how many fond memories I had and how good I felt after the event we attended. Robin was unprofessional, inconsiderate, racist and a Bitch. I would love to speak to the owners because if she is representing this establishment then they are in big trouble. I felt that I was targeted because of my being disabled and because my family and I were the only Hispanic people there at the time. While Robin was so busy yelling at me there were about ten small children jumping and climbing the rocks near the water with the parents too busy drinking and laughing to pay attention. I believe she should have focused on that issue instead of who was riding my scooter. She wanted me to leave my scooter behind the desk in front but how the hell was I suppose to get to the table without my scooter that is why the two employees helped me by taking it for me. That woman needs a lesson on what it is to be disabled and also a class in how to be professional. She could have come to our table and introduced herself and stated her purpose for even being at our table instead of yelling like a maniac. There was another manager there a guy but he just came to our table like a dog with his tail between his legs not really doing anything to help the situation or to even try to make it better. My mom had to tell him that she didn't think it was right to have to pay for a meal that we couldn't even enjoy but even then he had a hard time saying he would comp it. I was so disgusted I just paid for our stuff so we could get the hell out of there. I hope that Robin is punished for her behavior and I hope the wheelchair accessible label is removed from this establishment because it is far from accepting the disabled as long as Robin is there. If I could give a no star rating I would because it deserves no stars after the way we were treated so I do not recommend this place at all if you are disabled or Hispanic.

So I would love to give zero stars because of the lack of service we received, but since that isn't N option they get one. We came here on a Saturday night, had a reservation for 20, and didn't have a table ready. Additionally, we didn't have a table ready even within an hour of our reservation. They told us that the kitchen is small,so they couldn't accommodate a party that large, so we would have to have a limited menu as well. We ended up bussing the tables in a separate bar table ourselves, getting chips and salsa from the bar ourselves, getting our own drinks, and though we waited for an hour still never got a table, so we left. I find it hard to believe that even a small restaurant couldn't accommodate a party such as this on a Saturday night within an hour. Apparently this small restaurant doesn't need to fill its seats, and can afford to turn away a table of 20 folks that probably would have racked up at least a $1200 bill with drinks and food.

In six decades of life and spending my share of time "deployed" to the Southwest of the US and eaten at more than my share of "Mexican" restaurants... El Encanto was the best of ANY I've had and my wife and two of my adult children agree that hands down El Encanto is the best. We had a variety of menu items between us and every one of them was superior. My beef taco salad was so good that I hope to never have a trip to Arizona in the future that does not include a meal at El Encanto. The prices were very good, the ambiance was superb and our server Allison was a top notch professional, absolutely exceptional. To be within 75 miles of Cave Creek and not take in a meal at El Encanto would be a sorely missed opportunity. Great food, atmosphere and service a definite trifecta!
Very nice dining area. Relaxing with the waterfall and pond. The food, unfortunately, was mediocre at best. Definitely not worth the price.
The pollo fundido is my personal favorite with a margarita. The atmosphere is great... I prefer to sit on the patio so that I can enjoy the pond and the weather.

Went here for a rehearsal dinner, so I can't judge on what the normal dinner experience is, but I'll give you my simple pros and cons: Pros: -BIG, really big restaurant -You can ask the hostess for duck food and feed the ducks in the pond -Indoor/outdoor restaurant  -Lots of space -Really fun location.  I'm from the east coast and this area of Arizona is like a tv show to me.  Real cowboys, cactii, and awesome western shoppes and restaurants    Cons: -Salsa tasted like tomato sauce -Wine was eh. (only had red or white to choose from, but nothing to write home about) -Beer wasn't cold  Take it or leave it: lots of kids running around

Eh. This place has a nice patio. I would recommend this place for drinks and apps. If any out of towners think they want to do dinner here, maybe do drinks and apps and then move along. Asking for drinks before everyone has even sat down, not bringing the drinks before mains arrived and then only touching base once during service. The support staff is more friendly and on top of it. Again, drinks and apps people, drinks and apps.

The atmosphere is what makes this place special. The food and margaritas aren't the best I've ever had (I'm admittedly biased coming from an area that has fantastic Mexican food) but they are pretty good. I like that they offer three different types of salsa with the chips as a starter. My one year old loves feeding the ducks and looking for turtles. Overall, this place is great for families and big parties. I will definitely be back.

I have been here a few times, the food is very good and up until this last visit the service was great. However this lad experience was probably the worst I have had in a restaurant . From the beginning the staff was rude and not happy to be there. Our server Sutton, was extremely rude to the woman at our table. The server didn't write down our orders, which I have experienced many times at other restaurants and when the food comes out with all the proper modification its impressive, however when most of the meals came to the table they were incorrect this time. At the end of the evening AFTER PAYING , I spoke to the manager , and the server came over and decided to yell at me about how we were in the wrong for not ordering properly. Lastly one of the people in our group left there iPhone at the table. It was not found , however using the find my phone feature it clearly showed the phone in the restaurant in the back of the kitchen.    Update 6/7/17 I received this message from the server on Yelp.  Neno B: Richard, how is it that you cannot keep a story straight. Everyones order was wrong or did you just eat your aunts plate. See I know you had 1 chicken and 1 cheese no onion. I seen you eat 85% of it then ask for anther free meal. Is that how you do business? I took care of you for 2 hrs of which the first 30min you party was not complete. You personally drank 3 liters of diet coke and ate 2 meals. Why drink diet coke if you eat that much? Dishonest you say, then why not tell the people after 2 hrs and a 114 bill you came at me with your big "this is why I'm tipping you poorly" speech. Then left and came back to say I threw you phone in the pond? But now find my iPhone says its in the kitchen? I truly feel sorry for you. If you treated people like people, I'm sure you wouldn't have such poor karma. Ps where your aunts carna asada tacos wrong or the girls chicken fajita ummm seems like Richard cannot keep a story STRAIGHT. oh and ask my name next time so that you can actually call me out. You honestly thing parents would name a kid Sutton, God your dumb but I already knew that from the 2 hrs we shared together. Call someone a thief then stick to that story, no wonder you lack results because you are a habitual liar. Don't worry I don't blame you I blame you backwoods upbringing. I hope if you actually did lose your phone which, obviously I don't believe, I hope it turns up or atleast that you take your time and small brain to figure out how to actually use the app correctly. Oh did you know Florida is considered the scammer capital? I see You FL. Bye for now your good friend who's name you never asked. Hope I could teach you something, but chances are you to dumb to read this for what it is.    If you want good food and bad service and dishonest staff , then you will love this place!!!

My favorite Mexican restaurant in Arizona.  Love the machomos with quest guillermo and the frozen margarita. Normally I'm a rocks girl, but the frozen stays cool on a hot summer day and doesn't get watered down. A must try.

I was pleased with the unique and unexpected flavors of the food here. The atmosphere and setting is lovely. Although we sat inside and not on the patio, our view was still great. The Pollo fundido and carne asada dishes were my favorite.

My new favorite Mexican food restaurant! The food is amazing and the atmosphere is very welcoming. We went on a Sunday night about an hour before they closed and they were still very busy so I knew the food was going to be good but I didn't think it was going to be that good! It's about a 45 minute drive away but so worth it.
love the endless fresh chips and salsa, fun atmosphere and great food.

My absolute favorite Mexican restaurant in Arizona! The prickly pear margaritas are seductive and delicious, the pollo fundidio is to die for, the atmosphere and ambiance are lovely and the service is always good. Any out of town/country visitors that come to stay with me get to experience El Encanto and they all still rave about it. There's often a wait in the evenings on weekends but you can hang out and have a drink at the bar, I always choose to drive out to Cave Creek because I think it's a cool little spot and enjoy the character. Would highly recommend this restaurant.
The real deal.  The chicken chimi's and handmade chips/salsa are amazing.  Get a seat by the koi pond, have a cocktail, and listen to some good music.

We really liked this place.  Feels like you are away in Mexico somewhere.  They have good food and ambiance. A huge fish pond is in the courtyard.  Great service.  We brought our family who were visiting and they really enjoyed it too.  We will be back.

This has to be a top 3 Mexican restaurant in the valley. The setting makes it my favorite. Great outdoor patio and duck pond. They usually have a talented mariachi band on the busy nights. The pollo fundido is the best that I have had. Everything else that I have tried is very good as well except for the fish tacos. I would stick to something more traditional here. The pitcher of margaritas I always get helps washes everything down.

This place came recommended from a lot of our neighbors as a must-try.  I had the pollo fundido - absolutely delicious for me.  The setting/atmosphere/ambiance is lovely.  I was disappointed when my son couldn't get a simple plate of nachos - nothing fancy - we just asked for chips and melted cheese and was met with an almost appalled 'no'.  He didn't enjoy his tacos - so won't be going back as a family :-(

Food was awesome & the Pomegranate margaritas were so delicious!!! The service there left some bittersweet feelings but in their defense they seemed severely understaffed. The restaurant was really busy and there only seemed to be one waiter & the host in front and the rest were cooks. These poor guys did their best to move around quick enough to help everyone but they just couldn't move fast enough! Poor guys truly did their best so I hope management gives them some help because they were both troopers! We would definitely be back to give them a chance!!

The staff has always been friendly and the service is good. We've been here a few times & the good is consistent. The restaurant is comfortable & the kids enjoy the pond. The food isn't fancy and the menu is a bit limited in selections, but we've enjoyed it and all go back.

I was looking forward to going to El Encanto for a great meal & Flamenco dancing (advertised to start at 5:30 every Sunday on the patio). When we got to the restaurant and asked to sit near the dancing, we were told by the hostess, "we don't do that anymore." After she checked with someone else in the restaurant she told us that the dancing did not start until 6PM and that we "should leave and come back." When we told her we would go to the bar for drinks, they gave us a buzzer for later seating. When the buzzer rang, we were told that they would not seat us at all. For what we had at the bar.....we won't bother to go back. There are better options for flamenco and great food in Phoenix. What a waste of time the trip to Cave Creek was today.

What a great Mexican restaurant in the Phoenix area!  We enjoyed a nice lunch outside by the pond on Saturday.  The enchiladas and the carne asada burro was delicious.  The service was good, the place was huge and felt authentic - we'll be back if we're in the Carefree area again!

The atmosphere was very nice. Tropical with a Mexican flare, nice pond with fish and ducks. You can sit inside or outside, we sat inside next to the windows that looked over the pond, I was very impressed that the windows were so clean you could not tell they were even there. Now about the food, you get chips and salsa when you sit down, there is 3 different salsas, mild, medium, and hot.  They were all just okay, I thought they were pretty tasteless. Hubby and I ordered the Pollo Fundido, it would have been really good if it wasn't so dry, it was all white meat so I'm sure that had a lot to do with it, it was covered with a jalapeno cream sauce which was wonderful, but there was hardly enough. My friend had a Chicken salad which looked very good, I should have gotten that.

Came to the restaurant on a crazy Friday.   We sat down in their side room and the had the best server I've ever had at EL Encanto.  We have been coming here for over 15 years.  Our servers name was Laina and much respect to her and she made sure we were taken care of.   She is a keeper and a must get server.

My family of 5 and my parents went to dinner here on a Saturday night. They wouldn't take a reservation, only walk ins. They told us 45 min wait and they were right on schedule with that estimate. The margaritas were great, food was awesome, service was friendly, we were even serenaded!! The pond in the middle courtyard with ducks, turtles, and fish kept us entertained. It was a great dinner experience!

We called on a rainy, Sunday afternoon and were told they were not taking reservations.  There were six of us.  When we arrived at 5 pm, we were told there would be a 45 minute wait.  We had a member of our party needing to catch a flight so we asked why we had to wait so long as there were several tables available.  The young ladies at the counter said we could have called in two hours ahead and they would have had a place for us.  However, we did call in two hours ahead and were told they were not taking reservations because it was raining.  I was confused, upset and ended up at The Spotted Donkey, spending $200 and it was wonderful!!

We love Mexican food but unfortunately I can't recommend this place. It is a beautiful place but the food is just okay. I want to love this place because it is so close to home, but I just can't. The chips and salsa are good, but the food is about average.

Service was quick and friendly. 3 choices of sauces with complimentary chips. Taquitos were too hard to bite in to. Dry chicken burrito. Rice was dry and hard. The rest of the food wasn't anything memorable. What we do remember was the sun shining in our eyes the entire meal, maybe invest in some window shades
My favorite restaurant ever for Mexican food. Amazing choices for authentic Mexican food. I have been eating here for over 20 years.

El Encanto is about 35 minutes from my house, but we drive there as often as we can to have their lunch. I love the mole chicken enchiladas! The best I have ever tasted! My husband likes their fajitas and tacos. You can't go wrong with these items. I gave it 4/5 stars, because their margaritas are not very good. They are watered down & you can not taste any liquor. However, the food is amazing and if I lived closer, I would eat here all the time. This is a GREAT place to take your guests when they are visiting AZ and if you're the one visiting, this place is a must!

Went to El Encanto yesterday for mid-afternoon lunch. As others have noted, the ambience and decor were hard to beat. The authentic Mexican tile work, the pond, and the squawking goose all lent an air of delightful authenticity. Our sangrias were tasty but a bit pricey for the serving size, considering they were over half ice. The complementary basket of chips was dry and unsalted but the salsa selection was a nice touch. I preferred the fire roasted tomato salsa while my friend liked the pureed red salsa. Neither of us favored the green salsa. My lunch special, grilled Mahi Mahi with rice, was tasty and ample - just slightly on the dry side. My friend said her vegetarian enchiladas were very good. We both saved room for dessert but but had to send our sopapillos back to the kitchen. They were made with a wheat dough that was too salty and undercooked and they were served already topped with a whisper of cinnamon, powdered sugar, and a light drizzle of honey. By the time our waiter brought individual plates for each of us, we had each sampled a sopapilla and decided they were just not to our taste. Our waiter confided that it was his first lunch shift ever, and it showed. He was very kind but needed to learn the finer points of service. There did not seem to be anyone overseeing him. Hopefully he will learn to anticipate a diner's needs (like keeping water glasses full, providing individual plates for shared portions, remembering a request for split tickets, bringing change back to the patron who pays with cash).  I'm sure I will return to Cave Creek but I probably try another restaurant next time.
Great service, disappointing food. Not horrible but just not good:( It'd be nice if they could figure it out.

This place has always given me great food, great drinks and great customer service! Tonight I indulged in an appetizer that is just as good for a meal, the Queso Guillermo. I get it with the Machomos, the seasoned crispy beef, squeeze a few limes on the meat and smother it with the bubbly cheese and pico de gallo. Sooo Good!   Our waitress this evening even brought me an extra helping of the seasoned beef at no extra charge because I mentioned how the first time I ordered it to split with a friend that they piled it on the dish. That was because the first time we were sharing the appetizer as a meal.  The restaurant always looks clean, I wouldn't eat anywhere that was unsanitary and I've eaten next to the pond during the day and in the evening and I have never smelled any duck poop smell!
I went to el encanto for the 2nd time. I tried the Jalapeo Rellenos. Oh my, thought I'd died and gone to heaven! So delicious!! I'll be back!!

If you're looking for good Mexican food, pass on this place 'cuz THIS AIN'T IT, FOLKS!  Dispute the lovely water setting that we were told about, the place was busy and we were were seated next to a wall where we listened to screaming kids who were seated by the pond.   While service was adequate, the food was below average. Generally tasteless lunch all around. Just seemed like the food was thrown together with no sense of pride. Amateurish cooking and presentation.  My husband's salad was just a big plate of course chopped lettuce, a scoop each of black beans and corn and not much else on it. My taco was small, tough and cold. Chips and salsas were bland and boring. You too can have the same slop we had for $40 or can do yourself a favor and skip it.
Love that the kids are entertained. Great margaritas and chips and salsa. I suavely get the fajitas. Kids love the cheese crisp and my husband gets the fish.

Service and staff are excellent.  They really go that extra step.  Atmosphere is cool I guess, but it depends where you get seated.  Our last visit they put us at a small table for two in a high traffic area and next to a large party with several small kids running in circles and roughhousing right next to our table.  They moved us at my request to a much better spot.  Again, they are very accommodating.    I do find the food to be salty and on the oily side, more so than I am used to with Mexican food.  Last time my wife had fajitas, they were dripping in oil.  Doesn't thrill me, and I've had better Mexican food I am sorry to say, and I don't think we'll go back any time soon.  We're usually not in the CC area anyway, so nothing missed there.  It's out of the way for us when we're in AZ.

AMAZING! I am not the biggest fan of Mexican food, so when we decided to try this place for lunch I was kind of expecting the same greased up, fried, typical Mexican food. Boy, was I wrong! The ambiance is so perfect...with their swans & turtles swimming in the pond. The outdoor would be a beautiful venue for a rehearsal dinner or any fun get together. Decorated festive but not overdone. The salsas they bring out before your meal are tasty: mild/medium was my favorite. Husband loved the spicy & the tomatillo was  also good. We were told the portions are huge, so husband & I split the pollo fundido which came with beans and rice. Delicious! I had the most perfect prickly pear margarita. Overall terrific experience!

Alison is the hands down best bartender I've ever witnessed in my 32 years of existence. Her glorious shining self, truly expressed bartending at its most fabtabulous. She was super busy and despite that she got super busy on my taste buds. Love this restaurant love Alison.
delicious food, friendly staff, great drinks and beautiful pond ambiance. what more do you need?  they have ducks and turtles in the pond overlooked by a lovely patio.

The best margaritas, by far!  Our favorite place for Ahi Tacos and margaritas! The bartenders, Nick and Jesus are awesome! The service is wonderful! Love the staff here. So friendly and helpful. Been coming here for a long time and would recommend it to everyone.

Food was good, service was friendly and fast and the patio was very pleasant with the pond with ducks and turtles.  Dave got the Pollo Fundido and it was the perfect serving size with excellent flavor. I got the Carne Asada soft tacos and they were good. 3 different salsas come with chips and they were all good. Would definitely go back.

Service was adequate at best. Water carafe brought to table but waiter or bus boy never filled or refilled any glasses. Food was poor. Ordered the special which was a red/green sauce chicken burrito and a fajita taco salad. Chicken in burrito was 75% fat. Couldn't even eat it. Salad had edible chicken but was flavorless. Salad also had giant chunks of the lettuce stem. Would not recommend eating here. Not Mexican food by any stretch of the imagination.

Food was decent and atmosphere was great. Live music and dancing was a nice touch.   Service was mediocre at best. There didn't seem to be a manager within sight and much of the staff seemed disinterested. They had a heck of a time just getting our order right and getting it to the table in some sort of orderly fashion.   Enjoyable night but we had to ignore the disorganized and cranky staff.

okay so... had a 45 minutes wait, which was to be expected on a Sunday, but unnecessary considering only half of the dining room and half of the patio was open. I have no idea what all the fuss over the margs is about, ours was left full on the table when we closed our tab. the food was actually good... but not good enough to deal with the terrible service. our server was clearly miserable from the very beginning. her adorable little rainbow rowed pens in her apron gave me a positive initial impression, until she opened her mouth. my husband was severed the wrong dish, he holds an executive position in food and beverage and isn't one to "complain"... luckily the food runner realized and brought him out something else. the wrong dish. again. we didn't see our server for 25 minutes after the food was dropped. we waited, finished, in search of the check so we could gtfo. I approached a manager and asked him for help, he asked me if I had lost something to which I replied yeah, my server. he giggled and walked off. while walking out I caught a glimpse of the kitchen and I'm SO glad I didn't catch it prior to eating because it would have been a struggle. the turtles in the pond were super cute though. for whatever that's worth. ownership change? management turnover? whatever happened it definitely wasn't for the better.

Holy moly make a reservation if you are coming here or expect a long wait! Hopefully if you dont make reservations you can grab a seat at the bar for some pre-dinner drinks! We were given chips and salsa while we waited at the bar which was a nice plus! We split the steak and chicken fajitas. I thought they were really good but I cant be totally sure as I was completely starving by the time we sat down! The refried beans and rice were also very good! Overall, the service was pretty good considering the wait time!

So good! This place has the best guacamole I have probably ever tasted!! And margaritas!!   I also love the atmosphere and the ducks that hangout outside in the pond. I feed them when the staff isn't looking if I'm sitting outside...don't tell if you see me doing it :-D

This is a restaurant that used to be one of the jewels of cave creek. I have never given a yelp review before, but the food has gotten so bad that it really needs to be brought before the current management and potential customers. The setting is so special that it would be a shame to see it close, but the food quality has declined to home microwave quality. This is based on our last two meals there over 6 months.

This is a well run operation. It's a big efficient restaurant with a young friendly helpful staff.  Great tortilla chips with a flight of salsas - all fresh & good. Had the traditional shrimp cocktail with spicy tomato broth & chopped veg. Very tasty. Then wonderful tamales - I loved the green tamale especially & our waitress happily added refried beans & good rice to make it a dinner. Wonderful.
I absolutely love bringing my girlfriend here for lunch dates. The pond makes for a unique setting you won't find anywhere else and the food isn't half bad either.
Literally heaven.  If I needed to propose to someone it would be here.  Legendary food, service, atmosphere, everything was on point.  A+++++

Just moved into town this spring of 2017. Love the atmosphere in this place. Indoor and nice outdoor area with seating alongside the pond and all the beautiful birds that gather. Not many great places to eat in Cave Creek but this is one we feel good about bringing our friends to when they come to visit. Friendly staff and tasty "Americanized" Mexican food. It shouldn't disappoint unless you're looking for authentic. Margaritas are tasty. I favor the prickly pear blended. We are vegetarian so plenty of options and they are more than willing to accommodate.

The duck pond was my favorite part , but it is kind of dirty and lacking pond plants for the turtles that live there.  If you are shopping along this strip and need a break this will do because It IS NOT THE WORST but also NOT The best in American style Mexican cuisine.  We thought we were going to try the $14.95 buffet but took a peek and decided against it because nothing to use looked appetizing and there were very few choices I think only 6 buffet pans plus an omelet station .  They gave us the chips and the 3 sauces so MAYBE it's just me but all 3 sauces had an unusual ingredient added that I didn't care for .  My Chicken Fajita salad came and I DO NOTE this was the greasiest and oiliest one I have ever had it was very generous with peppers and onions and red cabbage that I picked out because dripping with oil . The chicken had an odd texture sort of dried out but juicy like a dry sponge with liquid . My salad also came with Mexican Style sour cream and  guacamole . I asked for the re fried beans on the side and my husband tried them he said they were just unseasoned whipped beans that really needed some salt .  My husband tried the carnitas and thought the actual pork was OK but the black beans that came with it just had an awful smoke flavor to them and he also wasn't a fan of the corn tortillas . He was having gastric problems the next day and thought it was from here since  I was fine and it was the only food we had different the day before . (so it seemed like kind of visiting Mexico for real) I can't say positively that this was from here just a guess .
