If you dine here a table would be better than a booth because you will have a better view of the ducks , swans and turtles .

This place is one of the "staples" of Cave Creek. Been around forever. Food is always great. Scenery inside and duck pond is cool. Margarita are great and you can order pitchers of them. Great place for lunch or dinner. Been coming here for 20+ years since I was a kid.
Great mexican, visited one time out here looking for houses and now I live here, cant wait to visit all the time

The mild salsa is tomato paste, the medium/green salsa is the only half way decent one, but it is still meh. The "hot salsa" is not spicy and tastes blah. The food is total crap, and it's not cheap. The patio is very nice but that's about all this place has going for it. This is one of the worst "Mexican" restaurants we have ever been to. We will never go back. We regret not leaving after tasting the crappy salsa.  UPDATE: it's now 4:40am next morning and I've just been woken up by the most awful stomach cramps and I feel completely ill from the disgusting food I ate from this sad excuse for a Mexican restaurant. I will be contacting my parents later this morning to find out if they too are having stomach issues from our regrettable visit in last night.

I have been shopping at Retablo since 2013, 2 years before I moved to Arizona. I have since moved to Arizona and I'm still shopping there and have found everyone wonderful to work with.  There hasn't been anything that I have needed that the owners & employees have not been able to help me with. Most of my house is furnished with furniture is from Retablo. .  Anything you are looking for they you can get at Retablo. Thank you Gretchen for everything.

I love the atmosphere of this restaurant. I have been coming here for years and sitting outside by the pond always makes me feel like I'm on a mini break from AZ but over the course of the last year or so I feel the quality of the food has severly declined. I don't know what happened but it's nowhere near as good as it used to be. Shame because it's a cool place!
Favorite restaurant in the PHX metro area. Drinks awesome, eveything about thus place is great.

Fundido! Fundido! Fundido!!! Must try the Fundido sauce! It is truly the best compared to any other Mexican restaurants around here and even compared to ones in California. It's amazing!  The Pollo Fundido meal is my favorite meal here. It's a good sized portion--my husband and I share this meal and are completely content.   They are self proclaimed as having the best margarita in town and my husband agrees. Lots of parking around the back. Something we just recently realized.   Enjoy the man-made lake with ducks, fish, turtles and an area to feed them too. Perfect entertainment quality if you bring children. Beautiful ambience.

After reading the reviews I feel as if I wasn't at the same restaurant as the other reviewers.  Yes the place is pretty, but the similarities ended there.  Our server seemed uninterested, and slow would be an understatement.  It took 15 minutes just for the drink order!  When the food finally came, we sent a shrimp dish back, but it could've been 3 more.  Although one of our guests enjoyed his food, I would say we are not going to be back anytime soon.

Had heard so much about Cavecreek went out there today. Stopped to eat at El Encanto, being from New Mexico USA the food was different than I'm used to but very tasty. I would definitely eat there again. Beautiful place.
Enjoy the food and the view, great service every time I have gone, thank you
The food was good. The service was great... But the atmosphere was wonderful!  Also, it's always nice seeing the manager sweepings floors & refilling waters.

Had a pretty bad experience, and we didn't even get to eat there!   We checked in: two adults and a not-yet-walking toddler. I specifically said 2 and a high chair. I saw the hostess write "3" in her sheet. We chose first available seating. We were told the wait is 25 minutes.   A few minutes later, our pager started buzzing, and I hope it's a fair assumption that we were next to be seated. So we made our way to the host's desk and we were told we'll be in a booth with no high chair. We said we need a high chair, so the hostesses put us back on the list.   We waited I think at least 20 more minutes, baby started fussing and we're very hungry at this point. When I asked how much longer it would take for us to be seated, I was told there were 6 other parties in front of us! But wait I thought when our pager buzzed the first time that we were next at that point, and we were waiting for the next available table! I guess they can argue that all available tables at the time were booths, but I don't comprehend why we were told there were 6 parties ahead of us. Did they put us back at the end of the line? So we left, we are not putting up with this BS.

Ditto. Wonderful ambiance, good place to bring guests, worth the drive. I've had the Seafood Enchiladas (3.75 stars) and the Pollo Fundido (4 stars). What brings El Encanto up to a solid 4 stars overall is that ambiance. Relaxing, romantic, quaint, peaceful, blah blah blah.  Only sour note is that both times I've been, the service/servers weren't that impressive. But not horrendous enough to keep me away.

I love this Mexican food!!! The atmosphere is even better though. They have a beautiful pond that you can sit next to and look at the fish and the ducks. They have string lights that they turn on at night so it makes for a very pretty dinner! We ordered the sampler platter because it came with pollo fundido, tamales, and taquitos, and we couldn't decide what we wanted so it was perfect! Everything we ate was delicious. The pollo fundido was really flavorful and the chicken inside was moist. Their chips and salsa are really good too. They give you a trio of salsas but the best by far is the green salsa! This place would be perfect for a special occasion dinner, a date night, or just a family dinner!
Food is average to good. I hated the jalapeo margarita. But the regular margarita was very taste. Being in az I wanted the food to be a bit bette. Cool location.

Dined with a group of 6 last evening. Let's start with positives, the space accommodates large groups, the pond and wildlife make the surrounding unique, and the chips were good and abundant (menu stated we would be charged for chips after the first free basket, but that didn't happen)  Food and service were mediocre. Taco shells, for instance, were fried so crisply that they shattered when you bit into them, leaving all contents to drop to plate. Taste of other entrees was"off". Margaritas were overly sweet and not worth the price.   Bottom line is that there are so many good restaurants around, give this one a pass.
Great authentic Mexican restaurant in the heart of downtown Cave Creek.  Many great dishes and good margaritas.  Very nice ambiance.

I thought this Mexican restaraunt was Great..My bean burrito was delicious. My husband said his good was good also..We went with another couple and they also enjoyed their meals.. When we return to arizona we will eat here again..I thought the prices were also good.

I usually love this place however last time I went the hostess made my son cry, so I will not be returning. We were told there was a wait to sit about 30 mins with 10 open tables in the patio area. I told the hostess my son would like to sit in a table that is open to wait until there is a table..."we were told sorry I can't do anything about that and "I guess he doesn't see the ducks tonight" prompting my son to burst out in tears. We still took him to look at the ducks but the hostess team is pure moronic on how to treat customers with children. I won't be coming back.
The outdoor portion of this place is cool.  Jic ambiance, fresh air etc... Then it goes down hill.  Worst service ever.

SERVICE: 1 Star  (non communicative, bored, not helpful when asked simple question like 'What comes in this dish'....) FOOD: 4 Stars, Tasted great. we used to go years ago, for the atmosphere - the relaxed, funky setting. I know they're big and 'busy' now...but... does service always have to suffer when something gets 'successful'?..to bad. Food was great...good on ya chef's and person bringing our lunch out to the table.
The absolute best place to go for inauthentic setting with excellent Mexican food. Great for groups comma family and happy hour.
I agree with the previous reviewers below. Definitely a tourist trap, and the food is ok, at best. Margaritas are Blah. Food was boring. Service was slow.
All was going OK until I find out sour cream condiment is extra charge. Mexican food, really

The ambience is great. Our server was good and efficient. The food was so-so. Not real good Mexican. The two stars is because 3 people in our dinner party got sick off the food. They all had chicken and within a couple hours they were all in the bathroom.

The only reason it's getting three stars is because I grew up on this food and still crave it so I'll go back. That being said, it has gone way down hill and is rarely as I remember and almost never worth the inflated prices. It really bums me out to go somewhere I've been visiting for years just to get price gauged for something that used to be much less expensive larger in portion and higher in quality. I've found foreign objects in my food as well as in my over priced margaritas, I've received awful service and left with a disappointed feeling at least 80%of the time. That being said there are some great staff members there that are quick to take care of these problems the best they can but it's sad that they happened in the first place. I really used to adore this place (that's within walking distance of my home) but now when I'm in the mood for Mexican more often then not I drive into Scottsdale. I hope they get back to the level they fell from, I truly miss "the way we were"

My wife and I like to eat here.  We sometimes bring the kids.  The atmosphere makes it enjoyable, from feeding the ducks to music and flamenco dancing, it's a great experience with consistently good service.

Good service and atmosphere. The food quality has suffered since we were the last. Ordered fajitas and the beef was ok but the chicken was like rubber. Very few onions and peppers. Other in our party that ordered chicken dishes had a similar experience.
Best margaritas in town!!! We go there as often as we can, the kids love feeding the ducks too!!  Great ambiance!

Awesome Mexican food! I was starving after the Butterfly Wonderland and needed to eat something before exploring the Aquarium. I almost bought a little deli sandwich from the cafe at the Butterfly gardens but was so happy to have held out, hoping for a better option. On our walk to the aquarium we were pleasantly surprised to find a whole plaza full of attractions and restaurants, and El Encanto was calling my name "Amandita".   El Encanto starts each table with a full basket of hot chips and 3 different salsas. For a saucey girl like myself, I was already in salsa heaven! My favorite was the green avocado salsa followed by the spicy red, I wasn't a huge fan of the mild (too much oregano), but that didn't matter because I had 2 awesome other salsas!    For lunch I had a Cadillac margarita (it was a late lunch! Lol) and a small version of the fish tacos. The margarita was good and for $7.50, definitely not a bad price! The fish tacos ended up just being a fish taco, but after stuffing my face with delicious chips for the previous 20ish minutes, I really didn't need more than one. The fish was Mahi which is a tougher fish and the taco shell fell apart on me so it had to be a knife and fork taco, but it was served grilled and with a super flavorful pick de gallo as well as the most delicious rice and black beans. Even though my taco fell apart on me, I was very pleased with my meal and great service from Ronnie. Don't settle for Butterfly garden or aquarium cafeteria food, El Encanto is just around the corner!

Have eaten here twice with friends and each time the staff, food and margaritas were awesome. Have tried something different each time on the menu and was very satisfied. Love the duck pond and outside patio area. Very friendly and service inspired staff. Would highly recommend giving them a try.
Came in with a party of 24 with a reservation and manager attempted to give us a fixed menu and made us wait 50 mins extra before telling us so.   Great place/food with horrible management

Loved the beautiful setting on the patio. Our server was Joe and really it couldn't have been any better. We ordered the jalapeos rellenos and the carne aside burro. The carne asada is the best I've ever had. The meat was tender, flavorful, and lean. The jalapeo appetizer was also very good and spicy. This will be our go to Mexican restaurant.

Jaime totally rocks!!! She knew what had onions in it and how. Never had someone as knowledgable about the intricacies of the menu. We were impressed with her ability to remember all of our altered orders. Also, I'm so boring, I get the same thing at every Mexican restaurant, Chimichanga with Carne Asada. I have been to hundreds of places and this, by far, has the best Carne Asada ever!!! It's tender and smoky. Gracias!!!

Two things you should know about this place: (1) It's a long drive if you live in Phoenix or the east Valley, and (2) it's worth the drive.  I once took my parents and some family friends. My mom complained the entire drive about how long it was taking to reach. When we finally did, she sheepishly conceded the point. Hah!   The food is good, with a good blend of standard and some unique Mexican entrees. The mood is festive. And the decor and overall setting is what really sets the place apart. Think of a duck pond, palm trees, a grand patio filled with people having a good time, huge windows if you want to sit indoors, and a great misting system if you want to sit outside in summer (but prepare to get ever so slightly wet). If you have to wait for your table, there's a fun, fairly crowded bar area with free chips and salsa. The service has always been friendly and efficient.   Because of the drive I don't go often, but if you're new to Phoenix you should definitely make the time at least once. I often take out of town guests. Cave Creek is an interesting little town to explore on its own.

Great food and great atmosphere, sit outside and watch the ducks and turtles if it isn't too hot. The pond can smell a bit funky in late summer, but the margaritas make it bearable. I like the burro with red and green sauce, hubby likes the chicken fundido.

There  is not large selection of eateries in Cave Creek but El Encanto is a good one.  I started off with a pitcher of margueritas and they were the best.  The queso appetizer was fabulous as was the fresh guacamole.  The pollo fundido was outstanding and the small size was more than enough.  They were able to accomodate our large group.  I will return!

I've been here several times and the service is good and so is that atmosphere. The food is lack luster and is just ok mexican food. Nothing to write home about, we mostly just like to sit on the patio.

You guys.  Stop taking this place so seriously.  They have amazing frozen margaritas. You will get drunk. Fast.  The food is good, usually. The plates are so hot that it turns the food into molten lava. Be careful.  The employees are really nice and down to earth.  There is a nasty duck pond that is really gross but my kid loves looking at the ducks and turtles and other birds. One time my friend said she saw a bobcat in there. Awesome.  Free chips and salsa.  A huge place with lots of options for seating.  They got new wooden chairs that are A MILLION TIMES BETTER than the old metal ones. I really reaalllllllly hope they replace the bar stools next. Those things are the worst! When it's the height of season, don't even try to get a table. It's so busy. Just sit in the bar. The bartenders will take care of you!  A wonderful place to go in the summer when you don't have to wait for a table.

Who knew this little Disneyland-esque restaurant existed in Cave Creek! I've been told by my parents that I came here when I was little but for some reason, I experienced memory-loss, because I don't remember any prior visits. With that being said, I'm mad at my memory for forgetting a cute spot so easily!  I love anyplace with a little atmosphere. The food doesn't even have to be phenomenal if the atmosphere exceeds expectations. When I visit a restaurant, I want to leave reality and enjoy a meal in la-la land. El Encanto provides that.  At this little oasis in the desert, this quaint restaurant is situated amongst cowboy tourist trap central, but there's nothing cowboy about this place. El Encanto provides a fun Mexican meal atmosphere. As you walk in through the courtyard, you notice tables surrounding a large pond of several ducks and swans. Yes swans! As the waitress put it, "it's great for the guests and especially children...but not so great for me who has to feed them!" I'm still not sure of the origin for why the ducks are there but it definitely adds to a atmospheric experience! The restaurant has Mexican tile and decor and it provides a fun experience for families, couples on a date or friends!  The food was definitely above par. The margaritas were tasty! We went with a pitcher since we were going to order several and here's a little tip...the waitress said that three margaritas come in a pitcher, but it definitely came out to be more like 4 (maybe just under). So it's definitely worth ordering a pitcher when you compare the price of a pitcher versus the price of an individual glass.  Second up, the guacamole. Delicious! They put cheese on top and it adds a nice little zing to the creamy guac. For my entree, I went for the Pollo Fundido. Here's the thing. It was delicious. Incredibly delicious. However, it was way to fatty and creamy for my waistline. That being said, it was still deliciously and filling. I could barely eat half of it so it might be worth sharing.  I would definitely make the drive to Cave Creek to visit El Encanto again.

One of the best go to places when you're in Cave Creek. Food is great, Margaritas rock! Got to spice up the hot sauce though, it's pretty mild for the tourists! The turtles and ducks in the pond are the best entertainment LOL

If you're familiar with aviation, you'll be familiar with braking action. For this place I give a "poor" braking action report. I just got back from going here on a Saturday afternoon. The place was busy, but not overly so. We were asked if we'd like a seat next to the pond, and decided that a 4 year old would enjoy the view of the turtles wading gently in the pond, and the ducks doing anything possible to avoid the scorching sun committed to frying their little brains after prolonged exposure.  What was not anticipated, however, was the flys. Are you kidding me? I should not be sitting in a restaurant where I'm about to shell out $50 for lunch and have the pleasure of swatting flys while eating. Iraq? Sure. Afghanistan? Definitely. Mexico? Comes with the turf. North Scottsdale/Cave Creek/ Carefree? WTF.... over?   Also not anticipated was the service. There seems to be a conflict between me and my mate on this one. She goes with "average", I go with "tardy". She's thinking I'm being "harsh". I'm  thinking I'm being fair. That said, I just think that the server was borderline lazy. Asked for the water carafe to be refilled, and someone else ended up bringing it sevvvvvveral minutes later, while the water station was literally across from our table. Asked for our salsa to be refilled, he looked at it, acknowledged and walked away. I made a "bet" that he would forget. I was not let down. Winner winner chicken dinner. But not quite the win I had in mind. This went on with bussing, refills, etc. He seemed just a bit "behind the situation", had poor SA, and was not interested in performing at a high level.   The food was eh. Well. My food was eh. I got the enchilada plate, she ordered the pollo fundito. I liked the fundito. It is Ajo Al's Pollo Con Queso in disguise. It is good, but if faced with Al's or El Encanto, I'll go with Al's every time. The beans were a little heavy on the lard. Like I said, it was just sort of bland-ish all the way around.   Understand, if I were going to Filiberto's, this would be more than adequate food. However, we paid $47 for lunch and dollar for dollar, it sucked.

Youch! Waited for 30 minutes and the place wasn't even busy.. Slow service.. even slower kitchen.. pollo fundido was cold (un-melted cheese, stone cold chicken) and tasted like it had been in the fridge for a while! If the stove is broken or the dishwasher, whatever the problem, you really should communicate that to your guests.  The green pond in the back was kind of different..

We arrived at El Encanto at 7 for our 7:00 reservation and we were seated at 7:30, it would have been longer but we said we would sit inside.  The server was pretty nice and the margaritas were actually pretty good.  The food was about average except the pollo fundido which were delicious.  The fajitas were alright.  I think it would be more enjoyable at daytime as the lighting isn't the greatest and maybe another item would fit better than the fajitas.

Marissa was our server and she was very informative and efficient. The food was very good and we would definitely go back to try something different. Hubby had a corn rice with mahi mahi and I had the very unique shrimp cocktail with a bowl, of albondigas soup. A friend who was with us had rib eye with jalapeo mashed potatoes and he was not impressed. This one is worth trying again, good margaritas, we has prickly pear and peach.

All I have to say is MOLE SAUCE!!!!! It was the best I have ever had! The small portion of the mole chicken enchilada was PERFECT before a fun night out in Cave Creek. The Prickly Pear Marg was awesome as well! Definitely stop in if you are in town and want Mexican Food!

this place has a very cool layout. entering from the street, it opens up wide with a wrap around patio, lots of shade from structures and trees, cool foliage, and even a big duck pond with lots of ducks, swans, and turtles.   we were seated immediately and served some very tasty, crispy chips and 3 types of salsa's. i had 2 of the house margaritas which i thought were so good, they went down too easily. we split a green chile tamale appetizer, 1 each, and they were surprisingly very filling and packed with chiles. we also split a fish taco plate, which was mediocre and a little high priced for only 2 tacos with one tiny sliver of fish inside.   the black beans and rice were cooked well and had a great flavor. for out 2 plates, 2 margaritas, and 2 beers, we paid about 50 bucks with tip. our sever, poor guy, didn't smile once and although prompt, was obviously not happy to be at work today.   when the folks come to town, we might have to venture out this way again.

This place has gone downhill. The rumor is that Immigration raided the place and took the cooks away. Since then the menu has been reduced to a few basic offerings. Too bad, as the setting is kinda cool, but you could find better.

Ambiance? Five stars. A duck/turtle pond in the middle of a beautiful spot? The architecture alone is worth going for. Kids love it. Very romantic. Good margaritas.  The food? Well, I'll just preface this by saying we had just gotten back from Mexico. So we love Mexican food and had some really amazing, authentic meals while we were there.  The food is.....good. Probably the best thing on the menu is the Pollo Fundido. It's like a chicken stuffed chimichanga (deep fried!) and served with this amazing creamy sauce. It's quite tasty. The sampler is also a great way to try several things and is a lot for two people to share. The lunch portions are moderately priced and a petite portion, so a nice option if you're not starving. Our last server, Jill was amazing.

El Encanto will always have a special place in my heart since this is where my husband and I had our wedding back in 2006.  It was our favorite restaurant which also happened to be visually beautiful and so unique.  We love the food, the pollo fundido is the best Ive ever had, the margaritas are outstanding (we had a margarita fountain at the wedding, so fun)  Everything Ive eaten there has been great and the atmosphere is so nice especially if you have opportubity to sit outside.  This was always our go to place for out of town guests as well.
Loved the patio! Food was good. It was super busy, but they had a great 'waiting lounge' close to the bar, that you can get a margarita and chips and salsa while you wait

The Lamb Barbacoa was one of the best dishes I've ever had in any Mexican restaurant, anywhere!   The lamb was tender and without any fat or gristle (rare for lamb dishes), and the sauce was fabulous. ALL the items in the dish were just right also.  I ordered a roasted Jalapeno on the side, which was delightful.   The chips and salsa were some of the best also (thin chips, and medium, hot and green sauces)  The setting is cool.  We sat overlooking the 'duck pond' watching terrapins or turtles or whatever they are. A great lunchtime experience!  I wonder what it's like at night ...!  I just took at look at the 'take out' menu, and it shows that they have two other locations - one in Fountain Hills ... so I'll try the FH location next!

Updated, June 2016:  Stay away in the summer, low staff, quality of food diminshes.   I have been here a handful of times and my most recent visit was very good!  I enjoy the variety of salsas provided with the chips and the chips are tasty and not oily like many Mexican food restaurants.  I also appreciate being able to order a small or large dinner plate for the items I enjoy eating.  Sometimes a small plate is just enough so I don't have to order a big plate of food that I end up taking home and not eating after I paid for it, so a nice option.  The restaurant itself it not like any other and is truly an enjoyable atmosphere.  If you have out of town guests, this is a great place especially when the weather is nice and you can sit outside next to the small water pond and enjoy the AZ climate and fresh air.

We love taking out-of-town guests to El Encanto for the "experience".  Charming, funky Mexican patio feel (complete with a pond filled with duck, geese and turtles), in general the staff is great (we have had one or two surly servers in the past, but we never see them again, so evidently management takes care of this) a mariachi band or guitarist strolling amongst the tables (my only issue with that is what's the etiquette?  Should we stop eating and look attentive when they stand at our tableside and play?  Do we tip?)  And the food is GOOD!  I love the three sauces that they bring to the table with chips---just pour those into a soup bowl and give me a spoon.  Chips are typical Mex restaurant fare---a little greasy and tasteless---probably out of a box from Chicago.  We haven't had a unenjoyable meal there yet, although I wish they served a vegetarian version of a chile relleno---why do people insist on ruining cheesy goodness with meat?  But maybe I just need to ask.  DH loves the Pollo Fundido and the Carne Asada.  I am also a fan of the Enchilada de Pollo con Mole.  It's fun casual, and come hungry!

Great place! Great atmosphere. Great service. Great prices and... great drinks!!! Plus it's in Cave Creek what more reason do you need to go. It's also fun that you can sit outside if your in the mood and if there's a chill they provide these great hand made blankets. The live musicians walking around is super cool too. Get the Guacamole.....

I'd like to know who voted this place as having the best Margarita? Um,  that didn't even come close to even being good. When you can see clear through the glass and it has absolutely no color then that's not a good margarita. The Pollo Fundido is probably the best thing that they have on the menu and the salsa is good but it's not that good. The atmosphere is really great but I think they need a little work on the drinks. I'm giving it three stars because the food is good.
Great atmosphere. A bit far for us, but the margaritas are super! The food is great as well. Good place to take family or a group of friends.

Our meal at El Encanto in Cave Creek was a disappointment to say the least. Other than the lakeside ambience, I would not recommend this restaurant to my worst enemy. We ordered the fajitas, and honestly, the onions and green peppers were plenteous and tasty, I suppose,  but we had to search for the steak and chicken. The sides and condiments were okay, but nothing to write Home about .  This was a pretty pricey meal, so you hate to leave hungry. Bummer.

Mass produced Slop !  Flavorless.  Presentation lacking !  Don't waste your time.  Had the Seafood enchilada and chicken mole enchilada both were not worth mentioning.  Chips were good, salsa 's were flavorless with a little heat.  I must say nothing on anyone elses plates looked any better.  Waitress didn't really have much of a personality either.  Still left her 20% though.

I come here with the wife often and never leave disappointed.  I always seem to enjoy the fish tacos the best.  They are lighter and you don't leave stuffed because their portions are very big.  One word to the wise is not to order the margarita by the pitcher.  My wife and I did and it doesn't taste better as the drink goes on.  Too watered down and not a good taste.  We also sat inside for the first time and enjoyed it a lot.  Great Mexican place north of the 101!!

I travel to Scottsdale frequently  - 3 times a year and each time I go here to eat lunch/dinner. The service is great. The food is so good and the atmosphere is worth the drive it too.    It's the perfect place to kill an afternoon drinking alcohol, staring at the pond and eating their chicken.     I eat Mexican frequently so for me to rate this place so highly - they had to be good.  If you are on the border about this place - just go- based on the other reviews - you're likely to love it then hate it.
We come here all the time. Every visit more magical than the last. Great food and great service. And this place has an atmosphere that you CANNOT replicate.

What a wonderful atmosphere!  And the service was perfect!  Our waiter was a very pleasant young man named Mike and he made our dining experience a true pleasure.  The only reason we aren't giving the 5th star is because the food was a bit bland compared to the descriptions in the menu.  We'll definitely come back and try again!

The food was really good and service was excellent.. one problem was a couple we were with we're charged for every refill for their drinks of cola and Ice-T.. ended up being almost $10 for the drinks only one time a refill was ask for.. the rest report automatically by our server... I was so happy my hubby and I just got water.. I thought that was ridiculously expensive and should have been warned that refills were extra...

(Lyrics - Counting Crows - A Long December)  At El Encanto and there's reason to believe Maybe this meal will better than I had I can't remember the last drink that I had as I was eating Now the service go by so fast  And it's one more day up in Cave Creek And it's one more order of Fundidos If you think that I could be Yelping, I wish you would   El Encanto is a long staple of the Cave Creek area.  Nestle along side all the biker bars and niknac shops; El Encanto brings out some pretty darn good Mexican food.  I came here after a short hike with some friends.  We went to the bar for some Bloody Marys to start, which was okay; I didn't really care for the mix.  As we sat I ordered a beer and enjoyed the view.  Inside the restaurant is a beautiful pond with some ducks, turtles, and koi fishes.  This would definitely be a romantic setting during the evenings!    I continue to ordered my meal and my friend recommended the Pollo Fundido; what appears to me as a chicken chimichanga doused with warm cheese on a bed of Mexican rice.  Overall, the dish was definitely cheesy!  The chicken was still warm to the bite as it well wrapped with a tad bit of crispiness while the oozing cheese soften it slowly.  To be honest, not my cup of tea, though I can eat cheese; just not this much.  I wanted some spice to give it another element; maybe some peppers.    In the end, El Encanto is quite a drive for me, but they have 2 other locations around the valley.  I think it's definitely a nice date night to check out the view and have some wine.  As for the food; it's up to your palate.  I for one, will keep trying! - Enjoy!
We love the plaza-type environment, watching ducks in the pond. Food is good. We've been here several times and keep coming back.

Like general Mexican vibe but they need to CLEAN this place..looked grungy and unhealthy/unclean. Service slow and indifferent to their patrons. Perhaps the snowbird influx has spoiled management. Get real people..the REST of us eat out ALL year..not just Nov-March!

We were taken there by friends who are local to the area. The venue is perfect for a visitor destination. Beautiful little pond in the center of outdoor dining area.   Sadly the Sunday buffet was totally lacking. Little choice and poor quality. Did not feel very clean.  Indifferent service.   Bill for four buffets was $100.00 with tip.   Plates served from the menu looked pretty routine at nearby tables. Enchiladas, rice and beans. Rice, beans and enchiladas.   Sure hope this is not the best Carefree has to offer. It's a long drive and top dollar for so-so Mexican food.
The food was really tasty and a pretty good value. The mole reminds me of my mom's because it is sweet. My bffs carnitas burrito was good too. I would come back again.

Everything here is AMAZING.  The food, the service, and especially the scenery if you sit by the duck pond!  I've been all over Mexico, and El Encanto is some of the best Mexican food I've ever had.  It is unbelievably authentic.  This is a great date place, or a place to take out-of-towners, or  place to go to "just because"!  Well worth the drive from Phoenix!
Good food, great atmosphere. Everyone raves over the pollo fundido...its awesome, but the rest of the food is great too. Cheese enchiladas are bomb!!

First time visiting the restaurant last night. Can also say it will probably be my last.  My complaint with this place involved the service, the prices and the quality of the food. We had some family in town and had just finished with an event nearby. Someone suggested we try El Encanto for dinner. After arriving we waited about 20 minutes for our table for 10 which is understandable on a Saturday night. When we were brought to our table we were promptly brought waters and chips & salsa by the bussers. But we had to wait at least 10 minutes for the server to take our drink order and wait an additional 15 minutes before our drinks were delivered.  We ordered our food, it came out in a reasonable amount of time, but my entree was cold. I ordered the pollo con mole enchiladas which though they tasted ok, they were cold. This entree was $14.99 My boyfriend had the "special" 5 jumbo shrimp swimming in some chipotle sauce served with veggies and rice. $17.99 Thank god we waited so long for our drinks we filled up on chips and dip.  Then the server had a difficult time splitting our check. We were told the computer wouldn't allow him to split the check any further and everyone's tickets were messed up. He probably should have suspected or at least asked at the beginning if the check was to be split.  On top of it all he added a 20% gratuity.   All in all, I felt that this place was over priced, the service was slow, the food was served cold and the portions did not equal the pricetag. Also, not very accommodating to large party's. One positive thing I can report is that the house margarita was quite tasty - though it was mostly ice.

Was so impressed by this restaurant, and will come back frequently! Staff was friendly and helped me decide my meal ( I couldn't decide because everything looked amazing) and her recommendations disappoint! You can tell they take great pride in their food and business. Authentic food, and amazing atmosphere. Planning to go back again soon!
AWESOME food, great service, atmosphere was amazing as well ! I would go here on a date night or take family.. All around, it's a pleasant atmosphere... Loved it !

My whole family was together for the first time in almost four years for my brother's college graduation, and it was a great last-night-in-town dinner.   Service was excellent, ambiance was great. We were greeted immediately after a short walk through the outdoor dining section and past the charming man-made duck pond, and seated immediately after. Our server, Max, had taken our drink orders and brought water and chips within a minute of our settling in. He also took pictures of the whole family together and was friendly and laughed with us.   The food was great -- the recommendations for the pollo fundito are worth listening to! That's what I had, and it was amazing. I was a little unsure about the cream cheese jalapeo sauce before it arrived, as I'm not a huge fan of jalapeos, but Max assured me it was to my tastes, and he was right! I'm desperately searching for good recipes to recreate it when I'm back home in Seattle.  Everyone else at my table had pitchers of the house margaritas, which even I sampled and enjoyed, despite margaritas not being my drink of choice. I had one (well, not just ONE) of the best strawberry daquiris I've ever had.  But here's where El Encanto loses one star. My brother was unimpressed with the slightly hefty price of his pretty small burrito, even though he enjoyed it. Also, my father's beef fajitas didn't come with cheese, and only had two tortillas -- though he did get more when he asked. Not sure if there was an extra charge, but I don't think there was.   Toward the end of the meal, the owner or a manager (Bill), also checked on us, which I always appreciate on a busy Saturday night dinner.   In addition, Robin (one of the hostesses? A manager? She was standing at the hostess station when we walked in and chatted briefly with my mother while our waiter asked the rest of us where we wanted to sit.) gave us a HUGE free fried ice cream to celebrate my brother's graduation. It was delicious and easily enough for all five of us to share after such a huge dinner.   Also the duck pond was awesome! We sat next to the windows with a great view of the ducks, geese, and turtles! The overall atmosphere was pleasant, and the decor was charming, though noise carries inside, and as the dining room filled up, the volume went up. If you want an intimate and quiet dinner, be sure to go in before the big rush and ask to be seated away from the entrance -- outside with the duck pond understandably  attracts the families with loud children.   If I ever find myself in Cave Creek again, I would definitely eat at El Encanto again! I wish I could get Mexican food like this back home in Seattle. Guess I'll have to make it myself.
Been going here for 20'years and just keeps getting better. Highly recommend to anybody in the area, especially if looking for a good place and are from out of town!

We have been to El Encanto many times and have usually enjoyed the food, although never really raved about it. Tonight was more than a disappointment. The albongas soup although very tasty was barely warm. I ordered steak fajitas. Oh what a disappointment. Over cooked beef, and under cooked vegetables. NO fajitas flavor, no hint of marinade just overdone chewy beef and vegetables barely shown the grill. No wonderful caramelization........no nothing. My husbands a la carte taco (and something else) totally bland and tasteless. Can't even remember what he ate....that's how lacking it was. Sweet and attentive server. The restaurant was slammed and I can only guess the kitchen was in overload  VERY disappointing.

My wife and I followed my folks on Motorcycles to El Encanto.  My folks have raved about this place for a while, so I was expecting a lot - and I was pleasantly surprised! The ambiance is top notch - Very gorgeous inside and out. Huge pond inside with ducks, turtles and fish....Our waitress was very attentive and the food was delicious! Yum!!

Sunday Brunch the worst ever. Few choices. Rice, beans, omelet station, waffles, enchiladas, eggs ranchero, enchiladas, veges. Not able to serve yourself and she asked if I wanted 2 enchiladas they  were cut in 1/3 pieces. Nothing else and I free soda all for $17. we had 2 margaritas and 2 brunches and it was $59 for the variety and qty it was poor to sad. Better off at Taco Bell. and service was very slow considering the place was not busy at all.

One of the most unique places I've been! Very interesting setup, lots of outdoor seating wrapping around a pond. Food was great, I got the pollo fundido and my father ordered the chicken fajitas. Both were great and good portions. Our server was definitely less than impressive but that didn't ruin our experience. I'd definitely come back!!

My favorite Mexican place in the Phoenix metro. Very friendly service and great food. Not even a steak place, but the stuffed poblano Ribeye is the best steak I've had in the Phoenix area. I enjoy the variety of salsas they bring to the table. Another favorite is the polo fundido. My young nephews loved feeding the ducks in the pond. Great patio year round.

While I enjoy the ambiance of El Encanto in Cave Creek, I feel the service is hit or miss and the food is just eh...  I've been on several occasions, most recently this past Sunday.  Perhaps they were short staffed because it was Easter, but we were there for a good 15 minutes before we were acknowledged by our waitress and then it took another 15 to get drinks and we had to request salsa to go with the chips on our table.  Our food took a really long time too...  When you do get your Corona or Margarita, you feel like you're in Mexico - the chips and salsa are addicting!    Go for the ambiance, not the service or the food... and go with a fun group of people!

Food is not bad - not great.  El Encanto continues the PHX trend of nickel and diming customers for chips and salsa.  Party of 5 gets one basket of chips to share - want another basket of chips with your $100 dinner?  Pay up, they say.  Most meals include  either rice or beans - not both.  Birds in your face?  No extra charge.
Awesome setting! Feels like you're in a Mexican resort in a way!   Great variety of food too!   Excellent portions and spot on price.

A. Sunday afternoon drive brought us here for a real get-away from our small world! Wonderful view though reflection less glass to pond and waterfall with ducks and turtles, delicious house margarita, and real, tasty Mexican food.  A great getaway!

Good chips and salsa, like that they give you 3 different salsas. Both their beans are vegetarian, awesome. I recommend the black bean and cheese burrito enchilada style. Some people like the outdoor seating but the smell of the duck pond is pretty sick.

This is one of the prettiest places to dine in the Phoenix Metropolitan area. Someone once told me that historically the place had been a brothel in the 1920's. It has kind of a Shangrila Hacienda feel to it. There is a little pond in the walled courtyard/outide dining area stocked with waterfowl, and on several occasions I have seen a wild Great Blue Heron inside! When my parents came to visit from Massachusetts I chose a hotel destination close to this place because I think it really feels like a vacation in here! The food is pretty good. They have this deep fried Machacca and grilled green onion thing that they serve with warm melted cheese and hot tortillas which is kind of fun for a group. I like the Rellenos here. They have picadillo in them. The bar area is large with a nice fireplace and well stocked with a good roasted tasting salsa and chips, as well as plenty of icewater pitchers while you sometimes have to wait for your table. Very picturesque and great for photo-ops or possibly a wedding party or something. Not the most incredible food on earth, but neither is it ever disappointing, and the view here at sunset is like magic.

We arrived and were given a wait time for 15 minutes, my guest, mother and I heard this as well for our small group of three for first come first serve seating. We saw groups move as well. When I asked to verify the wait time we were told an additional 35 minutes. Terrible service and first experience.

Neat place.  But you must have reservations.  Wow, lots of people, especially on a nice weekend.  We didn't reserve and waited an hour for a table.  Unique water feature, very large restaurant.  Food was really good, but I'm not a mexican food snob, so others may have opinions as to better.  Well worth the price, which seemed reasonable.  I recommend, but again, call ahead!

We just keep coming back to it, even when it's almost a 30 minute drive from our house. Love their coctel de camarones (shrimp cocktail) - great appetizer to start off with. Always fresh and plenty of shrimp, and you get a huge basket of chips & 3 kinds of salsa on the side, which are pretty yummy. We usually share an entre since their portions are really healthy sized and we can barely even finish one between the two of us. Last time we shared the Chicken Queso Fundido, super cheese and delicious. Love the view when sitting nearby the surrounding tables by the pond, great service and would definitely go back a few more times!

POLLO FUNDIDO PLEEEEEEEASE!  I'm surprised by some of the negative reviews for El Encanto. I would agree that it can be somewhat pricey and the birds can be a bit much (especially when people feel the need to feed them from their tables), but I actually really like this place.   My boyfriend brought me here when we first started dating and we come back on a regular basis. The service isn't always great, but they do their jobs and I've never had any big problems. I love the unique atmosphere here, even if it is a tad bit cheesy. It is completely unexpected in the middle of the country-western Cave Creek. The inside of the restaurant is starting to look a bit run-down, but the old vibe kind of lends itself to a somewhat authentic Mexican feel. I particularly like getting a table outside during the warmer months, or inside by their floor-to-ceiling windows. It's also a fun place to bring out-of-town guests.   I have to admit that I have only ordered one meal here: Pollo Fundido. It is one of my favorite meals of all time and I crave it on a regular basis. It is so good that it almost bumped them up to 4 stars. I don't even need to look at a menu. Their chips and salsa are also decent and I know my boyfriend likes their fish tacos.   All in all, El Encanto is by no means a place to rave about, but I am happy to make the trip up from time to time. The Pollo Fundido totally makes the drive worth it.

I really really want to love this restaurant.  It is a really neat little place with a great atmosphere. It is right by our house.  The only problem is that the food never tastes the same.  One time the burrito is simply amazing.  The next time we go it's awful!  More time than not the house margarita tastes like dish soap.
The worst Mexican food ever eaten so over rated. Setting is nice nothing tasted good.

Love taking out of town guests to this place-the ambiance-funky, different, huge space with a very old Mexican vibe. The food is just okay-but drinks and atmosphere are so great that it makes up for the difference. Huge pond with fish in the center of the restaurant, lots of old Mexican tiles, iron patio furniture and just a really nice atmosphere for a family gathering or celebration. Highly recommended if you are looking for a place with character and just a little bit different than the usual mall restaurant.

This place is great.  If you love to sit outdoors and enjoy some wildlife you will defiently want to check this place out.  You must also get a pitcher of the frozen margaritas.  You will feel good after just one glass.  The steak fajitas rock too.  Great atmosphere, great service.  Would recommend to anyone.

Ugh.  Here on Good Friday and the restaurant wasn't very busy, but we were seated for easily 10 minutes and the host brought chips, but we never met a server -although several were around.   A table that arrived after us was greeted before we were and, ultimately, we decided to leave.   We have had great experiences at both the original El Encanto and El Encanto Dos so this was a major disappointment.
Yum, best fajitas ever! Great atmosphere, music, location by the aquarium.  Will go back for sure!

Not the best service-  We were not greeted once were seated at out table or offered drinks till 10 minutes. I had to get the manager's attention, who could not find our waiter. The manager got our drinks and checked us out.   Food- Decent selection of salsas, however the hips would've been better if they were warm. Frijolles Charra were much spicier than indicted on the menu, so watch out.   Atmosphere- One OF THE BEST
3 out of 4 of us got one of their specialties, pollo funtado, and we all loved it.  The sopapillas are a great desert to share.
This is one of my favorite places to grab Mexican food.  The food is good and it is fun to see the ducks and turtles!

We hit this place periodically.  The food is good and the service is typically good.  It's very popular to sit out on the patio during the winter and spring months in Phoenix,  Pollo Fundido is one of our favorites and I also love the mole enchiladas (in fact, I had some just last night!!).    One point of irritation - when booking a reservation for a party of 12, we were told that there was a 2-hour limit on the table.  I get it, you want to turn over tables, etc. - but it does not make guests (including a large group who are coming to spend money in your restaurant) very welcome.  Agree or not, it left us feeling kind of like we were told to eat and then get the hell out.  Unless service is slow, I don't believe I have ever sat in a restaurant for more than 2 hours anyway, but I found that being told that there was a table time limit a bit irritating.   It won't stop me from going back because we love the food and atmosphere.  It's a good place to bring out-of-town guests when they are in Phoenix.
Great atmosphere. Delicious frozen margaritas. Wish the food were a bit better and they had healthier options
So totally average at best.  Service was really bad and have had better Mexican food at taco bell

First time here.  Pleasantly surprised with the combination of great food, excellent service and overall ambiance which includes live music provided by an accomplished guitarist.  My table had a view of the patio area and a pond with water features along with a family of ducks. Definitely a place to go go for that special occasion.

Food is good enough, but the lack of cleanliness of the restaurant leaves me grossed out. We've been there multiple times where the silverware or plates look dirty. Also, when you ask for a straw the server will bring it out to you in their hands. So gross!
One of top 3 Mexican food restaurants I've been to. Awesome margaritas and enchiladas. Can't wait to go back.

I don't know how this place runs normally, but it was quite a nice experience this weekend when we went for a wedding. The food was great, and its really amenable to kids since there is a duck pond with a quarter machine for the food.  Plenty of parking.

We went there for Sunday brunch. You can't order from the menu Sunday morning so it's either the Sunday brunch buffet or ... go somewhere else to eat. It's $15 per person for the buffet and there's a nice selection. The huevos rancheros was pretty good but a little bland as was the chorizo & eggs scramble. I suspect it's for the typical tourist's palate. The salsas and pico de gallo also had little or no bite. The food is filling and there's fruit, breads, flan and even salad to choose from so there was variety. It's a little expensive for what you get I think. And it would all be pretty ordinary if not for the big pond with green water with ducks and turtles that contributed to the ambiance. (Don't look too closely into the water because there are gross things in there that will make you lose your appetite.)   We sat out on the patio, the weather was nice and mild and the pond was "interesting" and despite the color, not smelly. I enjoyed the live music too. I've never been here for happy hour but I suspect having drinks here is fun. I'd probably come here again for the brunch since the food is predictable and plentiful and the location is convenient for us. If you go, just don't expect it to be anything but average.

Friendly staff, clean atmosphere. Good tasting food.   Wifey had the cheese enchilada. I took the safe route and ordered the beef fajitas. I've been to mexican owned restaurants, and the fajitas at El Encanto have been the most flavorful. Tender beef with nicely spiced veggies.  Our server, Alexander, even took the liberty to get my margarita fixed. I didnt even have to ask.

Stopped in here for a margarita and was hoping for an appetizer of ceviche. Unfortunately they didn't have ceviche on the menu so we opted for the chips and salsa and . They came with 3 different salsas and were fine. The margaritas on the other hand were absolutely horrible. Apparently they are pre-made and they were so sweet I couldn't even drink mine. When I requested a glass of wine instead the bartender offered to make me another one (by hand this time) and even it was not very good. The place was pretty empty and I was surprised that being the only ones at the bar we still had to get the attention of the bartender each time. Don't think we will return. I did like the sink in the women's restroom though!
Good food.  Waitress refilled our drinks (soda & an iced tea)  without us asking.  Was charged $2.50 for each refill!

We typically love El Encanto and have been there countless times over the past years.  It is one of the "must do" places we take all of our out of town guests.  Service is typically outstanding.  It is by far one of the most unique places in the Valley when it comes to ambiance and a place I thoroughly enjoyed showing guests.    So here is why I am beyond disgusted by everything El Encanto right now.  We had RESERVATIONS for Saturday night (middle of summer, although it has taken me a little time to sit down and not leave a scathing biased review).  Upon showing up, they made us wait for more than an hour before they suggested that we move to the waiting room.  We eventually moved into the side waiting room out of the way and out of sight.  Somewhere along the way they informed us (way after the fact) that we would have a limited menu with 5 total food choices to select from due to the size of our party.    After waiting for more than an hour, when one of the members of our party went to find out how much longer, they told us our reservations were cancelled.  The manager refused to talk to us and they would not even make eye-contact with us.  Needless to say, El Encanto lost more than a large party that night.  I will not go back again anytime soon nor will I recommend this place to others moving forward.  This was beyond bad business and tacky.  It pains me to share this but bad business is bad business.

Good food using fresh ingredients. Definitely a unique dining experience. Mexican architecture with trees growing through walls, a pond with ducks in the middle of restaurant, outdoor seating inside!? We did experience a brief windstorm that forced us to cover our food from dirt and dust, nevertheless, our party of five definitely enjoyed the dining experience.

Great margaritas. Nice atmosphere with seating outside around a small pond. Service was good.   I ordered a chimichanga with extra rice and shredded beef. The beef was ok but they need to Dd cheese and possibly some sort of sauce. This was the first chimi I've had that was dry.   Give it a shot. Love the atmosphere.

The absolute BEST mexican food I have had, ever! And that's saying alot from someone who was born and raised in Texas. Not only was the food great, but it was set in a terrific atmosphere. The restuarant was built around a lake where ducks hang out while you dine. This is a must visit if you are ever in the Phoenix area.

This is place is amazing. I have only been to the el ecanto dos up until this point. The original el ecanto is beautiful and surprising, it has a large pond with ducks and the seating area is huge.  The waiter came very promtly, kept out chips and salsa full. Our food came out very quickly, I ordered the pollo fundido and I have to say I have been dreaming about it since, so delicious!  The ambiance was awesome and the people there were great, definately check this place out.

They are upstairs in the development surrounding Odysea.  The food is tasty and the drinks are well mixed.  We went in when they were having a free Saturday evening children's movie in the open area so it was a little loud to sit on the patio.  When we got there only a couple of tables were occupied.  By the time we left it was over half full.  It's good to see they are attracting traffic.  We had the charro dip, meatball soup and rellenos.  The starters with chips are filling.  I love their lamb and their skirt steak with potatoes is very good.  It's easy to park in the back parking lot and walk directly to the restaurant.  If you're in the area near Talking Stick it's a great place to check out.

If any one knows of a restaurant in the PNW like this with the amazing pollo fundido on the menu pleaaaaaaaase let me know!!!! I have had this once and haven't stopped thinking about the food or scenery since! I have googled every single Mexican Food restaurant in Oregon and have yet to find anything like this dish. My dad may live in Arizona but the reason I come back next time is for this restaurant!!!

All the other nearby restaurants were closed so we decided to give this a try. An unexpected great find! We were lucky.  I love good mole.   Unfortunately it is hard to find on many menus.  And even when I find a Mexican restaurant that has mole it is often too bitter for me.    I asked the server what he thought in terms of whether the mole sauce was bitter or not.  On his own suggestion he went to the kitchen and brought me a side so I could taste it and see if I liked it. I loved it! I really enjoyed not only the enchiladas with mole but also fantastic service from the moment we walked in.

My favorite Mexican restaurant in Arizona is El Encanto.  I enjoy the location - Carefree is awesome - and they have done a nice job with the indoor / outdoor areas.  The margaritas seemed a bit shy of liquor, but the food is amazing.  The tortilla chips are not greasy and the three salsas tasty.  The fundido is excellent and portions are plentiful.  I wish they had this restaurant in St. Louis.

Ambience is very casual, wear whatever.  The food is really, very good.   The service was not bad.  However, the portion size and the drinks are measured tightly and aren't worth the money. We ordered the pitcher of margaritas twice ( Cadillac and nasty) they were mostly ice.  They bring your cups filled with ice as well.  So in reality you end up with 2 drinks. When asked about this the server said its all measured if you ask for less ice the pitcher won't be full.  We also ordered the lamb there was five 1/2"X 1/2" cubes of lamb the rest was sauce and a few floating veggies.  Delicious but measured like you're in a socialist camp. Both not really worth the money, but good.  This was the consensus of the 6 of us at the table.

Grew up in this old western town, love the service, food, and beautiful latin atmosphere.  This place is perfect for a typical night date or even a nice afternoon delight! I would suggest ordering the Pollo Fundito, it is the most popular item to order on the menu!  The charm and unique layout of this restaurant is perfect for any occasion.
Best Mexican food & pitcher of Margaritas is a must here!!! Best margarita you will ever have.. Promise!!!

Can I just say I love El Encanto.  I took clients there for lunch the other day.  They are down for the 'Season' from Chicago.  They were just enamored by the atmosphere.  Yes the birds can be bothersome, so don't sit by the pond!  At any rate, the service is always good, the food is fresh and piping HOT.    My favorites are the Chili Verde and the Pollo Fundito!  YUMM!  The Chili Verde is slow roasted pork smothered with green chili...so good!  The Pollo Fundito is a chicken burrito smothered in queso blanco and run under the broiler...double YUMM.  It's a bit kitchy, but the service is consistent, the food fresh and tasty, and the whole El Encanto story is charming.  When you are in Cave Creek, Go, no RUN to El Encanto and don't forget the margaritas...so good!
Great salsa and margaritas. I am definitely going back if I am ever in the area again. Amazing inside!

I am thinking that the draw to this place is the pond with turtles, ducks and fish.  The water is a bit scummy but charming.  The food is average, not especially tasteful nor spicy.  It is good for atmosphere.  My hubby even left some food on his plate which is unusual.  Breakfast is better a lunch or dinner meal is questionable.

the first thing that hits you as you walk into this vast size restaurant, is the smell of dirty indoor/outdoor pond.  i could see how some might find it cute, but it was smelly and dirty.  we got a nice  indoor table for 4 with a view of said pond. we paid extra for top tequila in margaritas - disappointingly warm and tasteless.  food portion of taco bowl, so small it's ridiculous - but steak in it was fabulous.  chicken not so much.  steak fajitas amazing (same steak).  guac. and salsas bland and meh... nice server/man.

Came in for Father's Day lunch. Being the second time here it gets worse with each visit. I like a ambiance but the food can't improve the place. The bill for 3 came to $72.00 seems to me that they need to bring up the quality to match the price.

Good food, but the service was excellent! Jamie was very friendly, always kept the chips and drinks coming, checked up on us every once in a while and put up with our crazy kids! Great representation of the business!

My friends and I stopped by after a visit to the Aquarium. It was a restaurant that was open and we were a little skeptical at first. Because there was hardly anybody else in there. I think this was because they were about to close. The wait staff was extremely friendly and wasn't upset that we came in an hour prior to closing. We sat down and took a look at the menu and were instantly intrigued. There was an appetizer that had sheet melted cheese and shredded beef on top of it that was absolutely phenomenal. A friend ordered the pollo fundido and loved it.  I ordered the carnitas burrito and it was amazing. And another friend ordered the green chili burro and it was great. The sauces that came out with the chip we're okay but left a lot to be desired as far as flavor. We had about three baskets of chips before dinner came so by the time our food was there we couldn't eat it all. I would most definitely recommend coming to this restaurant especially if you order the melted cheese appetizer.

My family went to a late-night wedding rehearsal dinner here, served buffet-style. Our rather large party was seated on the patio. The kids had a blast, feeding the ducks and fish. While the pond was a bit... 'pond-y' smelling, I guess - it IS summer... it wasn't obnoxious and did not reach our tables. It was a very relaxing and inviting atmosphere.   Chips and salsa were ok, as were the salad, and the small tastes I took of the enchiladas and tacos. The chicken & steak fajita meat were awesome. I had to break my low-carb resolve to have some of the pollo fundido, though, and was glad that I did. It was really, really good. Really good.   Service was excellent. I've read the other reviews, where service is frequently panned. Our experience may have been better, since we had dedicated servers. They were on the ball, though.   Good tourista place, and I hear they do a pretty nice breakfast. Not really sure I'd consider it romantic, but could be, for some people. I'd take the fam again, when we're up in that neck of the woods.

I'm giving this 5 stars purely for the reason that there's a duck pond in the middle of the restaurant which keeps my kids entertained while my husband and I finish our meals. The food is good too. Hubby loves the fish tacos and you can't go wrong with the burritos! They have fries and chicken strips for the kids that aren't quite into beans and rice yet. We come here at least once a month!

Believe it or not, hard to find a good Mexican Restaurant in the Phoenix Area.  I think I found one here!  The decor was great!  Beautiful pond and geese with the authentic Mexican blankets and tile.  It was like Wonka's Chocolate Factory...  Looked small from the outside then opened to this huge area on the inside!  I ordered the tequila shrimp dish.  5 or so big shrimp and yummy veggies on the side.  3 different salsa types with hot chips.  Service was average + but not out of this world.  Prices were reasonable I guess...  Could always be a bit lower, especially with this location being a ways out.  It was pretty full on a Thursday night, however.  After I finished my meal, I understood why!
A savory meal, which was reasonably priced. The small enchilada dinner ($10) was portioned larger than expected.  Every item was tasty and not overtly greasy.

My family and I just Celebrated my Mom's Birthday at this Restaurant, we have been here many times before, we love the Ambiance, and the food is pretty good,  I got the abondigas soup, it was just ok, the Chicken & Steak  fajitas were good, their enchiladas were just ok, also!  Our mistake is that we didn't make a Reservation, and were told we would have a hour and a half wait to sit outside, so we decided to be seated inside, they asked us if our entire party was there, I said no, that they would be here shortly, I was told we could not be seated, because our entire party was not here, I have never been to a restaurant where they couldn't seat us until everyone in our party had arrived, normally they ask you if you would like to be seated now or wait, we also were told our party of 7 would not be able to sit together, we would have to sit at tables across, which did not make any sense!   Luckily, there was a couple that left a table that accommodated 7 people so we were all able to sit together.this is a beautiful Restaurant, it is a shame they were not accommodating for our large party, our waiter did make up for some of our Dissapointment !

Ive been coming to this place since 1995, sure places change a little but whenever I go I always get a shredded beef chimchunga, even though they took it off the menu they still make it, all you have to do is ask :)  ducks are friendly and sometimes you see turtles in the pond which is really cool for kids.  sitting inside by the large windows is very interesting especially if its sunny the water just glistens into the windows while youre eating.  They do have a nice waiting area outside with a fire pit they sometimes light if its hilly out during the winter or nighttime.    Drinks are hard which I like, I hate going some place, paying for a drink and getting some watered down thing they call a margarita......  Like I said ive been coming here for over 20 years, even when they were remodeling the car inside...this place never disappoints me.   there is misters outside during the summer with added shading to keep the sun off you and there are heaters during the evenings.  great accomodations especially when y late father who was quadriplegic would come they would always be courteous to him and never bat an eyelash when he asked for his food to be put on his plate because it was specific for him to be able to eat..  love this place  fingers crossed I can eventually bring my kids here!!!! :))

LOVE the frozen margaritas. We got the large pitcher and oh my- they were great! Such a unique and fun place to go. A pond on the inside/ patio area. Super authentic looking and nice service. They filled up on a weekday for lunch, so I'm glad we got there closer to 11am. I loved the shrimp tacos I ordered.

This place has seriously gone downhill in the last 10 years. Remember when the menu had some interesting dishes on it and the staff was actually nice? Remember when the salsas actually had some flavor--seriously what is up with the green gunk that they call salsa...what IS that stuff??  Unfortunately, my recent visit ended up with me returning my food to the kitchen...I had to walk it up to the kitchen because our waiter never returned. I was a few bites into eating a taco salad--veggies and beans only--and came across a piece of super-greasy gristle in the grilled onions. Listen--I've worked in a kitchen on a grill--if you don't clean the grill well, you end up giving people crap like what ended up in my salad. It wasn't a piece of meat recently cooked--that gristle had been on the grill for awhile, drenched in oil over and over and moved around on the grill.  So, off I go to the kitchen to complain about the fact that they didn't clean the grill. Finally after standing there for a few minutes, a waiter finally got the manager for me. Guess what the manager said....wait for it.....  "They do their best to clean the grill."  What?? Excuse me??  #1, getting a piece of greasy gristle in your veggie salad is gross, but regardless that's NOT DOING YOUR BEST. Your best is cleaning off the grill! It's called a scraper. Learn how to use it...don't be lazy about scraping the grill. Lazy=crap in people's food. #2, What do you mean they do their best? Do you mean to tell me that you don't have standards of cleanliness back there in the kitchen? (side note...as I was standing there looking into the kitchen, I saw a basket of chips spilled on the floor as well as paper towels strewn under the sink. No one seemed to notice...do these people clean?) #3, Here's what you're supposed to say when someone finds a gross piece of yuck in their food: "I am SO sorry. That is UNACCEPTABLE. I am going to go talk to the kitchen staff RIGHT now.  I will take this off your bill and I will go get a new salad for you. I will watch them make it and I will make sure everything is done right."  FYI--that's not what happened. I didn't eat another bite at the restaurant. I was too grossed out by the filth in the kitchen and in my dish. I will not be going back. Boring/bland menu, inattentive staff, and a dirty kitchen. YUCK

Good food and margaritas. 1st time here. Nice atmosphere. I like that they give you three types of salsa for chips. I had the Plato de Mexicano. Was more food than I needed, but I ate it all. I will be back. They have a duck pond, with turtles and Koi.

Started off rough with a long 45 min wait.  The front staff said they paged us but we never got the buzz.  Asked for immediate seating and the manager. Richard, the manager came to us, listened to my concerns and was apologetic and said he'd make it right.  After a nice recommendation of the carnitas and chicken enchiladas from our very nice server,  Julia, my daughter and I enjoyed the deepfried cinnamon ice cream topped with whipped cream and strawberries.  The bill came minus enough discount that amounted to a full meal.   Way to make our sour start end with a sweet finish!  Thanks, Richard and Julia.  We'll come back soon.

I tend to romanticize Mexico.  It's a little strange I know, but I always feel that Mexico is one huge hacienda style restaurant on the beach just perfect for day drinking.  This is what El Encanto is to me.  What my preconceived notion of what Mexico should be like.  That may make me a backwards American hill billy but so be it.     I enjoy El Encanto.  I do not get to make it up there as often as I would like since It is about 5 miles past ridiculously far, but when i am there I am always glad I went.  This is usually the place I take out of town guests from the East Coast or Midwest.    The food is good.  I usually get the Queso Guillermo (How does my dictionary recognize Guillermo but not Queso?  That's gotta be fixed.)  It is basically boiling cheese with a few spices and some green onion.  You can add shallots and this beef that appears to be shredded beef that has either been dried or fried, and I strongly recommend that you do.  I have had the lamb, which is ridiculously good, the fish tacos, which are not deep fried as most other places are, and the pork, which is pork and I love pork.  I have yet to have anything there that was not delicious.    My main problem with El Encanto happens to be their Margaritas.  You would expect that a great day drinking mexican spot would have great Margaritas right?  Wrong.  Too sweet, pre-made margarita mix.  This is easily remedied by ordering a shot of Don Julio and a Negra Modelo!  All in all definitely worth going to if you are in the area.  Make sure to laugh when your guest asks the waiter if they have fresh duck or turtle soup on the menu.  They will think they are wildly original and witty.

This is one of our favorites.  The foods is great, the service impeccable and the atmosphere feels like you have just stepped into old Mexico.  The kids love the turtles and ducks in the pond.  We take all out of town visitors to El Encanto to enjoy.

Not my favorite place to go. The ducks smell really bad I don't think they ever clean where they poop. There was bird poop all over the table and chairs which the waitress was rude about and said what do you expect it's outside. Really... and I didn't think the food was very good either. Not gonna go back.
Great authentic Mexican food. If you like margaritas then ask for one topped with some don Julio tequila.

Hidden Gem!   So glad we came across this place.  You cannot tell from the outside how unique and cool this place is.  Food was great, atmosphere and decor are spectacular and a great place for kids.   Eat inside or out the view is amazing and service is excellent.  A must try when your in Cave Creek, we often went right bye it, so glad this time we stopped :)

BE AWARE: MY WALLET WAS PICKED OUT OF MY PURSE, SUNDAY 6:30PM 6-5-16. The inside chairs are high and easy to hang a purse on. We were in a party of six and chose to sit inside. There were flies around and we were not comfortable from the onset. We keep thinking we should have left at that time.  There was a Hispanic women about 40 yrs old, about 170 lbs with a very, very heavy set white man with red hair at the table next to us. This is key, since we have since read out on the Police Blotters sites that other victims have reported the seeing a a couple with the same close to them.   The tables are very close here. You will have a hard time moving your chairs, and not bumping the neighboring table. I noticed my wallet was gone when I pick up my purse to leave. Checked with the manager and receptionist, no wallet was turned in. My head was spinning and then started to think, maybe it was at the condo we are renting. Upon returning to the condo, no wallet was there, and we began to make calls and canceled all the cards.   Never put your purse on the chair. On you lap is best. When the food arrived the beans and shrimp were cold. So that was disappointing. The chips and salsa were good. But I think as we were diving into the chips, the theft occurred.   We have reported this to the police. At this point I am rethinking my purse type and looking at getting a wallet that is tethered to to the purse or purse wallet combo that goes cross body. We are vacationing from Seattle. But I have keep passport card separate from my wallet. So we are a bit shaken, but ok. Hope this saves you the same pain.
This is our go to spot for Mexican food, it's very very good and extremely consistent serving excellent food! We typically sit in the bar area where they've got a great bartender named Monica.

I love going to this place. It has a great atmosphere. I always try to sit by the duck pond. My baby, as well as my tablemates, love to watch the ducks and turtles. There is always some drama with the goose and mallards. Its great. It is like watching the discovery channel.  I give the atmosphere 5 stars.   The food is good. Is it the greatest Mexican? No it isn't. The food is probably a 3. It is good Mexican and I enjoy it. The chips and salsa are good because you get 3 different salsas. I have had the salad fresca with shrimp and it was good. I did not think the shrimp was worth it, and would probably just get it plain next time.   If you are in Cave Creek, you should go here or take out of town guests. There is no atmosphere like it. Plus afterwards you can check out the shops across the street.
Pollo fundido and ducks! And turtles. And geese. And duck-geese hybrids. Deese? Gucks? And friendly service.

After our visit to the OdySea Aquarium we stopped here for dinner and let me first start by saying Hostess Devin was awesome. Thanks girls for the good talk while we waited for a table. Devin's great service alone is what can keep tables full here.  Ryan our server was pretty good say well. He made sure that our drinks where filled.  The food was amazing! I can for sure say we will be back.  At the end of our meal it was get to meet Carrie the owner or manager. She was one of the sweetest down to earth owners I have ever met!  Thanks guys!

We waited 55 minutes with at least 10 tables open the entire time, all spaced throughout the restaurant. 4 random ones were open the entire 45 minutes-fully set. It's super annoying to watch as 2 tops or being sat at 6 tops and 4 tops available everywhere. Anyway, hope the food is worth it!

My review seems to be inline with most of everyone. I will say that the Chicken Queso Fundido was pretty damn good and the chips and salsa were ridiculously addicting.  The margarita's were eh not my favorite but it was more less for the ambiance and good company were there for. I've heard positive things about the El Encanto Dos, maybe I'll give that location a try sooner or later- or cut my losses and find a better Mexican establishment in that area.

Honestly this was the worst food and service I have ever had in my life. First when the front hostess sat us, he didn't even give us menus and was kind of rude to us when we came in. We brushed it off and sat down with our kids. They served us our drinks and gave us menus. The waiter was nice, but also seem to be goofing off at the waiter station. Every table that was sat long after us had been served food,drinks, and left before we got our food.  We waited about 45 minutes for our food and when we got it, my chicken was raw and my husband's shrimp was also undercooked. I took two bites and literally went to the bathroom and threw up I was so disgusted. I am not a food snob in any way and usually pretty chill about stuff, but raw chicken is just too much.Thankfully they compted the meal which is the only reason they are getting two stars. Do not come here if you have kids or like good tasting food.

This is one  the worst Mexican food experiences I've ever had. The only thing enjoyable was the physical environment. If not for that, I'd give this place one star.
