The wait staff was kind, but rushed, incredibly inexperienced with basic wait skills and not knowledgeable about Mexican cuisine or Tequila. I felt like I was in a Mexican version of Chuck E Cheese! The food itself was unimaginative, inauthentic, and, though extremely typical, way under par to even the most common chain restaurants. Just an all round bad experience. I guess if you're from somewhere that has few Mexican food offerings, you Might enjoy it. But for better, head to central or south Phoenix.
Great food, Margaritas and ambiance that is fabulous! If you are in Cave Creek you need to stop here and make a memory!

Had the Worst waitress ever by the name of Diana she was beyond rude we wanted to order drinks because two of us wanted to drink and one was a designated driver the manager and the waitress lie to us and said it was a state law that two of us couldn't drink why one was the driver which is totally not true also we tried to let it go OK so we won't drink we said and we started to talk and she interrupted my conversation with my sister and said are you talking about me it got ugly so we asked for another waitress I've beenIn the restaurant business for over 50 years as my sister has for at least 40 the new waitress was very pleasant we ended up giving her a $40 tip on a $44 check I would never go back there again and it's sad because the first time we went we had a lovely experience but not anymore I hope they treat people better than she treated us think twice before you go there

I love places like this, out of the way and unique.  El Encanto has been around for about 20 years. They have a duck pond in the middle of the patio which is pretty cool. They food was decent and the sangria, good.  If I were in Cave Creek again, I'd go back.
Place is very nice. Not a lot of tvs.  Coldest beer this side of the Mason-Dixon Line! Also not lots of tvs!

Quaint cantina situated on Cave Creek Road in Carefree Arizona  A Lovely although quite dirty and smelly pond on the very large patio sets the mood Ducks birds and turtles alight upon the protruding boulders and entertain you as you enjoy the chips n salsa Three types of salsa are served A spicy hot , a mild and a mild green salsa The chips tasted store bought and were slightly stale Happily the first basket is served gratis while subsequent baskets will cost you .99 cents per My husband and I presented promptly at 11:00  Here are some of the highlights I asked what the chefs "Seafood special " (and I am quoting the menu ) was . Today's seafood special is chicken I tuned out the rest of the description entirely because they lost me at the chicken part Husband ordered the Plato de Mexicana  One beef tamale One shredded beef taco  One cheese enchilada  Served with a large pile of refried beans  Sans tortillas No rice is offered The beef smelled off and looked like it was stewed Perhaps made well in advance and left to linger Husband refused it Since the seafood special was chicken and I do not imbibe I ordered a bean tostada with side of guacamole  Beans are not made with lard  Thank you Thank you Thank you Mine was ok Shell was definitely stale but I was so grateful about the lard free beans Lettuce was good  No tomatoes very little cheese A bland affair until I doused it with the array of salsa so kindly provided Very bland indeed but I would perhaps come back with friends and keep trying for that seafood special jackpot to hit This place looks like it would be awesome for friends  cocktails and appetizers  It is certainly worth another try  I truly wish them well

This establishment used to have excellent service and food, but sadly this has not been the case the last few times I have visited El Encanto. I am in no means picky with what I eat, and I am not comparing 5 star meals to a place such as this, but their Plato Burro consisted of a few strands of dry meat shoved into a cold tortilla. The rice was cold, beans microwaved, and the server came around to the table once every twenty minutes or so. The only thing that prevents this place from having 1 star in my book is the pretty duck pond, and their salsa is very good. Avoid this place and head somewhere else if you want good mexican food.

We were taken here by our host in Phoenix.  It's one of the prettiest Mexican restaurants I've been in, with a courtyard surrounding a duck pond (there is a sign requesting you not feed the ducks tortilla chips!).  The margaritas were great and my chicken was excellent, as were my partner's tequila shrimp.  Would definitely go back there if I were to visit Phoenix again.
This restaurant was suggested my the ladies at Cibola Spa in Peoria. Really good food and service, definitely worth the little detour. Thanks for having us!!!
Our neighborhood go to place for Mexican food!!  Always great food and service!  There are vegetarians in our family and they can always find something delicious to eat.
Delicious brunch with a dear longtime friend. Great way to start a Sunday and end a weekend!
Mediocre. Expensive tourist trap. This is not Mexican food. From the chips to the sauce, to the glutinous fish enchilada special, blah.
Polo Fundito with extra sauce! Yum. Every time I come here, this is what I eat. It's hard to stray away from something so good.  The margs are fantastic too!

Great food, great atmosphere. All deserts are made in house. House margaritas are tasty, lacking a lil alcohol but still yummy. It's a rustic yet high quality product in the sleepy western town of cave creek, AZ. Carnitas are my recommendation, your local mexi resturants probably don't slow cook the pork like they should.

We visit this restaurant often.    Visitors from out of town love the atmosphere, especially the ducks.    We were looking for breakfast and wanted to go somewhere different.    We had not tried the brunch and thought it was about time.    The brunch was a good value at $14.95 with a large selection of regular menu favorites and a few added bonuses.    The omelet bar, waffles and fresh fruit were a nice added bonus.    It's a great place to take the kids and grandma.    Enjoy a nice margarita or mimosa with your brunch.

The food here is so good!!! I have never been disappointed. The atmosphere is great, there is a pond and ducks/ outdoor seating. Just remember to arrive early since the wait list tends to get long really fast!

Love the outdoor patio, turtles, ducks birds flying around. The menu has authentic Mexican food that has been great every time. Three kinds of salsa served with chips at your table. Really enjoy the green. Great friendly staff.

Beautiful seating area next to a pond with ducks! Delicious margaritas by the pitcher for a reasonable price. Free chips with three house made salsas that are great. I ordered the enchiladas with red and green sauce - very good. My friend ordered a dish with the white sauce which was amazing! Service was a little spotty.

We somehow end up at El Encanto in Cave Creek at least 3 times a month. It's a great spot for the kids because they love feeding the ducks and watching the turtles. You can buy duck food at the hostess stand for $.50, which the kids love!  They have a ton of large tables so this is a great spot for bigger groups. I would always recommend sitting outside on the patio, inside is just simply not the same. On the weekends and occasional weeknights they have live music and sometimes even dancers.   The food is really basic Mexican food but is very, very good and consistent. The fajitas are done well, the kids love the cheese quesadilla and black beans, and my husband loves just about everything on the menu. Chips and a variety of sauces are served to every table. My only complaint about this restaurant is that the service can be inconsistent. The servers are usually quite slow and forgetful. I'm also not a huge fan of the margaritas here and for a Mexican restaurant that is a huge negative to me. Still, the vibe of this place wins every time and keeps us coming back!

We were told to get the prickly pear margarita and it did not disappoint!  We had to wait a bit since the outdoor patio was closed. But that was a good thing as it was quite chilly outside. One of our party doesn't like very spicy food and the waiter was very accommodating with putting sauces on the side for her.  The food was quick, hot, and delicious.

We stopped in for dinner after going through the aquarium.   It is a new restaurant and thought we would give it a try.  We were rushed to our seats by a woman and when we asked for a booth she just ignored us.  Our server was quick and did well.  The food was awful.   Very dry and not flavorful.   My tamale was gritty,  the rice was dry and hard.  My youngest son had the pollo fundio and his was not bad.  It was the only thing we took home. If you are looking for authentic Mexican food do not stop here.

I've been coming to El Encanto for just about 15 years now and every time I get the same thing!! Two words: Pollo Fundido. Do you love cheese?!? Do you want creamy cheesiness in every delicious bite of your Mexican Euphoria? Don't even look at the menu. The other things worth talking about are the Queso Guillermo appetizer. Of course, more cheesy deliciousness accompanied by dried shredded beef,  pico de gallo, and a few sliced limes.   The salsa is amazing- try not to fill up!! You must save room for a Chocolate chimichanga with Mint Chocolate Chip Ice cream for desert.   Warning: you will go home with an stomach explosion- but consider yourself warned, and it's 100% worth every bite!
This place has really good mexican food and a very nice ambience.

This place is absolutely amazing. The service is fantastic, and the manager, Robin, is knowledgable and committed to excellent service. We had a relatively new server, Max, who absolutely rocked it. He is sensitive to food allergies and knows how and when to ask the right questions. He also knows when not to answer if he doesn't know the answer and will consult the a management to make sure his response is accurate. We were a party of 6 with 3 kids in tow and we all had a blast! Between the great food, the excellent vibe, the awesome service, and the hilarious ducks and turtles, we were one happy party. We will certainly be back for more very soon. Highly recommended to all!!!
Might be good for tourists but worst Mexican food and Margaritas I've ever had. I  will stick to making our own at home.

Been there a couple of times when we've been down to visit. Great food and we love the patio. Dos is good too and last time we were there they still had their amazing appetizer platter, which the original does not have. Atmostphere at Dos is not as nice though.

Nice patio, and interesting salsa with the chips while you wait for your meal, but I can't believe what we got for $70: Four $7 margaritas that had no trace of alcohol and three forgettable tacos. Plus we were charged extra for a side of rice ... Rice and beans are standard sides in Tex-Mex and don't cost extra. That's the way it should be.

They have been here forever and my family and I love the food. There is something for everyone and a great duck pond for the kids. The frozen margaritas are phenomenal and the manager Robin is as sweet as they come. El Encanto feels like going to grandma's house for Sunday dinner without the work. PS. Grandma loves it too!!!

I'm perplexed by all of the 4+ star reviews for this restaurant.  We were seated on the patio, which was nice.  The food was not impressive at all.  The Pollo Fundido that everyone raves about was dry and there wasn't enough of the jalapeno cream sauce.  I was dissapointed that when my daughter found hair in her food, they still charged us for the meal because they remade her plate.  The problem however, was my daughter had lost her appetite from seeing the hair and couldn't eat her food anyways.    My husband ordered the lamb stew.  The sauce was seasoned well, but the lamb was very dry, just like my plate.  This restaurant was packed, so people must have good experiences here, but as for our family, we won't go back.

The food is great ( I love the Chicken Mole), the margaritas very good, and the service fantastic. One issue was pointed out to the waiter with one meal, the manager and waiter went well above expectations to make things right. I always recommend this restaurant to our friends and family.

After going thru the Town Dump in Cave Creek, AZ we were tired and needed a break. So we stopped at this restaurant, which also has one in Fountain Hills, to quench our thirst and nibble on something. There was four of us so we ordered a pitcher of Corona, margarita for the gals and chips, salsa and guacamole. What made this four star was our barrister, Jennifer, who was so busy but made the time to tend tour needs. She had attest personality and made our visit enjoyable.

another weekend, another group of visitors and once again we found ourselves in Cave Creek.  The rodeo was in town so it was super busy.  This restaurant is situated on a man made pond with big geese. The patio is fantastic, but the wait was too long for our hungry selves and we had a rodeo to get to, so we sat inside. Plus, Kentucky was playing their way to the Final four... no way I was missing that!  Our server was extremely professional, very outgoing and fantastic.  There was something weird in our chip basket and he made a point to find out what it was (just some carnitas meat that got thrown into the fryer, no biggie) and he made to sure explain.    the frozen prickly pear margaritas?  Get them.  I had the carne asada tacos and and they were delicious.  A friend had the fried shrimp tacos, also delicious.  Another friend had the pollo mole... YUM!!  REALLY good mole there.  The restaurant offers half portions, which is much appreciated.    In all, this is a fantatic mexican restaurant with great scenery, great drinks and food, excellent service !

We were in Cave Creek visiting around town when we stumbled on this adorable little restaurant. The entrance was very inviting, and while we were looking at the menu we noticed the lovely outdoor seating. It was a fairly short wait for a Saturday, and we were able to sit in the nice outdoor seating! We chose some drinks, the guacamole, chips and fajitas. It wasn't a very long wait at all. It was a great meal and nice ambiance, we will be back the next time we are in the area. I will say we got so distracted by taking photos near the entrance for Instagram we forgot our credit cards and to sign the bill! We are so sorry about that once again, I can't believe that happened! We will bring back more friends and family to make up for it next time.

Ambiance is excellent with the little pond that has turtles, ducks, and fish.  Food is great.  Chicken was a bit dry, pork was good, fish tacos were excellent as was the guacamole.  Service is slow. We waited quite awhile for the check and even longer for her to pick it back up to run the credit card. There was a 25 minute wait to get in on a Sunday at lunch time, which was fine. Just the wait time at the end was a bit annoying.
Great margaritas and authentic Mexican Food. Not sure if he is there all the time but they have a guitarists playing Mexican favorites.  Pretty sure he's tired of playing 'La Bamba' FYI.

El Encanto has the prettiest, most picturesque patio!  It is so lovely.  Problem is we didn't get to sit on it unless we wanted to wait for quite sometime.  Everyone in our party was hungry so we opted to eat inside.  It's a large restaurant but inside had very little ambience, not even music playing!  I would like to return and the next time I will wait to sit on the patio.  Food was very good but there are similar Mexican finds closer to us in the valley.  Wouldn't drive up here just for the food, but a nice stop when in the area.  The Mole Enchiladas and Pollo Fundido were favorites.
Standard Mexican fare...great place to bring out of town guest! Loved the beautiful outdoor dinning area around the water. Enchiladas and guacamole were very good and margarita were drinkable!

This is an interesting place to grab a meal. It is clearly designed as a tourist destination. The decor is over the top. There is a lot of outdoor seating, which is great. The place is deceptively large and quite busy.  We got a good seat right next to the pond outside. Our server was friendly and fairly attentive. We started with a pitcher of margaritas on the rocks. The margaritas had very good flavor.  The chips and salsa they bring out are good. The standard salsa had good flavor as did the spicy salsa. I would have liked more heat from the spicy, but it was good. I did not enjoy the green salsa at all. The chips were sturdy and crisp. We also ordered the Queso Guillermo for a starter. It had great flavor, but was saturated in butter. You will enjoy the flavor but will make you wonder about how much you are shortening your life.  For my meal I ordered the Plato de Mexicano. It consists of a cheese enchilada, beef taco and a red chile tamale. The taco was ok. It is good sized with ok flavor. The enchilada was ok. I would have liked a little more flavor though. The tamale was the best of the three. It was a good sized tamale and was quite tasty. The rice that comes with the meals is ok.  This is a cool place to bring people. That being said, it would not be my first choice for food if I was not entertaining people.
Really good stuff.  Good food, great service and a very cool spot. I will be back on my next visit to Phoenix!

The food was good. I ordered the fish taco perfect just what I wanted. I did come on a working lunch so no drinks for me. But my Romeos had beers. It was pretty busy. Waitstaff was nice. When are food came are plates were mixed up so some of my men weren't eating what they ordered but they were fine with it. Dessert time 3 of us ordered flan, chocolate chimis sopapillas. Everything was really good!

A great find in Cave Creek. The service was fast & very friendly. The food was excellent. Loved having 3 salsas with our chips. The decor was fun & festive. The outdoor seating area was pleasant. Worth the short drive from Scottsdale & fun to walk around after or before at the quirky shops in Cave Creek.

Adorable place.  The food isn't anything mind blowing but tasty.  Bar has about five beers on tap.  Drinks are average.  If it wouldn't be for the awesome atmosphere this place would be just another Mexican joint on the block.  Ask for the hotter salsa.  It's pretty good and definitely better then the normal one that they give you.

Prepare to wait for a table but it's well worth it. Huge menu and everything we've tried on there has been yummy. Drinks strong but good, salsa at the table generous and complimentary. Didn't like the guacamole but that may be a personal preference.

We had a wonderful lunch here today before going to butterfly wonderland. It was delicious! Ryan was our waiter; he was great! I had the chicken wrap with fries and my friend had the Quessadilla. They were both really really good! The sauce in the chicken wrap is something I definitely would love to have again!

Have been going here with my family for years and today's food was very bad. There must be new cooks. The older lady in the front was very rude and needs to understand the business she's in. I hate to encounter people like her. Makes the experience sour!!!!

We went to this place cause we looked at some reviews and people gave high remarks BUT we were disappointed. The enterance showed promise, but the inside let us down. We sat at a table inside that over looked the pond with the ducks and turtles but there were 5 flys on our window alone. And we sat right next to a fly light. I ordered the quesadilla and added chicken and it was soaking wet with juice from the chicken. The tortilla fell apart because of it be so soaked. We had ordered the app quac but it came with the meal and tasted more like avacado paste than quac. Had high hopes but was let down.

I can't believe it took me this long to come eat at El Encanto! I've heard about the cool patio and pond but really didn't understand it until we finally stopped off here for Cinco. Glad we did!  When you first walk in from Cave Creek rd side you are met with a large outdoor pond and see tables next to it. It really reminded me of the River Walk in San Antonio. Really cool and probably the best reason to come here. The atmosphere is really great. Plus we had awesome weather which made the experience even better. The wait was about 20 mins so we grabbed a drink from the outside bar. The pond and weather really made the time to by and before we knew it they had a table ready for us. Too bad they didn't have a table near the water but we still could see if from inside.   I ended up ordering the mole chicken enchilada. I'm a big fan of mole and it is very hard to get right. I'm often hesitant on ordering mole at a restaurant that I've never been too but I was glad I did here. Easily one of the best mole and I wish I would have ordered the large size! Chips and sala were good and had good service too. Ill be visiting El Encanto again!

Teenage daughter and I went on our way to a Seven Springs adventure. I'll say the food was decent if extremely pedestrian. When the waiter explained the salsa...one is mild, then medium then "hot" daughter and I live in downtown phx...this was nowhere near hot.  Aside from no spice it was a lovely lunch.  Good service, quick although it was busy...but I think I might have accidentally found a good wedding venue....

Food - for me it's a no.  If i were to review the space itself I would give it a five star but the only reason I would return would be for a special occasion invite.  The pond was cool, spent time looking for the turtle so that was a fun distraction from the tasteless food.  The young man who served us was sweet and tried his hardest - training for wait staff needs to improve, it was not his fault he did not know some menu stuff and basic serving skills like bring more chips and salsa for a big crowd! Overall I can see why people like El Encanto but I am a food snob so at the very least food has to be edible and I found the food not so much so.  I left feeling hungry and went on a search for desert to fill the empty spaces.

Free salsa and chips to start/ with three delicious salsas. Allison was our server. Husband ordered the carne asada funditio with beans and rice. Had the same lunch portion.  Allison is a fantastic server.  Was so hungry forgot to take a picture.  Cave Creek is a fun place to visit so it is nice to have a go to place to eat

If you've ever had good Mexican food then you DO NOT want to eat here. The food was mediocre at best. The only reason for the 2 stars is the service. The host and wait staff were very pleasant, but other than that the food was terrible. You are better off crossing the street to Smokehouse. We had dinner there the next day and it was fantastic. Skip this place and cross the street.

I don't know why some had a poor experience.  My experience was exceptional. I had pollo fonduti and my sister had the chicken chili relleno and we both loved our entree. The chips and salsa sampler was a nice surprised and the chips were thin and crispy.  My margarita was good but lacked a kick.  The waiter was very knowledgeable and friendly.  It was a sunny day and we sat on the patio which made it a great mid day lunch.  I am from the east coast and this place will be a regular for me whenever I am in the area.

We went into El Encanto for a late lunch.  The place was clean but service was slow.  We ordered pollo fundido.  The meal was not edible.  I was not sure if it was the sour cream sauce or not.  I would not go back.

Good chips and salsa and great margaritas. I had the corn tamales and they were like luke-warm. The tamale itself was sweet. I assume that's how it is supposed to be, but I didn't care for the sweetness. I wasn't overly impressed with this place and probably won't come back. Our waiter was very friendly.

Very happy we stopped off and tried this place. Not sure why more people rate it higher.  Starts off with three homemade salsa's and chips.  Salsa's are great.  The guacamole is just a great as salsa.   One meal was Pollo Fundido which is a chicken burrito deep fried with a homemade jalapeo and sour cream cheese sauce. Wow was it good. The chicken had a really good flavor and large portions.  Retried beans have to be made with lard because they are fabulous.   Second meal was Cheese enchiladas meal. The green sauce stood out more than the red sauce even though both were great. Beans and rice was had great flavor and compliment he combo.   Over all great food and will come back over and over. Try for yourself. Won't be disappointed.

Expecting mediocre  gringo food, imagine our surprise when the food that came was very good. Enjoyed the black beans for a change and the fish tacos were very good.  My margaritas, (raspberry) came with plenty of tequila in them. The ambience was lovely. We sat outside next to a pond with ducks. As the sun encroached upon us, (It was in the 90's) the manager could be seen raising the big umbrellas. Between the shade and the pond it was cool enough to enjoy the food. The wait staff and bus staff and manager were very amiable. The prices seemed reasonable, with my Delicious drinks at 8.50$ and my entre at 14.00 or there about. My companion, who's standards are very high especially with Mexican food, thought his  beef taco's were superb! His mother was from Mexico and he said they were like what she served.   I would say if you find yourself in CAREFREE, find your way to the EL ENCANTO!

This restaurant is unique! Pretty pond with ducks and turtles. The salsa is the best I have ever had. A trio of 3 unique homemade kinds; mild, hot and tomitilo. The chips are thin and crispy. We got the sampler plate for 17 and was enough for 3. The kids meals are $5 including a drink.

I've been coming to El Encanto for 20 years. It's a beautiful place with pretty good food. I've always expected to wait, but on my first time back in years with family from out of town we waited 90 minutes to sit while others have come and gone.   We tried calling in to make reservations but were told they weren't taking reservations. Upon arriving and putting our name down we were asked why we hadn't called in a reservation. After explaining the situation we were told it would be 30 minutes. Not a bad wait but 90 is uncalled for.   It's sad to see service suffer so badly but I have to say this will be my last trip here. Not worth the drive, not worth waiting this long.

Great food, great service, I love the atmosphere especially sitting outside where you are up close and personal to the wildlife. The food is delicious, although it doesn't seem super authentic it is a great place to grab a bite with the family. Love this place and will continue to go!

Hmmm.... I gotta say I had high hopes and this wasn't good... I have complaints on the drinks... sub par... really sub par... let's not even mention the salsa, yikes tasted like cold spaghetti sauce. Not authenticity.... sorry just being honest.

Love the ambiance of this place!! That's what first attracted us.   The food and service are good too.  I had the carnitas & a cheese enchilada and we got guacamole for the table. All of it was delicious! The carnitas were Lea for carnitas and bursting with flavor. My 1yr old son loved the guac, so did the rest of the table. :) The 3 salsas (verde w avo medium, traditional tomato mild, chipotle spicy) & chips they bring to the table to start are a very nice touch. Most Mexican restaurants only bring 1 salsa. All 3 of them were very flavorful.   The service was also great...starting with a busboy who explained the differences between the 3 salsas and continuing with our attentive server.   Great spot and would love to come back.

Was there for the first time today, and the last time I will be there. The food was not very good and the meal was overpriced for what we got. I had the fajitas and my wife had the quesadilla with vegetables. Tasteless and just not very good at all.

Sometimes there can be a wait, but the food is usually tasty. Chips and salsa with three yummy salsas to choose from are a highlight. Service is usually good- every once in awhile it is slow though. Prickly pear margaritas are a must if you like sweet drinks. Duck pond great for kids ( and me if you're an animal person!).

This place was a super fun stop for lunch while we were exploring Cave Creek!  My girlfriends that live in Buckeye had been here before, and wanted to take me and our other girlfriend while we were out visiting, and I'm soo happy they did!  What a cool, unique little spot!  The perfect place for lunch and margaritas on a hot Arizona afternoon!    This is a huge restaurant, and when you walk in they have a nice little area with palm trees and a walkway that leads you to the main restaurant and their duck/turtle pond!  Its inside this little courtyard, and the seating is all around this neat pond area.  There were lots of mallards around, and also at least two different species of turtles sunning on rocks and swimming in the water!  Also they had a little station where you could buy feed for the animals, just put in a quarter and you get pellets to feed them!  When we did this, we saw there were also huge koi fish living in the water as well!  Very beautiful and large fish, really cool to see!    Anyway, about the restaurant...we asked to sit at a table by the water, so we waited a bit, but decided to go to the bar and get margaritas...they were REALLY good!  My margarita was definitely top notch, and it was perfect to chill in this nice little room by the bar while we waited for our table.  Once our table was ready, we got chips and salsa, which were also very good...I really liked their salsa especially, it tasted like it might have been homemade?  I ordered their Plato Burro, fried, with chicken, and it was good.  Came with rice and beans, and did have a lot of chicken in it which was nice.  Typical Mexican food, but good!  Our server was also very sweet and friendly, and was quick with drinks and food as well!   El Encanto definitely excels in atmosphere and the feel of the place is very special...my girlfriends and I had a wonderful time, with good food and drinks, and would definitely go back next time we are in the area!

We had dinner here last night and the wait was 45 minutes for a table.  We went to the bar to wait and a nice couple was just finishing and gave us there table upon leaving - score!   El Encanto's dirty little secret is their frozen margaritas.  Nick was our waiter and the bartender, said the machine was malfunctioning but would do his best to get us our drinks.  Well, drinks magically appeared and they were delicious as usual.  Dinner was exceptional, I had the Fajitas and my boyfriend had the Carne Asada Relleno. Wow, both dishes, the steak was cooked to perfection and so tender, you barely had to chew and cutting it was like butter. I want to give a shout out to Nick - even though he was busy both behind the bar and waiting on tables, he was very attentive each and every time he walked by the table, he asked if we needed anything and made sure that we were ok. It was a very nice experience overall.

Even though true Mexican dishes are terrific, sadly so many Mexican restaurants serve gloppy, over-sauced dishes that this style has been termed "typical Mexican".  Well this restaurant would fit the "typical" bill. The fish tacos were fair at best, with none of that really fresh fish taste you get at some places, and the "Camarones Autnentico" were small to medium shrimp swimming in a not so flavorful sauce. Other dishes were all Mexican mediocre chain quality.  The Sopapillas for dessert were neither fluffy nor tender.  Service was very good, atmosphere nice with a small pond in the middle, and their salsa and chips excellent. It may be a good stop for a few beers and chips, but other than that not worth a visit.

Delightful atmosphere! We came at 1pm on a Sunday and had a 30 minute wait. We were able to get a pitcher of margaritas at the bar and some chips. The margaritas were good - well balanced enough in that they didn't taste like liquor but you could feel them. The chips are thin, crunchy and fresh. We were seated at a table by the pond and could watch the turtles, ducks, and koi. It was cool but there were plenty of heaters. We had the tamales. They are actually the best I've had in a restaurant (my sister in law makes the best ever so I'm biased). They were moist - the masa was very flavorful and good texture. The service was good in the dining and bar. Will be back!

The salsa was awful.  Three different types, none were at all spicy and one tasted like marinara sauce.  The cheese enchiladas were extremely bland.  The waiter also told us that the kitchen wasn't willing to make any substitutions on the tamale/taco/enchilada entree.  The prices were average, but a bit high considering the mediocrity of the food. The one plus is that the building is beautiful.
Good service, pleasant atmosphere, and a good menu. It is typical Mexican/US fare, but that is what you expect.

Stop in for breakfast , the place is beautiful . But skip this place for breakfast. Waiter told us they had no fresh eggs and refused to make a Bloody Mary with Clamato even they the had all the ingredients . However pushed the pre-made Bloody Mary cocktail.

This Mexican Food restaurant has this cool pond with ducks and turtles. The food is da bomb! The servers are excellent. Mikey T. the "chip" guy and Robert our server treated us great.  The margaritas are super delicious. Love the ambience. Can't go wrong having dinner here. Come on down and share a pitcher of fab margaritas.

Wanted to try a new restaurant.   We drove to Cave Creek for some really good Mexican food.  Margaritas were delicious too.   I had a burrito with shredded beef rice and beans.  Great flavors throughout.   My wife had shrimp tacos and said they were outstanding!   My other traveling companion said, that those are the best tacos she has ever had, which is a big deal because she is doesn't get too excited about food very often.    I was drinking Don Julio 1942 and asked for another one.  Why did my waitress feel she had to remind me of the cost!!   I know what the hell I drink!!  that was the only negative thing that occurred.  The ducks  and turtles  on the pond made the experience worth the snide remark!!

The chicken fundido is excellent.  The margeuritas are delicious.  I'm not sure that I like the duck & turtle pond...it seems a little gross.  There are lots of birds on the patio so we always eat inside .
Good times, good friends, sweet margaritas.  A long drive through the desert for mexican food, but worth it.

What an enjoyable experience. Love the ambiance and had a blast watching the turtles. Our waitress was friendly, knowledgeable, and accommodating. The salsa trio was fresh and vibrant. I had a shredded beef taco that was juicy and flavorful and the BEST cheese enchilada I've ever had (I've had a lot). Soooooooooooo good! I usually don't care about refried beans but I cleaned my plate! They were so smooth. My husband's food was good enough that I didn't even get a taste. This place is definitely worth a visit!

Went here with Tori on Sunday and we had a really good time. The restauraunt surrounds a duck pond and we are both big duck fans so we sat outside and the ambiance was great. This is the perfect spot for wedding or work parties. The patios are huge. The food was ok, we just split the chile verde and it was spicy and the pork was really tender. We also had sangria and although a bit sweet for my tastes it was still pretty good.
Great restaurant,  a must for all our visitors.   I love the prickly pear margaritas...beautiful outdoor seating and the service and food is always good

Whether you are looking for great Mexican food or a retreat away from the Phoenix metro area this is an ecellent place to go.  The entrance with the decorated walkway and pond stocked with coy fish and ducks makes you feel like you are walking into a "real" mexican restaurant that is in Mexico.  On the inside make sure to get a table that overlooks the pond and enjoy the atmosphere as you enjoy the authenic food that they serve.  This place is a must see when visiting Cave Creek.

Really nice to sit outside with a pond, birds and turtles. this place has been around for awhile and if your going to Cave Creek, check it out.  Food is good. Great frozen margaritas. Chips with three types of sauce. They have lunch specials. Check it out.
Best local Mexican cuisine in North Valley! So delicious and happy hours on the patio beside the duck/turtle pond are the greatest! Love the chips & trio of salsas

The last time I went here there were several empty tables and the hostess said we would be waiting 45 minutes... needless to say we didn't, and left to eat elsewhere. The few times before my boyfriend and I had food here it was close to decent, not quite there. The prices are too high for the quality. Service was always slow and uninspired. The menu seems bigger than what you can pick from. There are better "Mexican" restaurants in Cave Creek that don't overcharge because they think the place looks nice. The duck pond is what you would expect, I can go to a zoo and see the same thing and probably eat better food as well. No offense, but this place could use a new menu/better staff. I have a feeling locals like us that live here avoid this place, and most of the people dining in are out of town snow birds. Too bad they don't know any better. Parking is also a pain, it's a like a tiny horseshoe with the restaurant in the middle, and the entrance is at the front near the road.

I RARELY give five stars to a restaurant-but this place earned their stars with their service, drinks, food, and atmosphere! I had their famous (or if you're not careful, infamous!) frozen margarita. I don't typically enjoy frozen margs, but these are on a different level. The texture isn't typical-it's more slurpee than icee-smooth, light, and almost creamy! The flavor was a perfect balance between tequila and mix.  The chips and salsa were delicious. My entree was OUTSTANDING! I had the carne asada relleno. The meat was cooked a perfect medium rare, the seasoning was flavorful. We couldn't understanding why they only had 3.5 stars because our experience was way better than that.  Loved the soft guitar music and the duck pond inside the courtyard. During high season, GO EARLY or call for a reservation because the wait can get long. We sat at the bar and the service was friendly and attentive! We will definitely go back!

We have been coming to dine at El Encanto for over ten years, it has changed very little.  The food has been consistently above average from the first visit.  Chips are crispy, but they could be warm, the salsa (three varieties) are good, tho I think the lime green one needs some explaining, (what's in it?, again I forgot to ask).  I don't think the menu has changed at all since our first visit.  My favorite is the Pollo Asado con Salsa Autentica ranchero style with black beans and rice.  The cheese quesadilla and sample platter was ample and delicious.  Our drinks were checked and refilled promptly, and the margaritas were excellent.  The pond is full of turtles, and fewer ducks than I remember from my last visit, (they aren't on the menu) and the ducks and turtles will keep you entertained while waiting on your food and during your meal. The one inconsistency is the level of attention from the servers.  Our last visit was fine, our waitress was prompt and friendly, but prior visits did lack the prompt service and drink refills you would expect from a good restaurant, resulting in our request for a visit with the manager.   Prices are reasonable especially for the neighborhood.  I wouldn't hesitate to take out of town guests for unique atmosphere, indoor or outdoor seating and good food.  They can be busy on weekends and holidays, I would recommend calling ahead for reservations.

Had lunch here with my sister yesterday. Requested a table by the water. I had the seafood enchilada special and my sister had the fish tacos. We agreed both entrees were very good and the atmosphere was awesome. She loved the outdoor eating area and can't wait to go back. Our waiter Gabriel was wonderful. Bonus: the little booths set up next to the restaurant we browsed through on the way to the car. I really like this place! It makes me feel like I'm on vacation.

The food is consistently delicious. The service has always been friendly and professional. My concern this visit was cleanliness. The fan near us and the light fixture directly above our table need a good dusting. Makes me wonder what other Cleaning has been forgotten or blown off.

Went to El Encanto for Restaurant Week 2009.  Took an hour to drive there from my home in Avondale, but it was well worth the drive.    Driving into Cave Creek, was so fun.  Reminded me of Sedona or a cute, little western town.    Sat outside near the pond.  I highly recommend sitting outside.  Watching the ducks, especially the ones with the fro's on their heads, was so funny.    The food was really good, but the environment was the best part.  I recommend driving out to El Encanto, especially for date night or a big group dinner.    Be careful though, sometimes the ducks get too close and bite you!  My friend's butt was particularly delicious to them.  Ha, ha!

I love going to El Encanto - probably far more because of the ambiance and the fact that it is a sort of landmark in my hometown of Cave Creek. The food is solid, but not fantastic. I love the avocado salsa they bring out with chips. The pollo fundido is always good, if not a little dry at times. My kids love feeding the ducks, though, and are happy to go to El Encanto. The service is usually good. I would be sad if there was ever no more El Encanto.
LOVED everything about this restaurant!!!  Excellent guacamole, meals were robust and flavorful. Absolutely adorable venue. Excellent wait staff. We will be back!

Great Mexican food! Best for miles. Wicked cool indoor / outdoor atmosphere. Margaritas aren't my thing but the wife loves um. Haven't had anything I don't like but the burros are awesome, especially the chicken. Service is ok gets really really busy on the weekends.

Loved our first El Encanto visit!!!  You almost don't know they are at the new aquarium...seems like they do t let them advertise much?!?  Our server, Jaime, was amazing!!!  Knew the menu well, very friendly, knowledgeable, kid-friendly...which can be hard to find and overall just added great vibes to our dining experience.  Highly recommend this place.  My husband got the shrimp fajitas and I got the steak and chicken fajitas... Both were fantastic and their cream cheese jalapeo sauce was amazing as well. Can't wait to go back!

We love it here - the ambience is excellent.  I always order the same old thing the Fundidos.  It is totally yummy - cream cheese and crispy outside with moist chicken inside.  I'm in a rut but I'm good with it :)

I have visited a couple of times now, with various friends and everyone loves the place and the food.  Let's start with the place.... As my wife put it: "It feels like we are in San Diego" (somewhere she loves); the combination of the pond, turtles, ducks, geese, trees and birds convinces one that you are no longer in the middle of the desert, but have been transported to some oasis of green, water and cool..... A wonderful setting for a meal.  You can either sit outside around the pond and enjoy being surrounded by the trees and wildlife, or if you are a little less adventuresome, there are plenty of tables inside, some up against floor length glass at the edge of the pond, so it seems as though you are outside.  The food itself is fresh (the salad is always crisp & tasty), VERY well cooked and the service excellent. We have tried a wide selection of dishes between us and everyone has been pleasantly surprised with the quality of the dishes presented.  If you are unsure what to choose, I recommend going with the 'Daily Special', I have opted for this a couple of times and on both occasions it has been excellent.  It is also very reasonably priced - I thoroughly recommend El Encanto!

Low quality food .. Rarely make it right... Enchiladas can be cold and chicken tacos taste like chicken is old... If you ask for any thing extra like extra onions on an enchilada they will charge you $2 .. Ridiculous !! It's already overpriced !!

I am so stunned anyone thinks this place has even average food. It's awful! The salsa is boring.  The service crappy! It tasted like frozen TV dinners from the '70's.  No great Mexican or burger place in Cave Creek blows my mind!
Love this place...Best Mexican in the valley IMO. Makes for a beautiful and relaxing lunch destination. 5 stars for days!

Stopped in for lunch today.  I've wanted to try this place for a long time.  1 - Frozen margaritas were very good, even at $7 each. 2 - Chips and salsa were great. 3 - Service was very good. 4 - Atmosphere nice with view of pond and turtles. 4 - However, entree was awful.  My chicken (pollo fundido) was extremely salty. 5 - I won't be back. 6 - Do yourself a favor; stop for cocktails and move on.

This is a great place to bring out non-Arizona guests. If you have any kids in your group they can feed the ducks and turtles. Usually there is a wait, but the huge patio makes for a nice place to relax and have an adult beverage, especially when it's hot outside.  Food consists of your typical Mexican entrees all with rice and beans. It's a couple of bucks higher than your a chain Mexican restaurant, but worth it for the location and atmosphere.  Recently, I was there on at Saturday night and was told the wait was 1.5 hrs, but before we finished our first margarita (45min)we were seated at a nice window table.

I've been here only twice. Today would've brought the experience down to a 1 star, but the previous one being a 3 - I settled on a 2.   This place is huge and dripping with atmosphere. It's sprawling in fact and the patio wraps around a duck and swan pond... can be fun, but can also be annoying. Depends on how you feel about birds. Maybe it's romantic. Maybe it's disgusting. Personally, I find it to be a little bit of both.  The food is average. The salsa is very tasty, but not spicy enough. Today they were having a buffet style thing for the mad rush of mother's day. The place was empty though. There were a lot of wait staff - about one per table... on a buffet night even. With all these servers, we found it nearly impossible to get service.  We opted out of the buffet since it didn't seem cost effective (or appetizing, but we had driven so far we thought we should make the most of it), and sat at the bar forever waiting for one of the 5 servers to stop watching Castaway on TBS long enough to ask us what we wanted.    The margaritas were weak and not very cheap. The waiter was rude, but he brought us a refill during a commercial. I think it's simply too far to be worth it. If the food was above average and the service was good, this would be a fun time. The whole area is a very touristy spot. I'd suggest it as a place to take your parents when they come visit you.

I love the pollo fundido and the atmosphere is very relaxing!I enjoy sitting and being able to watch the ducks while I'm eating ntt food it is definitely a place to check out any time you come to Cave Creek

This is a surprisingly wonderful place to host a small reception or gathering (40pple or less). Recently went to a wedding reception here and it was beautiful! The food was good as well. Great chimis and fajitas. The chips were a little on the stale side and the house marg wasnt the best (pay more to get a better marg) but overall nice place.

My family stopped here on a Friday afternoon during our vacation. It wasn't busy at all so our experience was a quiet one.  The atmosphere was beautiful inside and out!  If it hadn't been for the fact that it reached record high temps that day, we would've eaten outside. We were able to sit at a table right next to the pond and it was really fun to watch the ducks and turtles swim.  We were greeted and seated immediately, and our waiter was very attentive. My hubby and I both had the Pollo Fundido and is was soooo good!  The quality of the chicken was excellent! It was also a fun little town to walk around after lunch. Next time we are in AZ we will be back!

I am normally a very positive person, and am hardly critical of dining establishments, food and service because I KNOW how difficult this industry can be....but last night's experience in this restaurant left such a bad taste in my mouth, that I really feel the need to share our experience with you. My husband and I are from Calgary, and we heard amazing reviews from Calgarians about this restaurant, so on our last night in Phoenix, we made the drive to Scottsdale for dinner. My husband made the reservation for 7 pm, and the person on the other end gave us driving instructions to get to the restaurant. We arrived at exactly our reso time, and were seated immediately. After we placed our drink and food order, a gentlemen (very young and quite immature) decided to stop at our table and lecture us about booking a reservation for 7 pm. He told us that their kitchen closes at 6 pm, so we "should know better for next time to not book so late in the evening." We were told "it's okay for THIS time, but please don't let it happen again." We felt like the biggest inconveniences to these people. Our dinner arrived, and my husband is a quick eater, whereas I am not.  I had at least 3/4 of my meal left on my plate, when the young gentlemen returned to our table and took my husband's plate away and put the bill on the table. I have never in my life been treated like this in a dining establishment. It was so very, very rude. I told our server to pack up my meal because "clearly, we were inconveniencing them when they wanted to close up so badly." Of course, he responded with "Oh no, please stay. You are no trouble at all!" But I told him again to pack up my food and we would leave. When we got up to leave, these two young men were hanging out at a table, playing away on their phones. The young, immature gentlemen stood up and started to say "Thank you. Thank you for coming in. Have a good --- " but by that time, I expressed with my middle finger exactly what he could do with the rest of his sentence. He got my point, and stopped talking. I have worked in this industry, so I am not a pretentious snob who knows nothing about late-arriving guests when a kitchen is trying to close. If booking a 7 pm reservation was such an issue for these two boys, then they should have simply told us over the phone, and we would have happily booked elsewhere. As for the food, I have had better. It was not terribly awful, but definitely dry and lacked flavour. I ordered a pork carnitas with a cilantro sauce (no cilantro sauce on plate, which was disappointing). Husband can't even recall what he even ate...so that says how unremarkable the food is.  Overall, horrible service. Will not bother with this place again.

This restaurant is magnifico! The service is extraordinary, the wait staff is cheerful and approaches the tables regularly in a timely manner.  The prickly pear margarita is to die for! Just awesome. Do try the carne Asada relleno , Superb! Try to save room for dessert!

What a wonderfully delicious place! Great atmosphere, friendly and attentive staff, and delicious food! It was such a great meal all around! WONDERFUL MARGS! My husband is picky with Mexican food and they even have burgers on the menu that were yummy! We also came on our honeymoon and they gave us a fried ice cream in celebration! So fun! HIGHLY recommend!

Great Mexican place in Cave Creek. Authentic atmosphere. Food is reasonably priced. The hostess on the other hand is not so nice! Don't ask for outside seating! She'll put you in your place for you being dare enough to ask! I was made to feel like I should be grateful for even getting a seat inside!!!!
This place is fantastic! The restaurant itself is so fun to sit in, and the food is delicious! Go try it out!
We have no plan to visit this place once again. Really bad attitude.  Have of the place was empty but they still want you to wait for half an hour or more. You guys lost my continue business.

Great atmosphere.  The strawberry blended house margaritas is definitely worth trying.   The salsas were okay... The guacamole was really good.   We always try to stop here for at least one drink to watch the turtles and ducks.

This has GOT to be THE BEST MEXICAN RESTAURANT on the planet. Our waiter Sage was outstanding. Stuffed jalapenos were to die for not to mention their homemade Margaritas!!!  A must stop in Cave Creek.

El Encanto serves authentic Mexican food in dreamy atmosphere.  Great for a date night or special occasion w my kids.  They serve a mole that I compare all other moles to.  The margaritas are also top notch.  My kids like the duck, koi, and turtle filled pond.  I understand on Sat mornings they have a mariachi band.  Customer service has always been great here as well.  Highly recommended for a taste of Mexico.
The burrito shell is extra crispy today and the beans are crisp from being under heat lamp to long or something normally food not like this

Although we had to wait over a half-hour to be seated, (which we expected because it was a Friday) the service was fast, efficient, and excellent! I enjoyed the Pollo Fundido with the award winning house Margarita!  We sat outside near the heaters and it was absolutely beautiful!!  Definitely will be back soon!

We were pleasantly surprised by this restaurant. It is quaint and has a large outdoor patio as well as a large indoor space. We opted for the bar. Had a beer and a margarita (very nice). The complementary chips, fresh and warm, came with a salsa trio (mild tomato, medium avocado tomatillo and hot tomato) was very flavorful! The menu offerings are many and I chose the carne asada relleo, which was the best meal! A roasted pepper filled with cheesy goodness, topped with mashed potatoes and steak cooked to perfection.  My husband chose the carnitas burrito without any of the sauce on top, which he later regretted as the tortilla was dry. The atmosphere was hopping, the staff is very attentive and friendly. A must in downtown Cave Creek!

It was a rainy Sunday afternoon at 2:30pm and this place was packed.  I'm not sure why everyone was thinking Mexican and running late for lunch, but I was not alone.  I noticed they were quick to bring out propane heaters to the outside diners.  It is outside yet covered from the rain.    It was a quick 20 minute wait.  It probably would have been a shorter wait, yet a few outside tables were wet from the rain.  They have a beautiful inside seating area with big windows at each table.  Looks like you might drop right off into the pond.  Our waitress was quick to take our drink orders, another server was quick with chips and salsa.  They serve 1 green and 2 red salsas with the chips.  Some reviews I read complained about the charge for a second order of chips.  It is 99 cents.  No big deal.  It was so beautiful, I would be tempted to spend a lazy weekend afternoon with a few cervezas and order of chips.  The 99 cents is totally understandable.  We ordered shredded beef tacos, rolled tacos, an order  of guacamole, a quesadilla, and a bowl of soup.  Everything was wonderful.  Yes I've had better salsas, yet this was perfect for my day.  It was fresh and complimented the food.   I'll be back.  P.s.  We had a great view of the pond with ducks and turtles swimming by.  Bring quarters.  They have duck food in gumball machines.  No tacos for the ducks.  :)

Great place to have a romantic Mexican dinner. The seating by the pond/water is tranquil and something that you don't find anywhere else. The food is good, better than average. They are very generous with the chips and salsa here. Which is something that you don't find at a lot of places. I am one that likes to dip a chip in my meal and I don't like being told that "I am going to have to charge you for more chips". I love stopping here when I am in the neighborhood, great watering hole after a long ride on the bike.

I've been coming to this restaurant since the mid 90's. I am now in my 30's and still frequent on ocassion.  The last time we were here it was great. We came for lunch and were able to sit outside near the pond. The menu was as I remembered. Tonight was different. Sunday night about Tom and the wait was 45 minutes for first available. We found a seat at the bar and an hour later my husband went to check how much longer and he was told "hopefully" another twenty-five minutes. Just as we were about to order our buzzer went off. We were seated inside, in the back, against the wall and across from three empty tables next to the windows near the pond. It happened to be my birthday dinner and my husband asked to be moved to the tables near the window. The hostess responded with "you're more than welcome but you would need to go back up front and wait in line and I would need to seat this table immediately".....which is understandable because of the wait. But the way she said it was rude. As for the menu; it was different. I ordered my "usual": cheese enchiladas. It came with two sauces...not the standard red. When my husband ordered the carne asada Chile rellano he was asked "how he wanted it cooked". That's odd. I've never been asked how I wanted my carne asada cooked. "Medium rare?". The dish arrived with three pieces of "steak" and a poblano stuffed with mashed potatoes!!!!! I've never encountered this type of Mexican cuisine anywhere. And I thought I was quite knowledgeable concerning the cuisines of Mexico. It just wasn't what I expected or wanted for my birthday dinner.

Can't judge the food at this location. Not very busy when we showed up, they promptly sat us and we received chip and salsa within 5 minutes. Then nothing... waited another 15 minutes for a waiter to do just drink orders but to no avail. We left.

I've been eating at this restuarant since 5th grade. In case you are wondering this is way way over ten years now. I've watched it grow and change. The Mexican food is great, not the gourmet Santa Fe style, but true AZ style...a little greasy, a little sloppy, but oh so good.  Aside from the food you can't bea the atmospher. If possible sit outside by the duck pond. It's a real treat. If you have little ones bring some change and feed the ducks.  WARNING: Watch out if you sit at a table by an overgrown palm tree, my grandmother got pooped on by an owl once...no joke!
Great food and atmosphere.  The duck pond is a great feature.

Great Mexican food. Fresh and amazing guacamole..... I added my own salt to it. Chicken Tacos, Mahi MahiTacos, Salads, and just about everything has been great there. Great Margaritas also! Very scenic and Authentic fun at El Encanto. Love it here.
ALWAYS eat here when in Cave Creek and try to take out of state company here during their visit. Food is awesome, service is great and margaritas are amazing. Prices are fairly reasonable.
Love the ambiance! Great service! Carne Asad a tacos were delicious.   Lots of meat.  Our seats were overlooking the pond.  So relaxing! Will return.

I wish I would have taken a photo of my food before I sent it back to the kitchen. I ordered a $10 salad (I don't mind spending that much, but it should be a good salad). It was mostly iceberg lettuce that was starting to turn brown, and it was swimming (literally swimming) in black bean liquid. They must have just scooped black beans right on top of the salad without draining them first. Plus, the "tomato" that they put on it was one slice and it was partly white because it wasn't ripe yet (yuck). This salad was a joke.  My friend ordered l quesadilla. Now, I'm not sure how anyone can screw up a quesadilla, but they managed to. It is literally an open face tortilla with a bunch of greasy (fake looking) cheese on top. Where's the crispy tortilla?! Where are the toppings? The children at our table didn't even like it. Needless to say, I won't be heading back there again. I have one star because leaving none was not an option.

Good place, great atmosphere, with the turtle pond in the middle, very pleasant courtyard for eating. Ordered the lamb barbacoa, and it was tasty, particularly the sauce. Good, friendly service. Not mind-blowing amazing Mexican food, but solid, with good atmosphere. Good salsas.

Our first time eating here from so many people telling us how great the food was, we were not disappointed. It was amazing!!! One of the best chicken quesadillas ever! The atmosphere is awesome and the staff was friendly! We will be back for sure!

Easter Brunch - we were seated outside right away. Great patio yet interesting choice to have a pond and give up so much real estate.  Patio is great for pictures, kids and does provide some wildlife entertainment. Make your own margaritas with plenty of tequila options is a terrific bonus. The food was typical Mexican food - chips and salsa so-so. Three stars because I was looking for some spice and nothing jumped out.

Visitied on Easter after golfing on a semi-hot day. Excellent chips and salsa/hot sauce to try before dinner. Had the appetizer for two, pollo fundido, a red and green tamale and 2 taquitos. Very good and filling for the $$ spent, would recommend highly! Cadillac margaritas hit the spot on a hot day.

was a little hesitant with the low ratings i saw but i liked it.  the decor was great!  surprised with the pond and geese with the authentic mexican blankets and tile.  i ordered the meatball soup and liked them both.  the price was reasonable.  would go back.
excellent food and great atmosphere- parking can be an issue but once the 110 weather gets here it will be adequate.

OMG, please...this is not good Mexican food folks. Not even close...  This is the heat lamped, warmed over, greasy spoon Mexican food that you could find in any big city in America.  The patio and atmosphere by the pond with the birds is simply lovely, so this is a great place to come for some beers and Margaritas. But the food here does not taste fresh, is not generally tasty.  The quality standard for the people who live up here in Cave Creek is obviously very very low, but El Encanto is a really a place to bring your Aunt Sadie when she comes to town for a charming drink or two.  If you want EXCEPTIONAL food (with a boring atmosphere)  go down the street to "Los Mesquites Taqueria." This is real Mexican food, melt in your mouth homemade corn tortillas, homemade chips, from scratch salsas, and very good Carne Asada. You won't get to watch the little duckees float by, but at least the food is superb and authentic.  El Encanto Dos is just a smidge better than Uno, but that isn't saying much.   El Encanto is easily one of the most overrated pseudo Mexican restaurants in Phoenix...Blech. I have had better Mexican at Jack In The Box.

With a desire to get out of the 100+ degree heat, we headed up to Cave creek for a bit cooler weather, some chicken tacos and a couple brews.  El Encanto has a neat little pond in the middle of the restaurant, and pretty darn good food.  The service was great, draft beer was ice cold.  I wouldn't necessarily make the drive solely to eat here, but when in the area it is a very solid dining optoin.

Your service has sucked lately! You have a manager that doesn't know the menu! They tell me that a order for pickup is 30  minutes. I show up in ten minutes and it's setting getting cold. Your workers are rude. I've been coming to the cave Creek since forever! Been to the one carefree hwy for years. I have a business in fountain hills for 15 year's and I have to say I will not recommend this reasturant to anyone! You need to get it together or not whatever you can afford

My boyfriend and I found ourselves at this restaurant by chance. The atmosphere was lively and a very good guitarist played among the tables. The building is older, but interesting. I liked the layout, with the pond in middle and kids feeding the ducks. Service was friendly and average.  Based on recommendations found here, I ordered the pollo fundido and was not disappointed. It was very good.  After all of this, are you wondering why the two-star review? It comes down to one thing. SALSA. It's not hard to make a simple, pleasant salsa. One can be a self-declared talent-less cook and still manage to produce a palatable salsa. With my salsa-addicted boyfriend and our history of always polishing off the salsa and chips provided with the meal, we left our table with three salsas remaining.  One was a tomatillo salsa.  It was probably the best of the three,...after adding a substantial amount of salt to it. (We were told the secret ingredient of this was iceberg lettuce.)  The second salsa had a weird underlying flavor to it, almost like paprika. It was just funky. (The secret ingredient of this concoction was dried pepper, which probably explains the smokey flavor it had.)  The third salsa was more like a mushy tomato sauce. It would be best paired with mozzarella sticks.  (This salsa, the house salsa, was made with canned tomatoes and garlic. That's it. Seriously?)   For a Mexican restaurant that puts out good food, salsa of this poor quality is inexcusable and a little shocking.

Recently had lunch here and had the worst tostada of my entire life. We had grandkids with us and they were enchanted with the pond so the visit was enjoyable but don't come here for the food. It has slipped dramatically in the last 10 years.

I had heard about this place from multiple people but it's practically the other side of the world from us (over 40 miles), so it took awhile but we finally made the drive. It was very dark on the outside and we weren't exactly sure how to get to the main entrance at first, but we walked through the outdoor patio with heaters and found the hostess desk. Only waited a minute or so before we were seated. The place is a lot bigger than I realized. After adjusting the crooked table and sliding into the booth, I felt the back of my pants were damp. Obviously they had just wiped down the seat with a wet rag and didn't dry it off. Gross! What I also didn't like about where we were seated is that it was right under the air handler which was very noisy and then my allergies started acting up during dinner. There were 3 types of salsa: mild, medium, and hot (not hot). I liked the mild & "hot" together. The medium salsa was green and tasted like lawn clippings. I appreciated that our server pointed out a few items on the menu since I was looking for regular chicken enchiladas. I got the Enchiladas de Queso with chicken (1 red, 1 green) and no onion. When our food came out, I found that the enchilada sauce was just room temperature, not hot. The rice had peas and carrots which I have never seen in Mexican rice before. The meal tasted pretty good but it wasn't cheap and I really don't think I can justify driving that far to eat here again.

Just had a wonderful meal at El Encanto the service and food was amazing. If your looking for a great quality meal at a good price it's right down your alley. The cheese dip was great and the Jalepeno rennos were amazing as was the Plato de carnitas. Come and have a great meal!

We were there in the winter (off season) a couple times and we had no problem with service. Loved it. I loved the thick, yummy baked cheese dip- too bad I can't remember what it's called. And the Pollo Fundido- yum! Can't beat the atmosphere; chill, beautiful, and... constant duck entertainment on the pond. My cousin brings her 3 year old to "the duck restaraunt" every time she visits. Love this place.

I can't believe on a Saturday with 20 empty tables you can't have a margarita with your fam just a stop in not welcome ... just full dining unless you want to sit in the dark bar no view or if your alone or with 1 other maybe the outside bar but not more than a few seats there :(  off to horny toad

Super delicious! I love El Encanto! I went with a friend on a busier night but we were able to quickly get a spot at the bar. Their margaritas are amazing, food was exceptional, and staff very friendly and attentive. This place has something for everyone. I got a shrimp dish with a cream sauce that was so good there was nothing left. Overall great place that accommodates everyone. Can't wait to go back!
One of our favorite stops in Cave Creek. Consistent excellent service, great portions and wonderful atmosphere!

Had dinner here last night and was very impressed.  First the food: had the green chili beef burrito and was very impressed.  Next time looking forward to trying the chili relleno.  Next the service: very attentive staff, not only our waitress but the entire service team checked in on us throughout our meal.  Very courteous.  Finally, the atmosphere: this is a very unique setting with indoor seating, patio seating, and a pond the restaurant is built around where the kids can feed the ducks and swans.  Very well laid out and thoroughly enjoyable.  Can't wait to get back for more!

Maybe Texas Tex-mex spoiled me, but overall I am not impressed with Zona mexican food.  El Encanto isn't too bad though.  I've always left full and fairly satisfied with the flavors - and the chips and salsa.  Good chips and salsa get me every time!  The ambiance is unique but eating on the outdoor patio has it's downside.  Like birds?  I mean birds flying close to you, eating the food at the recently vacated table next to yours?  Not only were the ducks under the tables and being shooed away by the wait staff, but flocks of none too timid sparrows were cleaning the tables before the busboys got there.  Thoughts of bird droppings and disease did cross my mind.  My whole family was mildly freaked out by it.  Hopefully this was not a typical experience - it did occur only once in our several visits so I don't want to emphasize it too much.  Kids love the place.  Feeding the ducks, watching the turtles and fish, etc.  Great photo ops with the munchkins.  But, the next time I go, I will wait for a booth inside with a glass wall onto the pond.  And the good news is the bar looks dark and cozy.  So that waiting needn't be a drag.   Solid value based on the food and the setting.  I've been there multiple times and will go again!

Let me preface this by saying that I moved from Austin, TX last year. As such... mexican or tex-mex restaurants are not something I am used to. Hole in the walls run by moms and pops? Yes. PLEASE. Somehow those are just vastly BETTER.  That said, El Encanto is turning out some decent food. Not great. Not bad. Just decent. The mole is probably some of the best I have tasted (what IS that flavor to it that I have never had in mole before?). The enchiladas aren't spectacular but then again... they're enchiladas. I like 'em. Pollo Fundido? I guess I'm in the minority with that one as I barely touched it. The chicken wasn't the least bit tender and chowing down on poultry a few feet away from some ducks, swans and random birds wasn't exactly a rocking experience.  Having said that, the pond and its denizens does provide for some nice atmosphere. Go at night around dinner. In the summer it cools off enough and in the winter the patio is heated. Just make sure to guard the complimentary salsa and chips off hours or you will have some competition for them.  In my visits, service has always been A+ though.  My main gripe... the margaritas. People think these are good!? For the price I'm paying I at least expect to taste SOMETHING. I've ordered them enough times now to know they're consistently weak and mostly ice. Hell to the no. Never again.  All in all El Encanto is a good enough place to go when in Cave Creek and in need of some americanized Mexican food.

Usually a favorite place of ours, but not today. We went for breakfast about 10 am and we were the only ones in the place. Business ramps up about 11 am. The manager at the front desk was on the phone, so we had to wait for him to finish his conversation to be seated and he made sure we knew they were only serving breakfast.  My husband was looking forward to the hue so rancheros as he says they are the best he's had anywhere. I can't eat egg yolks (digestive issue) and every dish had eggs. I asked if egg whites could be substituted in anything and our waiter curtly said, "No" and perhaps we wanted to go across street to another restaurant where they offered more "American" breakfasts. We said that wasn't the point and could I just get some of their soup or just roasted veggies and tortilla and our waiter, Gabe, said again curtly, no we can't do that. You can only order how it is on the menu and soup can't be ordered till 11:00. What?! Never did the manager, who was mopping floor around us ever step in or ask why we were leaving or even make an attempt at customer service. Again, we were the ONLY people in the place. It will be a long time before we ever go back and it WONT BE FOR BREAKFAST.

We live the Carefree location and were so excited when we saw them so close to the house. The food and salsa is exactly the same - great!  I think the location is limiting their traffic as we were there on a Thursday night around 6pm and there was only one other table dining. But the Aquarium was also dead, so I assume until the location really gets more awareness and overall traffic, it will be that way. I just hope they can make it in this spot because we are big fans.  They don't have what we consider the "best" margaritas but they get the job done.

Been coming here for over 20 years and is by far one of my favorite Mexican restaurants.  I live in chandler and drive nearly an hour just to eat here and enjoy the scenery.  The chips and salsa are absolutely amazing and so is the food. Make sure you call ahead to try and reserve a table by the pond (inside by the Windows during the summer months).

For some reason EC Uno falls far short of EC Dos in terms of food quality. Dos must have a superior kitchen staff?  Anyway, food was dry and far less flavorful than the meals we regularly get at EC Dos. Only been here once, so it could have been a bad night in the kitchen. Regardless, the food was disappointing enough to warrant never returning.  We'll stick with EC Dos, where the food is consistently great and has never disappointed us.  P.S. Pond is nice, but duck poop smell isn't...
Place was raved about and I was completely let down.. the food was not good and cocktails were awful. My lovely waitress was awesome however but I will not spend another penny in that establishment..

Great food and great service are the two things that I really look for in giving five stars and this place has both of those qualities. I hadn't realized that the Odysea aquarium had a plaza area with gift shops and restaurants, so I was excited to see the different food options in the area. However, everyone in our group was really feeling Mexican so we stopped in here. What a great decision! One person in our party has a gluten allergy, so we were really surprised to see that many of their dishes could be made gluten free!   I had the pollo fundido and the jalapeo cream cheese sauce was amazing! I wish I could have some of that on hand at home because it was so good. The service was also awesome as well - I think our server was Jarrett, who was super nice and attentive to our table. For an unplanned visit, I'm really impressed and would highly recommend!

I went here last year when I was in AZ, I thought it was God's gift to Mexican food... I was a bit tipsy last year when I went there... I went again last week, it was "ehhhh". Don't get me wrong, still good, but not as wonderful as I remembered... not even close.   We had to wait an hour for a table, the waiter made us wait about 15 minutes (not kidding) for water and chips/salsa... Seriously, 15 minutes? You dumbass!   The desserts were super good though, that was the upside...

I met my friend here, we all drove from various locations and this place was worth the drive. Tequila was decent. Food was pretty good. Air conditioning was excellent and the view was just gorgeous. Felt like we were on vacation. The service was excellent!   We each even got separate checks without a complaint from the server. Restaurant is very interesting and has a very nice feel to it. I don't know if I would consider the food amazing but it was good enough. Did I mention the beautiful view?  Glass was so clean I felt like we were outside.

We are from the Bay Area and admitted taco/mexi snobs. This place blew our minds. The atmosphere in that lovely courtyard, the robust tequila menu, great service, amazing food. The menu had us trying stuff we don't usually order with no regrets!! Yum!!
Excellent food and excellent service!  Just a warning it gets crowded on weekends but they really have a good staff to handle the volume of people!!

The best part about dining at El Encanto is arriving early so you can have the patio to yourself, so to speak. I joined a friend of mine for lunch there today at 11:30 am and we were the only ones there. Jaime, our waitress was very sweet and took great care of us. Wait for our food and drinks were minimal and the entrees were delicious. I had the lunch size Pollo Fundido which is a melt in your mouth affair it is so delicious and instead of the side of rice I ordered some grilled vegetables which were perfect.   My friend had the beef fajitas and she loved it. The drinks in my opinion are bit pricey...yes $ 8.50 for a frozen raspberry margarita isn't exactly cheap and they are not generous with the serving of the glass size either...so before tip our bill was $ 47.99 - that's a lot of money to spend on two people for lunch. I'm not bitching cause the food was really delicious and the service was quite wonderful.
The food was subpar. The portions were extremely small for the price. We were very disappointed with the overall quality of the "Mexican food" I would not recommend this restaurant.

Gorgeous setting outside with the pond and high ceilings. Reminds me of La Fonda Hotel down in baja. Unfortunately, after being served one margarita each and both of us finishing them over the Pollo Fundidio while we waited for our friends to join us, we ordered two shots of tequila. 20 minutes later, after our friends had arrived, ordered, and received their drinks we still had no sweet agave in sight.   We proceed to inquire about our shots, and received a half-mumbled and incoherent excuse about not having more than one drink at a time on the table. He clearly had failed to notice that according to the law [ARS 4-244.23] it strictly prohibits SELLING more than 40oz of beer, one liter of wine, or 4 oz of hard liquor to one person at one time. Allowing someone to order a second beverage when they know that by the time it gets to the table the first will be consumed is standard practice, and we weren't ordering doubles, bothering any other customers, or behaving in any other offensive manner. Not to mention both of our glasses sat empty on the table for at least 15 minutes BEFORE he came back with his excuse.  The manager then came to "apologize" but didn't offer to cover an appetizer or a round of drinks, which is the general practice in the industry when an employee makes a mistake or insults a customer in some way.
