As a veteran of the restaurant biz myself I was embarrassed  both for the waitstaff and the management. It's a shame because it's such a beautiful place but I will definitely not return to spend $60 on greasy cheese, watered-down margaritas, and a rude staff.

we went to el encanto at the cave creek location for mothers day this year and last :) this year i pigged out (lst year surgery) food was very good and ranged from omlettes made for you as you ordered them, mahi-mahi, made to order waffles-yum!!   cheese enchilada's (just as good as their carefree location) fresh squeezed orange & apple juice/cider. service was really good as waitress mentioned that the orange juice that i ordered to her previously, you can get where the food was and i said i saw that-she didn't hesitate to ask me if she could still get me a glass and i replied yes please :) i was impressed with that as my food was hot and i didn't want to go back up to the line and wait. that's service for you!! the atmosphere also at this certain location has a huge pond with ducks, turtles and birds and is a delight to be there in the morning and have a nice buffett brunch with watching the scenery along with it. there's nice local shops across the street to visit in addition afterwards. support our local restaurants and shops!! sandy :)

Best Fajitas and fajita salad bowls we've had since we moved to Arizona. Both chicken and steak were perfectly cooked . Great Atmosphere and the place is huge! Service for a weekend evening was fast & friendly. Totally recommend it and will be eating there again.

We own a vacation home in Northern Scottsdale and decided to take a drive through Carefree and Cavecreek. Loving Mexican food we decided to try out El Encanto after reading the reviews here on yelp. I am someone that always goes to wash my hands after we place our order and in doing so I had to pass the kitchen. Big mistake and I really wish I didn't see what I saw. It was a mess!! The odor coming out of there was horrible and everything was so dirty. To even think my food that I'm going to put into my body was coming from that kitchen made me nauseous. So word of advice be seated and don't move. I'm giving it three stars because we did survive but we will not be back

We have gone here a dozen times or so and the food is the best Mexican food we have had...staff is friendly....the only I can say is not as put together/clean as I would like to see...but a very cool place.

Normal 20-30 min wait for a Saturday and the kitchen was another 30 mins out. We finally got sat right next to the lake which was really nice to sit by. The waitress wasn't too friendly, seemed like she would rather be anywhere else but work. She offered what the special was for the night which sounded good, so we had two orders. Everything came out quicker than 30 mins but when we got the check we were shocked. I really wished she would have informed us the special was an $18 plate!!!! Times two! It was delicious but we were looking forward to paying that much money on a meal!

Food is good and service was fine, but would've like a heads up when adding chicken to my child's small meal ended up costing as much as the meal.  Waitress claims she had no control over it but it would've been nice to have known!

Took our daughter and future son in law last Thursday night when they came to visit for a long weekend.  Food, beverages, wait staff were all amazing.  When we visit, we always start our vacation at El Canto.  Have never had a bad waiter or waitress ever.  Love the pond.  Highly recommend it.  You won't be disappointed.
Great experience for the whole family. Pollo Fundido was excellent. Also, the trio sala and chips were a great appetizer.

It is a wonderful destination around Phoenix to  enjoy! It offers a  beautiful setting and great food.  It has a pond with ducks and fish, a small.bridge.... Large open rooms,for special events and  indoor and outdoor seatings at the restaurant. On weekends they have a guitarist who plays mellow music... Charming!!!
I met some friends here. We had a delightful time and truly fabulous food. This is the first Mexican style restaurant that I have really enjoyed in AZ.

We have been to Cave Creek several times and we always drive by and think we should stop in there sometime. Today was the day. We had friends visiting from out of town and wanted to take a bike ride so we headed out to Cave Creek and stopped in for lunch. It was pretty busy and we did have a bit of a wait but we just hung out at the bar while we waited for a table. If there hadn't been such a large group of us I would have just stayed in the bar area. We ended up on the patio which was nice. My hubby and I shared the appetizer sampler platter which was plenty of food for us. I really liked the tamale verde and I think I would order that the next time we go. Everyone in our group liked their food. I would have given 5 stars but the service was super slow!!

I'm still with the four stars...and that's GOOD! Consistent.  I would give them FIVE if: * either fill my margarita glass to the tippy top or charge a little less than $6.50 OR add some tequila to it! At $6.50 a marg, (rocks) I'd hope for a little feeling of "ah, I've had a marg" but I don't get it and I'm something of a lightweight - especially at 106 degrees on the patio. (This marg is $5.50 on happy hour - I'd like to see it $5.00 all day, every day!)  Well, I guess that's my only beef! The service has been consistently conscientious, the food and portions reasonable and the patio is charming. That Queso Guillermo floats my boat (sinks my waistline though!) - it's the best plate of cheesy heaven - done just right.   I did ask on my recent check-in about the fact that they won't serve you a small pitcher of margs unless two people are sitting down. (Small pitcher = 3 drinks) They will however, serve you three margaritas consecutively. Per my server, it's some AZ law regarding how much alcohol can be in front of someone. (Think of the ball games - each person can only buy so many oz of beer etc.) And here, I always think of this as the "wild west." I guess you can only get wild one drink at a time...and that the whole isn't greater than the sum of the tequila shots.    Does that make sense? I wish they'd have served me one pitcher instead of five drinks ;) Oh, the math!  Note: just kidding...can't afford 5 margs LOL
Love the atmosphere, live guitarist, food great. We were there on a Friday night and had a 50 minute wait for a table. Suggest making a reservation, go early or on a weekday.

The food here is decent.  It is basically like any other Mexican restaraunt in Phoenix- like Ariba and what not.  Same menu, same items, etc .  Nothing special, but this place does have a duck pond which is a hit with the kids.  It's also HUGE.  Not sure if they ever fill the place, maybe for Cinco de Mayo?  I don't know.
I felt really uncomfortable when I walked in because the girls in the front desk were frustrated and had an attitude about other customers. The food and drinks were great.

This place is the best!!  We have been coming here for years for the delicious pollo fundido and beautiful pond but now I have to rave about management. When I came in to the restaurant I found a debit card on the ground. I turned it into the hostess hoping the owner will come back. The manager came by to thank me. Then to my surprise... he bought my lunch!  This place is the best!  Thank you so much!
One word! FUN!  Ok maybe a few more words. We drove from Surprise on recommendations from a friend. We will be using this destination to take friends. Will add more tomorrow ...... not enough time

Tried this place when on a trip to Odysea. We were promptly seated and called for cheese and vegetable enchiladas. The tortilla chips served when we were first seated accompanied with 3 sauces was very good. The entrees were ok, the rice served seemed refried over and over since it had become a bit crisp. The main issue was that there were only 3 filled tables and over 6 staff members but they were all over at the bar or the enterance and we had to wait over 10minutes just for the check.

This place has been my favorite Mexican restaurant for my entire life. The cute little duck pond and cozy lighting make it perfect for date nights. My favorite dish, by far, is the pollo fundido, however, the dish is a lot smaller than it used to be for the same price. We will definitely be returning the next time we are in Cave Creek.

We had some family in town and we decided to bring everyone here. We had to wait a little while but it was a weekend night so it was expected. We grabbed some drinks in the bar and chips and salsa, we were happy campers.  Chips and salsa were both good. Nothing EXTRAORDINARY but the salsa was very good.  We sat outside by the big pond and it was nice out, even in the summer. I ordered the Pollo Fundido and it was very good as well. I'm not going to say if it was the best or not since everyone has different preferences, but it was very very good and worth ordering. I would say it is more on the sweeter side (must've been the cream cheese) than most fundidos.  Service was very good and attentive, kitchen speed was fine. Great food at a great place. We will be back!

Hostess with dark short hair was really rude. On the phone was snappy on simple questions on seating.. other location was full. I'm a waitress so I definently respect people working in restaurants and was not rude in any way. We came in to ask for a table for 5, got a wait time (totally ok) and gave her my name. I gave the name "Enrique", (Spanish name-Spanish restaurant lol?),and she asked for an easier name with a dead expression. Are you serious. Enrique is not a hard name. If anything it was a tad racist. Fix that. Other than that pond looks nice. Food is delicious. Sorry el Encanto, love your restaurant since childhood but customer service should be such a priority... little things like this can ruin a whole experience
My first dissapointing meal there,whats going on never seen it so empty,must have new chef.

Margaritas were good. Everything else disappointing. Mahi-mahi taco (chef selection) tasted fishy and steak fajitas were charred. Server seemed very dis-interested.  Atmosphere was nice though.  Must be doing something right though because it was very crowded on a Tuesday night.

Great food, fun environment and very friendly/helpful staff.  They have both outdoor & indoor seating, outdoors has plenty of heating lamps to keep you comfortable on a cool evening.  Prices are fantastic for the amount & quality of the food you get.  Will become a regular!

Great food and nice people to do businesses with. We drive a long way to get there and it is worth it!  Be sure you sit so you can watch the ducks in the pond in the middle of the restaurant, they are the great entertainment!

Hubby and I visited here recently and even on a rainy day the place was BUSY! I hadn't been here for years but wanted to see if things had changed. We sat at a table close to the water, service was very good and food was also good. Cave creek and carefree have a few more restaurants but still have that small town feeling. We would definitely return!

First time coming here and it was very good. The atmosphere is really cool. I had the chili relleno carne asada and it was delicious. My husband has fish tacos and they were also really good. Definitely will come back.
Came here for the first time last weekend and is now one of my favorite Mexican restaurants!! I'm actually on my way back for more this weekend!!! Love the scenery!

just had lunch here today and boy this is a sad excuse for Mexican restaurant.  in fact it really fails on both fronts..no real mexican flavors and the service is earnest at times but overall weak..big green pond big deal, who cares!! It is an old and tired spot that does have really good chips and salsa..it's a long way to drive for way average food and bad service
AMAZING! love the salsa, love the food, love the margaritas!
Hands down the best Mexican food in Arizona. I come here often with my wife and kids. The Sunday breakfast buffet is my favorite plus the kids love to feed the fish and ducks in the pond

My Cadillac frozen margarita was outstanding! Too bad the free chips they give you ruin the whole experience. Tasteless chips with awful sauces. One of the three sauces that was given to us tasted like fish. Definitely not something we appreciated. I'd rather pay 1 or 2 dollars more for quality. Take my advice: you either do drinks only, or you pay for an appetizer. Don't do the free chips!!

Got seated on the patio because there was any empty tables. I saw at least one table, but the patio was fine even if it was a little windy to be out there. We were the only ones sitting on the patio so we were seen three times by our server. The food was mediocre for the price even on lunch specials. The beans were over salted and tasted so unauthentic. My daughter wouldn't even eat her taquitos. I took a bite and understood why. So bland and dry.

Food is ok but the service is welcoming and friendly. The reason for 3 stars is that the bartender had a heavy hand with the margaritas. This is the only place I have tried next to the aquarium so I can't tell you to pass or not. It will fill you up but it's nothing you will crave again.

Food is more 3 star, but the atmosphere and service knocks this baby up to a 4 star! El Encanto is a beautiful restaurant. Not only is it massive, but the outside patio is awesome. Just perfect for our Arizona winter nights. The man-made lake in the back is so pretty and adds a nice ambience to the meal. Supposedly there are ducks and/or swans in the lake, but I didn't see any. You definitely need to make reservations if it is the weekend, seemed like everyone in Cave Creek was out when I went! There is a huge parking lot in the back and it was filled to brim at 7PM on Friday.   I had the Mexicano Combo (taco, enchilada, and tamale). The taco and enchilada were good, tamale was okay, I should have asked for green sauce! Their chips are quite tasty and the spicy and tomatillo salsa were my favorite. Margarita was solid, I felt it after 1.5 (might be a little sweet for some of you though). The boy had a scotch and it was quite a heavy pour indeed. Service was all around A+. Our waiter was super attentive and friendly, as was the food runner, and hostesses. Overall, not a bad joint. I will gladly take the ride out there when the boy's family wants to go!
Great environment and even better food and even better service. Best Mexican restaurant in the entire area. Must see and must eat place, we could eat here every night.
Love El Encanto. A year ago I would have only given it 3 stars for the poor service but they have improved lately. Like the pond. The food is always good.

Get the Pollo Fundido. Oh my god. Get the Pollo Fundido. I got the sampler appetizer because I couldn't decide. While all of it was delicious, the creamy sauce on the Pollo Fundido makes me want to come back for every meal.
Long wait but Worth it. Beef fajitas & fish tacos were delish, margaritas were good and service was great, Nice place, will return!

We are local to Phoenix and have been going to El Encanto and El Encanto II for years, though in the last few years we have stopped going as frequently because the service isn't what it used to be and El Encanto II tends to have hoards of unruly children running amok in the restaurant and on the patio. They may be somebody's little darlings, but they aren't ours and the restaurant should take care to make sure all paying customers have a pleasant dining experience. We've literally had to ask to be re-seated because somebody else's dimpled darlings were running in circles around our table. The parent's, seated at the table next to ours, were aware and did nothing. After 30 minutes of the parents ignoring the behavior and the waitstaff looking helpless, we asked for a new table. Apparently parents with unruly children are welcome to bring their children in for a night of babysitting, because children running around the restaurant happens more often than not.  But.....that is not why I'm writing this one-star review. We took some out-of-town folks to El Encanto last night. The place was not as busy as I have seen. In fact there was nobody waiting to be seated when we left about 6:30 last night, so being busy isn't even an excuse. What happened is that they gave us somebody else's credit card. My husband, not realizing, used the card today before he realized it was not his. He called the restaurant and apparently the owner of the other card is not aware, because he has not called in.......at least that is the story we were told. As a result, we have had to cancel our one credit card and hope that the new one arrives before the holiday, as we have plans (or had plans anyway) to go out of town.  My husband spoke to the manager, who gave him a lighthearted "we're sorry for your inconvenience." My husband had to "suggest" to him that he take his name and number in event that the owner of the other credit card calls in. They are truly "real sorry for our inconvenience!" They have offered no assistance to make this right or fix their mistake. I'm sorry, but this is INEXCUSABLE! It is careless and lackadaisacal and very reflective of the decline in service we have seen over the years.

You'd think for $7 you'd get a detectable level of tequila in your margarita. And you'd think for $8 you'd at least get some rice or beans with your tacos. I think Austin has spoiled me, but we spent a lot of money for not very much in the end.

This place gets a 5 star rating for the atmosphere. The food is also good, but the atmosphere is phenominal and what really makes this restaurant stand out in my opinion.   This retaurant is a bit of a drive for me, but it is one of my go-to retaurants I bring guests from out of town to so that they can get a taste of the Southwest.
Love Ambiance and who I came with to celebrate our anniversary.  But expected more from the food.  Thank goodness the drinks don't lack alcohol :-)
Really cool Cave Creek spot.  Everything's pretty solid, but try the Queso Guierllmo (spelling?) with a side of deep fried shredded beef (called "mochamos").  Yeah, I said it.  Trust me.

Just because some random mexican place has a duck pond doesn't mean you should waste your time and money there.This place is way below average and I live in AZ but it's so gross and unsanitary at this resteraunt that I wouldn't waste your time and money here.

I love El Encanto. We recently took my grandma and my kid for lunch. If you haven't been you should check it out. There is a really cool outside patio area around a large duck/turtle pond which really is the focal feature of the place.   The chips and salsa are award winning and the lunch menu is great and really affordable. I had the mole enchiladas and my husband had the fish tacos. Both were excellent.

My boyfriend and I were taking a drive and ended up in cave creek. I looked up on yelp close restaurants and we were actually headed somewhere else when we passed by El Encanto. It looked like it had a great patio and so we turned around to give it a shot. Am I glad we did.   Yelp suggested we try their margaritas, warning that they were a bit pricy but worth it. We shared a small pitcher and it was worth every penny of the $18. I had the lunch carnitas burro and my boyfriend had the lunch chicken fundido. Both were delicious and huge--I can't imagine the dinner size. They also brought out three different salsas, and though we couldn't get enough of the green salsa, they were all differently delicious.   Devin was our server, and she was on top of it. She recommended our meals and made sure we had everything we wanted. Amazing service. And as the other reviews mention, the restaurant itself is gorgeous...with a great pond with ducks and turtles. We are definitely going back and bringing others!

We always try to bring out of town guests here for lunch. The drive to Cave Creek up Scottsdale Road out of Phoenix/Scottsdale is outstanding. You pass through the Boulders in Carefree and on into Cave Creek, which has a western feel. El Encanto is one of the coolest restaurants in the Metro Phoenix area as far as ambience.  ( See the Yelp photos! )  El Encantos' food is very good Mexican fare too. They have reeally cold beer on draft and Margaritas. This is a great place to bring folks of all ages.

We stopped in, in between attractions for something to eat and were pleasantly surprised! The hot salsa is amazing and the chips were thin and crispy. All 3 of us loved our food. We got the house margarita with grand mariner - we really enjoyed them, a little sweet but to be expected with a house margarita. Service was a smidge slow but he was very kind. Would return again if in the area!

Although we usually go to the Fountain Hills location, visiting the original location is always great!    Great Food, terrific service.  The best margaritas in Phoenix.  The favorite dish is El Pollo Fundito (if I spelled that correctly ;) )  Enjoy!
